loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Малохат Бойматова – женщина 47 лет. Замужем и мать 4-х детей. Она занимается продажей детской одежды на рынке «Фаровон» города Гафурова. Малохат закупает товар на оптовом рынке города Истаравшан. Она ездит за товаром 2 раза в месяц. Её муж мастер строительных работ. Он тоже зарабатывает неплохо, но по мере требования взрослых детей, ему не удаётся накапливать деньги. Малохат уже 3 года кредитуется у нас. Когда она начинала, у нее было маленькое количество товара. Но сейчас Малохат расширилась, и за свой последний кредит, она закупила партию детской обуви. Теперь у Малохат увеличился ассортимент.
texts.en:
Malohat B. is a 47-year old. She is a married mother of four. She sells children's clothing at the Farovon market of Gafurov. Twice a month she travels to Istaravshan to purchase goods at the wholesale market. Malohat's husband is a construction worker. His income isn't bad wither but since their children are growing up, they do not manage to save money. Malohat has been out client for three years. When she started off, she had few goods but since then she managed to expand her business. She used her last loan to purchase children's shoes. Now Malohat offers a better assortment of goods.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sales of children's clothing and shoes

loans.name: Gulam Rasool

texts.en: Gulam Rasool is the son of A. Q.. He lives in Bagrami Kabul Afghanistan. He is 39 and married with three children. He lives in a family of seven including his father and mother. He has lots of responsibilities for his family and he has to pay for all the expenses of the house, so he needs to work hard and earn more money to fulfill their needs. That is why, as a farmer, he works on his farm a lot and tries to have a cultivated land. He would like to purchase different kinds of seeds and some tools for farming, so he has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months. He is happy with this effective process.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and tools

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: Mrs. Nida B. is 39 years old and married to Rosito, a driver of their own multi-cab. The couple is blessed with three children and all of them are studying. Her husband has an average monthly income of 2,000 PHP. Nida manages their business. She displays items of bamboo furniture along the highway at their place, and she also delivers furniture in the neighboring municipality and cities during market days. She is happy with her almost decade-long membership with the Paglaum Coop. For now, she requires a loan of $1075 USD for additional capital for her business and for labor costs and materials.

loans.use: To buy bamboo and other materials for furniture making and to cover labor costs.

loans.name: Tuhtabibi

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


 Тухтабиби Турсунова 1969 года рождения, замужем имеет 3 детей . Образование среднее. Заниматься откормом скота несколько лет. Муж сидит дома  помогает ухаживать за скотом. 2 года назад обратилась в Микроинвест за кредитом от КИВА. Мавжуда также занимается переработкой молоко. Ей также помогает сын продавать и выбирать скот. Она дополнительно выходит на поле и делает прополку и другую фермерскую работу Аппона Аштского района. На полученный займ хочет купить корм для скота сена и жмых .
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. Tuhtabibi T. was born in 1969. She is married with 3 children. She is a high school graduate. For several years she has been doing cattle farming, and her husband, who is unemployed, helps her around. Two years ago she applied for a Kiva loan. Mavjuda also processes milk. Her son helps her select and sell cattle. In addition, she works in the fields, removing weeds and doing other farming of Asht's Appon. She would like to use the loan for buying fodder and hay.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase cattle

loans.name: Eunise

texts.en:
Eunise D. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 33 years old. Eunise is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Eunise owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products in the local community. Eunise has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Eunise joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eunise has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Eunise is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 12th loan taken out by Eunise from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory  and as working capital

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita L. is from the village of Bato, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Nenita is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Nenita owns and operates a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing new clothing to local community members. Nenita has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (about $83) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Nenita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Nenita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kobada 1 De (Kobada Nokabougou) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe KOBADA 1  sont  des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 59 ans, 6 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames dans le village de NOKABOUGOU,  commune de Tingolé,  sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles sont en  partenariat avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un appui financier pour exercer leurs activités hivernales. Leurs activités sont entre autres la culture du sorgho de l’arachide et du haricot. Elles sont à leur cinquième expérience avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés correctement.
Ce nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour acheter de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 20 hectares.
Une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue sur les marchés de Tingolé, Marka-Coungo et Fana, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the KOBADA 1 group are married women who are on average 59 years old and have an average of 6 children. The majority live in polygamous families in the village of NOKABOUGOU, in the commune of Tingolé, in the sub prefecture of FANA, in the second administrative region of Mali. They are in partnership with the Soro Yiriwaso micro finance institution with the goal of having financial support to practice their winter occupation. Among their activities is the cultivation of sorghum, peanuts, and beans. This their fifth experience with this institution and all of the previous loans have been correctly repaid. This new loan will be used to buy fertilizer, herbicide and small farm equipment, and to pay the hoeing and labor expenses to maintain 20 hectares. They will consume one part of their goods and the other part will be sold in the Tingolé, Marka-Coungo and Fana markets to a clientele made up of men and women. They count on making an average profit of 40,000 CFA francs after the campaign.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, herbicide, hoeing et small equipment.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Liala is 29 years of age. She is married to 40-year-old Rolento, who is a laborer, and they have three children whose ages range from two to six years old.

Five years ago, Laila had a loan from Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) and started her own business buying and selling salt to augment her husband's income. At the start, profit wasn't really enough to sustain her business and supply her family's needs. Nevertheless, Laila used her income wisely so she was able to repay her loan on time, so that she would be able to take out a bigger loan in order to grow her business. Her business has done so well that Laila has been able to use her profits to purchase a motorcycle for use in her business. She also has been able to start another business, hog fattening (pig raising), in order to augment her profit from her other business. With hog fattening, a pig can be raised in four months, and the selling price is double the price of the piglet.

With her business success, Laila wants to to take out a bigger loan from ASHI to expand her business and make it more stable in preparation for her children's education and future.

loans.use: To finance her business of buying and selling salt

loans.name: Djamshed

texts.en:
K. Djamshed runs a café cooking different kinds of meals. He is a 30-year-old man, married with four children. Being a very good and experienced cook, Djamshed has managed to make his business successful. The income from the business is used to improve the living conditions of his family. He also dreams of being able to educate his children in the institutes and universities.

Djamshed is planning to make major renovations to the café and to expand it to attract more new clients and keep the old ones. For this, he requests a loan of $2000 US. Djamshed thanks all for the support and promises to be precise in loan payments.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: Major renovations to a café

loans.name: Isabelo

texts.en:
Isabelo is 49 years old. He is a simple businessman residing in Cabisera 9-11 Ilagan, Isabela. He is married to Rusia and they are managing their farming business.  Aside from farming, Isabelo is also engaged in the retailing business of generic medicines which he started since 1981. He usually sells his products using his motorcycle as a service. He patiently roam to different villages to sell his products.  

Isabelo is requesting a loan amounting to PHP6, 000 for the growth of his business. He will use it as additional capital in purchasing more medicines to sell. He knows that his business will become more profitable if it will be supported by the KIVA lenders.  He hopes to maintain it and further expand as it is continuously sustained through the years.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: 5 Sisters Empowerment Group

texts.en:
5 Sisters Empowerment is a group of 5 borrowers led by Musu M., 45 years old, married with 4 children aged 22-32 years old. Their educational levels are 12th grade-university graduate. Musu also cares for 2 orphans. She and her family live in Banjour, a newly built community for poor people who can't afford to buy town lots, north of the capital, Monrovia, Liberia.

Musu's business is selling charcoal. She buys charcoal wholesale and sells it retail to residents of Banjour, north of the capital, Monrovia, Liberia.
She has been running this business for 10 years and hoping to establish a transportation business in the future.

Musu talks to her customers in a good manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. She needs this loan in order to purchase new goods. Musu dreams of improving the living standard of herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase new goods

loans.name: Junrey

texts.en:
Junrey B. is from the village of Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. He is 20 years old. Junrey is single. To make a living, he owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. Junrey's main source of income from this business comes from providing transportation services to local community members using his motor vehicle. Junrey has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Junrey joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Junrey is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand his transportastion service. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Junrey from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of his family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase parts materials needed to expand his transportation service

loans.name: Nou

texts.en: P. is an old woman and a widowed mother. She is a local rice farmer who has been working in this sector since her children were very young. P., 47, has given birth to eight children. One of her sons is employed as a vehicle repairer. P. is taking out her loan to purchase more spare vehicle parts for her son’s business.

loans.use: To purchase more spare vehicle parts

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa T. is from the village of Unidos. She is 65 years old. Narcisa is widowed and has 4 adult children. Narcisa has a general store from which she sells a variety of products to the local community. Narcisa has been in business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,500 Philippine pesos (about $32 US) a month for these activities.

In 1999, Narcisa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business.  Narcisa is requesting a loan of 10,000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital.  This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Narcisa from PMPC. Narcisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 pesos from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase inventory & as working capital

loans.name: Antony

texts.en: K. has been running a butcher shop for the last 15 years. He also does farming to supplement his income. He is married and has six children and he is the sole breadwinner for the family. His butcher shop is located within the kakamega market. He employs 1 person and his butcher shop serves clients within the market and its environs. He is requesting for a loan of KES. 40,000 to purchase more beef cattle. He describes himself as a visionary and hardworking person.

loans.use: to purchase beef cattle

loans.name: Vera Maria

texts.es:
Vera Maria M. A. tiene 51 años, vive en union libre, y no tiene hijos. Ella tiene una negocio de distribución  de ropa en Fila Naranja. El crédito lo quiere para comprar inventario para su negocio de distribución. Doña Vera compra meraderia en San Jose (perfume y ropa) y los clientes la llaman, hacen el pedido y ella la distribuye. Ella ha dedicado a este negocio hace 7 años. Este prestamo le ayudará porque sería facil ya poder distribuir estas ventas a personas fijas y asi obtiene una rapida ganancia. Es la primera vez doña Vera se financia con FUDECOSUR y no ha tenido otros creditos con Bancos formales. Ella desea que pueda tener un local pequeño en donde pueda atender los clientes y así tener mas ventas. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Vera Maria M. A. is 51 years old, has a live-in partner, and no children. She owns a clothing distribution business in Fila Naranja. She plans to use the loan funds to buy more stock for her business. Doña Vera buys her merchandise (perfume and clothing) in San Jose. Her clients place orders via phone and she then distributes the requested items to them. She has had this business for the past 7 years. This loan will enable her to distribute her products to her regular customers and thus get a rapid return on investment. It is the first time Doña Vera has sought funding from FUDECOSUR, furthermore she has never received a loan from a formal bank. She would like to some day have a small store where she could receive customers and thus increase her sales.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase stock for her clothing distribution business

loans.name: Tineimu

texts.en:
Tineimu P. is 21 and single with no children.  She owns a business venture, providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members.  Tineimu has 6 years of experience in this business.  Tineimu needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 260 talas or US $108 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Tineimu joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Tineimu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Tineimu P. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.87 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.87 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated. For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Presfely

texts.en: Presfely U. is from the village of Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old. Presfely is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Presfely makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Presfely has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Presfely joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Presfely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Presfely is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Presfely from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: María Blanca Rosa

texts.es: María Blanca Rosa C. D. G. D. 35 años D. edad, resiD. en el Municipio D. Sensuntepeque, ubicado en el departamento D. Cuscatlán. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como agricultor, y albañil, así mismo junto a sus dos hijos D. 7 y 5 años D. edad. María se dedica a la venta D. productos D. bellezas como cremas, maquillaje y perfumes D. catálogos, los cuales  venD. D. forma ambulante, ofreciéndoselo a sus vecinas y personas D. otros lugares del mismo municipio, todo con el fin D. poder mostrar sus producto a mayor cantidad D. personas y D. esta manera aumentar la posibilidad D. sus ventas. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. productos, así D. esta manera María podrá ofrecer más variedad, lo cual le permitirá tener mayor clientela. Para María el mejorar su negocio es D. suma importancia, ya que en gran manera es a través D. este como logran solventar muchos gastos del hogar, y como toda buena mujer D. hogar ella desea poder darles todo lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María Blanca Rosa C. D. G. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Sensuntepeque, located in the Department of Cuscatlán. She lives with her husband, who works as both a farmer and a mason, and their two children, ages 7 and 5. María offers beauty products such as crèmes, make-up, and perfumes through a catalog. She sells her products as a traveling merchant, presenting them to her neighbors and other people who live in different parts of town. María tries to hold demonstrations in front of as many people as possible in an attempt to increase her sales.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy more products, and as a result, offer a greater variety so that she can attract more customers. For María, improving her business is of great importance because this is the means by which she meets her household expenses. Like every good woman, she wants to proviD. the best for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Numfor

texts.en:
S. is the mother of two children. They all live in the Ntabessi Mezam Division. S. is always smiling and says “…smiling is my therapy to overcome some of my stress”. She has not gone without bruises from the cruel hands of poverty, including inadequate money to pay for her children's school fees, buy medication, provide good food to her children, and to give a dignifying burial to her dear ones who past away to eternity. This she says has made life miserable some of the times but that in her trials she has learned how to smile.

Motivated by others in the program, she joined GHAPE in 2003. She has successfully managed and repaid five loans. With her fifth loan she is planning to stock medicines and piglets. With her experience in the business, she knows the business will greatly help the community, becuse they will be able to get drugs from her when they are sick and her pigs will provide pork meat for ceremonies and the manure for farm vegetables.


About GHAPE: 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses statement, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy drugs and piglets and to maintain her pig sty

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Рачабов Баходур проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 26 лет. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Жена занимается растениеводством и одновременно животноводством. Сам Баходур более 4 лет занимается торговлей. Он в основном продает продукты питания. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Bahodur R. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 26 years old, married and has one child. His wife is involved in agriculture and animal husbandry. Bahodur has been involved in retail sales for over 4 years. He primarily sells food products. He is requesting the loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Seyilbubu's Group

texts.en:
Today it is quite easy to meet people who complain about current economic situations and just refuse to seek solutions for their own problems, blaming everything around.

Nevertheless, the heroes of our story would consider everything said above as just an absence of creativity. Their principle is to be creative and keep on trying.

Seyilbubu O. is the leader of this group. By the age of 52 she had raised 4 sons. Seyilbubu is divorced and she successfully overcame the ordeal of being a sole provider for the family as her eldest son is married already and started to help support his family.

As to Seyilbubu’s occupation, she offers seamstress’s services. She makes handycrafts to order. She used to produce handycrafts for domestic use only. However, afterwards she started receiving orders from her acquaintances.

This activity has allowed her to lead a relatively independent life. Her monthly income amounts to about 60 USD. She thriftily saved money and was able to send her kids to school and provide them with school supplies and clothes.

Now Seyilbubu dreams about buying new household appliances and a new sewing machine. Before doing that she needs to make new handycrafts for sale. She is in need of a loan to purchase a hundred kg of wadding and fabric.

Seyilbubu’s partners are:

Bermet M., 39, is a mother of three children. Her husband works in construction. Bermet breeds cattle. Two of her children go to school. Bermet needs a loan to buy a cow. Bermet’s dream is to provide her children with education.

Gulnaz B., 34, has three children. Her eldest son, in spite of being just sixteen, already earns his own living. The other two children go to school. Gulnaz is a seamstress. She needs a loan to purchase fabric.

Ainura E. K., 41, breeds cattle and sells milk. Her husband is a policeman. He works in a crime detection department. In his free time he helps his wife look after the cattle. Ainura hopes to obtain this loan and buy a cow for breeding.

Where Did This Loan Come From?

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase wadding and fabric to make handycrafts.

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkan de l’association Balemayaton est composé 4 de femmes   mariées de la ville de San, région de Ségou, quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles et ont en moyenne 31 ans et au moins 3 enfants. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. 
Depuis environ 6 ans, ces femmes du groupe Benkan  font la vente  de riz, de pâte d’arachide, de poissons, de savons, de sucre, etc, et  parmi elles  se trouve une qui est très sollicitée par ses clients pour la qualité de sa  marchandise, la présidente du groupe Fanta S. qui excelle dans l’achat vente de la pâte d’arachide. 
Les femmes du groupe Benkan collaborent avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant une année afin de développer  leurs activités et  satisfaire le besoin des clients. 
Madame Fanta S. s’approvisionne à San, en gros, auprès des sœurs catholiques qui produisent de la pâte d’arachide, pour revendre en détail et en espèce aux femmes de son quartier. 
Elle  compte acheter, 50 seaux de 5kg qui généreront un bénéfice  de 28.000 FCFA et les autres membres prétendent avoir un bénéfice de 22 000FCFA par mois. 
C’est avec ce profit que ces femmes envisagent rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans leurs activités.
texts.en:
The Benkan group, belonging to the Balemayaton association, is made up of four married women from the town of San in Ségou, the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They live in traditional families, average 31 years of age and have at least three children. They got to know each other through neighbors. For around six years these women in the Benkan group have been selling rice, peanut butter, fish, soaps, sugar, etc. Among them there is one woman who is in great demand for the quality of her goods; she is the president of the group, Fanta S., and she excels in the purchase and sale of peanut butter. The women in the Benkan group have been working with Soro Yiriwaso for a year now with the aim of building up their businesses and satisfying their customers' needs. Mrs. Fanta S. gets her supplies wholesale in San, from Catholic nuns who produce peanut butter, and she sells them retail and for cash to women in her neighborhood. She is planning to buy 50 5kg buckets of peanut butter which will generate a profit of 28,000FCFA, and the other members of the group claim to be making a monthly profit of 22,000FCFA. With these profits the women plan to repay their loan and reinvest in their businesses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of peanut butter

loans.name: Marie Solange

texts.en:
Marie Solange is 26 years old and married with two children who are 3 and 4 years old.  Marie Solange struggles to sell a variety of goods, mainly plastic items usually used at home.  Marie Solange has been in her business for about two years. The hours of her business are from 6 am to 8 pm every day except Saturday.

Marie Solange realized that her working capital is not enough, and she wants to start selling drinks in her shop. She would like to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, Marie Solange will hopefully earn more profit which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting in her business for better sustainability. She really hopes that she will start saving for a better education for her children in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of goods, mainly plastic items

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es: María Concepción L. reside en Puerto el triunfo, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután, vive junto a sus tres hijos de 15,13 y 12 años de edad. María posee un comedor en el cual se encarga de hacer desayunos y almuerzos, los cuales  comercializa en el mercado municipal de Usulután en donde vende sus platillos con los otros vendedores del lugar. Este negocio es muy importante para ella, debido a que representa la única fuente de trabajo el cual le permite sacar a delante a sus hijos por ella sola, ya que no recibe la ayuda de nadie más. Ella es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, quien se esfuerza a diario para brindarle, ropa, techo, alimento y educación a sus tres hijos, los cuales son el mayor incentivo para seguir luchando. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar todo los elementos necesarios para elaborar más alimentos, ingredientes como: vegetales, verduras, granos básicos, frutas y otros más. De esta forma ella espera poder mejorar su negocio de manera que pueda atender a más clientes, y así mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
María Concepción L. lives in Puerto El Triunfo, located in the Usulután department. She lives with her 3 children, aged 15, 13 and 12 years. María has an eatery where she makes breakfasts and lunches that she sells in the municipal market of Usulután, where she sells her dishes with the other merchants in the market. This business is very important for her, since it is her only source of work that allows her to help her children get ahead, since they do not receive help from anyone else. She is a very responsible and hardworking woman, who makes a daily effort to provide clothing, shelter, food and education for her 3 children, who are her main incentive to keep going. María requests a loan so that she can buy all of the items necessary to make more dishes, ingredients such as: vegetables, staple grains, fruit and others. In this way she hopes to improve her business so that she can have more customers and increased earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make meals

location.town: Puerto el Triunfo, departamento de Usulután

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 58 años, es una mujer soltera que vive en su casa propia al lado de sus 6 hijos; quienes ya son independientes. El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de productos de belleza y con el paso del tiempo la convirtió en una experta en la venta, ahora es promotora, líder de la zona en la que vive. Desde entonces se encarga de un número determinado de vendedoras, a quienes debe monitorear y proveerles de productos para que ellas los vendan. Elena se siente muy contenta con su trabajo, dedicándole la mayoría de su tiempo a ello. Además posee en stocks cosméticos, lo cual ofrece a sus clientes, quienes fieles le hacen algún pedido previo. Su prioridad es mejorar su negocio y por ello necesita mayor capital para aumentar su stock. Ella es un cliente muy antiguo en MFP pero siempre destaco por ser muy puntual con los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, quiere comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería para tenerla en stock.
texts.en:
Elena is 58, and is a single woman who lives in her own house with her six adult children. She makes a living by selling beauty products, and with time she has turned into an expert. She has become a sales promoter and the leader of the area that she lives in. Since then she has been in charge of a fixed number of saleswomen who she monitors and provides with products for them to sell. Elena is very happy with her job, and she dedicates most of her time to it. She also has cosmetics in stock that she offers to her clients, who being loyal request them in advance. Her priority is to improve her business, and to do that she needs more capital to increase her inventory. She has been a client of MFP for a very long time, and has always stood out as being very punctual with her payments. With the requested loan she wants to buy a larger quantity of merchandise so that she has them in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise to keep in stock.

loans.name: Man

texts.en: Man K., 32, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. She is employed at a local garment factory making an income of US $2 per day. Her husband sells firewood, earning an income of about US $4 per day. K. is requesting a loan of US $700 to purchase a cow to attach to their cart to transport firewood. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. K.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy a cow to transport firewood to sell

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: Jenny, de 30 años, es una mujer muy colaboradora, vive en la casa de su madre junto a su esposo Atis (33), ellos tienen 3 hijos pequeños.Se dedica a la siembra de papa, maíz, alverja y flor de gladiolo, es una  de las mejores de su zona, gracias a la esmerada dedicación que les brinda. Lo que más le gusta a Jenny, es sembrar flor de gladiolo y disfrutar de su exquisito olor, sin embargo, a veces le molesta  terrenos estén alejados de su casa. Además de la actividad agrícola también cría 16 vacas que tiene en lo alto del pueblo donde vive, y su esposo trabaja como perforista en una mina de una ciudad al sur del Perú y llega a su domicilio cada 20 días. Para más adelante ella  piensa en continuar sembrando, por lo que quiere comprar más terrenos productivos en su localidad, también desea construir una casa en una zona céntrica de la ciudad, para instalar un negocio de venta de comestibles.Es  la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está contenta de laborar con los integrantes de su banco comunal, pues demuestra ser un buen grupo, al presidir ella la junta directiva. Y todos trabajan activamente, para pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.Jenny tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  varios sacos de abono que esparcirá  en sus cultivos de alverja, maíz y papa.
texts.en:
Jenny, 30, is a woman who is a great contributor. She lives in her mother's house together with her husband Atis (33). They have 3 small children. Jenny works planting potatoes, maize, peas and gladioli flowers, which are some of the best in the zone thanks to painstaking dedication she gives to them. What Jenny likes most about her work is planting the gladioli seeds and enjoying their exquisite smell. Nevertheless, she gets annoyed sometimes because her plots are so far away from her house. On top of her agricultural work she also raises 16 cows, which she has at the top of the village where she lives. Jenny's husband works as a driller in a mine in the south of Peru and comes home every 20 days. In the future Jenny is planning to continue to plant seeds, and for this wants to purchase more plots of productive land in her area. She also wants to build a house in the central city zone to install a food-sale business. This is the second time Jenny has had a loan from MFP and she is happy to work with the other members of her communal bank, as it has proved to be a good group, with Jenny presiding on the board of directors. All the members actively work to pay their repayments punctually. Jenny plans to invest this loan in the purchase of various sacks of fertiliser which she will scatter over her pea, maize and potato crops.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertiliser to improve crops

loans.name: María Del Pilar

texts.es:
María del Pilar es una madre de familia de 38 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el sector el Huabal, un centro poblado perteneciente al distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola de movimiento comercial moderado, pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y se encuentra ubicada en la Región La Libertad, a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en actividades relacionadas con la agricultura, ella cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar diversos granos y cereales, como maíz y arroz, su familia depende de esta actividad para mantener gran parte de su economía, por lo que siempre cuida de sus cultivos para que estos puedan brindarle una excelente producción.

En esta oportunidad ella ha sembrado maíz en su terreno, María desea brindarle mantenimiento aplicándole algunos fertilizantes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le permitan realizar esta acción.

María del Pilar siempre se esfuerza al máximo para sacar adelante a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María del Pilar, 38, is a mother living with her husband and three children in Huabal, a population center in Chepén district, an agricultural area with moderate commercial activity. It belongs to Chepén province, La Libertad region located an hour and forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. She is a farmer. She has a field where she grows various grains and cereals like corn and rice. Her family depends on this activity for a large part of their economy. Therefore, she always cares for her crops so that they will yield the best possible production. On this occasion she has planted corn in her field. María wants to care for it adding fertilizer. She has found it convenient, therefore, to request her first, 2000 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa to reach this goal. María del Pilar always puts maximum effort into her family’s success. Her greatest wish is to continue working to provide her family with a better quality of life. .

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her corn crops.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa D. R. is from the village of Pagalungan, Wao, Lanao D. Sur. She is 48 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. Nimfa owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling school supplies and other products such as snack foods, in the local community. Nimfa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Nimfa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nimfa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Nimfa is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Nimfa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital

loans.name: Lailyn

texts.en:
Lailyn P. is from the town of Banga. She is 37 years old. Lailyn is married and has a 13 year old child. To make a living, Lailyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. She also helps her husband maintain their farm. She helps in keeping it free of weeds and pests.

Lailyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lailyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She also plans to buy inputs for their farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies, and to buy inputs for their farm.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco; situado a 45 minutos de la ciudad.

El socio Fredy; el socio tiene 34 años de edad y es artesano, el socio es un excelente padre y desea todo lo mejor para sus hijos, el nos comenta que su esposa viaja mucho porque es la representante a nivel nacional de las comunidades andinas y la llevan a todas partes y se ausenta mucho dejando a su pequeña al cuidado del padre, el socio trabaja mucho en su taller y en el cuidado de sus menores hijos, el realiza bellísimos trabajos como mantas, ponchos con figuras que representan toda la astronomía inca. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de lanas y materiales para elaborar textiles.

El socio  agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This client belongs to the communal bank, Nueva Victoria – Chinchero. The bank is located in the district of Chinchero, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco, located 45 minutes from the city.

Fredy is 34 years old and is an artisan. He is an excellent father and wants all the best for his children. He tells us that his wife travels frequently because she is a representative of the Andean communities at the national level. She goes everywhere and is not there much, leaving their small daughter in the care of Fredy. Fredy works in his workshop a lot, as well as in caring for their younger children. He makes beautiful crafts such as blankets and ponchos with figures that represent all of the astronomy of the Inca. He is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of wool and materials to make textiles.

He is grateful for the loan and promises to make his payments in the stipulated time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wool and materials for making textiles

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is 44 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 15 and 17. Both of her children are enrolled in school. Her husband works in a hotel.  

Judith sells second-hand clothes for children and adults in a market.  The success of her business has allowed her to pay her children’s school fees and to get medical insurance. Her business is so popular that she is often called out of the market to take clothes to people.  

With this loan, Immaculee will buy more clothes to sell at the market. Immaculee has several dreams for her business and for her family. She would like to be able to buy larger quantities of clothes to sell because she would get lower prices and a higher profit. She would like to be able to buy a motorcycle or a car in order to transport clothes to her clients. She would also like to construct a home for her family.  

With the profit from her business, she will buy a plot of land worth 300,000 RWF (about $512 USD).

loans.use: Clothes to sell at the market

loans.name: Reina Rocio

texts.es:
Reina R. està solicitando un nuevo crédito de renovación a través de Kiva, porque la tasa de interés a la que accede es muy buena, le han ayudado a disminuir sus costos y a ofrecer un mejor precio de ventas. 

El crédito al que se postula lo invertirá  en la compra de CD, DVD, MP3 para aumentar su oferta de productos, adaptandose a una temporada de buena música bailable y navideña que se acerca, lo mismo que provisionandose con películas instructivas, para que las familias aprovechen las vacaciones, para reunirse alrededor del tema proyectado. 

Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Reina a través de su perfil Kiva anterior, puede ingresar al siguiente enlace: http://www.kiva.org/lend/184971.
texts.en:
Reina R. is requesting a new loan through Kiva because the interest rate she can access is very good, and helps her reduce costs and be able to offer her merchandise at a better sales price.

She plans to use the requested loan to buy CDs, DVDs and MP3s to increase the variety of stock available adapting it with dance music for the approaching Christmas season as well as including educational films so that families can use their vacation time to gather around and learn about the topic of interest.

If you would like to learn about Reina’s story by viewing her previous Kiva profile, please follow this link: http://www.kiva.org/lend/184971.

loans.use: To increase her stock of CDs, DVDs and MP3s.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Esperanza está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Adela del Carmen N. de 59 años quien inicio hace 30 años con la venta de leña y carbón negocio que cambio hace siete años por tener una tortillería amplia. Ella es una madre execional la cual ha preparado a sus hijos para ser personas de bien y que cumplan sus sueños; su hijo menor de 20 años está estudiando Ingeniería Agrónoma. 
N. tiene dos trabajadoras con quienes produce una gran cantidad duel bastimento por excelencia de los nicaragüenses e invertirá el crédito en trigo, leña, maíz etc. para aumentar la producción 
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Carmencita del Socorro Díaz Valles de 29 años quien tiene una tortillería desde hace 8 años y Damaris Karina C. de 24 años desde hace dos años aproximadamente vende truchas.
texts.en:
The Esperanza (Hope) group is made up of three hardworking women. One of them is Adela del Carmen N., age 59. Thirty years ago, she began selling firewood and charcoal, a business that changed seven years ago to a large tortilla making operation. She is an exceptional mother who has prepared her children to be honest people who achieve their dreams. Her youngest child, age 20, is studying agricultural engineering.

N. has two employees with whom she produces a large quantity of tortillas, the basis of the Nicaraguan diet. She will invest the loan in wheat, firewood, corn, etc. in order to increase production.

The other members of the group are Carmencita del Socorro Díaz Valles, age 29, who has had a tortilla making business for 8 years, and Damaris Karina C., age 24, who has been selling trout for about 2 years.

loans.use: Corn, firewood, lime powder, etc.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther N. runs a business selling rice, beans, sugar and cooking oil. She is requesting a loan to buy more stock of fish and bags of beans to sell.  Esther is 35 years old and is married to a businessman. She has 2 children who do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to stock fish and more bags of beans to sell

loans.name: Mirneymat

texts.en: Mirneymat A. is 50 years old, married with six children. Being the lone breadwinner for such  a big family is a very hard job but looking after 6 cattle is also a hard job.  Mirneymat wakes up early in the morning to pasture his cows and feed them. All of his day is dedicated to looking after his livestock. He has six years of experience.  His eldest son helps him. He usually sells cattle to the local butchers. Now Mirneymat has applied for a 1000 AZN loan to purchase three baby calves. At the moment he has more orders for meat from butchers than he can fill and this is why he want to enlarge his cattle raising business.

loans.use: To purchase three baby calves

loans.name: Chynargul's Group

texts.en: Chynargul E. is a citizen of a lakeside town. She is married and, together with her husband, is raising two daughters and twin sons. All of the children are school pupils. Chynargul and her spouse improve their living standard by working in the same establishment. The head of the family is a chief of the shooting-ground (his salary comes to 11,700 soms per month). Earlier, Chynargul in the same place had a job as the cook, and a month ago, she opened her own dining room in the building. Out of the earnings, she has managed to obtain household appliances. In order to purchase foodstuff and vary the canteen menu, the woman hopes to get a loan. In the future, she plans to open a café, to obtain a car and give a good upbringing to her children. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en: Maribeth I. is from the village of Lumbo, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 48 years old. Maribeth is widowed and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Maribeth buys and sells health and medicinal products, like ointments and multivitamins, in the local community. Maribeth has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. Maribeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Maribeth is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like generic medicines. This will be the third loan taken out by Maribeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, like generic medicines

loans.name: Elchin

texts.ru:
Elchin G. 45 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey odin iz kotorix uchitsya v koledje a druqoy v universitete. Elchin yavlyayestya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda i seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi.

Elchin uje 8 let kak rabotayet masnikom,  etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo dyadi. Seychas on nujdayestya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit myaso dlya pereprodaji.
texts.en:
Elchin G. is 45 years old. He is married, with two children, one of whom is a college student, and the other a university student. Elchin is an Internally Displaced person from the town of Fuzuli, now living in the Absheron Region together with his wife and children. 

For the last eight years, Elchin has been working as a butcher. He learned this trade from his uncle. At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to purchase meat products for resale.

loans.use: Purchasing meat for resale

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon A. is from the village of Lampanusan, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 50 years old. Corazon is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Corazon runs a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling foods like chicken pork adobo, afritada, beef stick and pancit bihon in the local community. She also makes and sells snacks like rice cakes and cheese cakes. Corazon has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Corazon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw ingredients and as working capital. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional raw ingredients, like chicken, pork and spices. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Corazon from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw ingredients, like chicken, pork and spices

loans.name: Donatilda

texts.es: Donatilda P. tiene 44 años, es natural del distrito de San Miguel, madre soltera y tiene 03 hijos;  viven en su propia casa, en la comunidad de Palmapampa anexo del Distrito de Samugari. Donatilda, es una mujer de mucho provecho, se dedica con mucho esmero a la labor que realiza. Su trabajo consiste en labrar la tierra, es campesina por lo cual posee una parcela, donde tiene ha sembrado cacao, hojas de coca y café, Ha trabajado durante 20 años y aún disfruta mucho de su actividad, además que le es rentable, explica que en temporada de cosecha, tiene el apoyo de jornaleros que ella contrata, así puede extraer rápidamente sus productos y poder venderlos en las empresas acopiadoras, quienes le remuneran muy bien por cada kilogramo de grano de café y cacao. El problema de su trabajo radica en no poder controlar la plaga de insectos que afectan sus frutos. En adelante, espera juntar más dinero, para comprar nuevas tierras. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesto a hacerlo. En su banco comunal siempre esta al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llegan. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de cacao y abono para su parcela.
texts.en:
Donatilda P., 44, is from San Miguel district.  She’s a single mother of three children.  They live in their own house in the community of Palmapampa, an annex in Samugari district.

Donatilda is a very productive woman.  She is very dedicated to her work.  Her work consists in tilling the land.  She is a farmer and owns a parcel where she grows cocoa beans, coca leaf and coffee.  She’s been working for 20 years and still enjoys her activity very much; besides, it’s profitable.

She explains that during harvest time she hires day workers to help so that they can quickly extract the products and sell them to agricultural gathering firms who pay very well for each kilogram of coffee and cacao beans.

The problem with her work resides in not being able to control insect infestations that affect the fruit.  In the future she’d like to gather more funds to buy new lands.

This is her 10th loan with MFP.  She knows that she has the responsibility of repaying all her installments on time and is willing to do so.  She is always aware of all the agreements reached in her communal bank.

She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy cocoa bean seeds and manure for her field.

loans.use: To buy cocoa bean seed and sacks of manure.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby N. is from the town of Banga. She is 51 years old. Ruby is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Ruby owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Ruby also helps her husband maintain their rice farm.

Ruby joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruby has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Ruby is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional piglets, feed and vitamins. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida C. is from the village of Siti Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old and married, with 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Leonida raises cows for sale. Leonida has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Leonida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to raise cattle. Leonida is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Leonida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Tetyana

texts.en:
Tetyana is divorced with two grown children. She is an entrepreneur from Beregovo, Western Ukraine, and she sells retail household items in a busy place in the local market that attracts many potential customers. Tetyana has been in this trade for nine years and presently has 40,000 Grivnyas invested in her inventories. Her monthly net profit amounts to 7,000 Grivnyas.

Tetyana is requesting a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase various small home products. Operating her business with integrity and skill, she is looked up to by others as an entrepreneur of authority and intelligence. Additional merchandise, combined with Tetyana’s work ethic and experience, will enable her to expand her business, increase her income and continue growing as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase various small home products

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 50-year-old, married man with 5 children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after the family. His dream is to educate his children and build a permanent residential house. He is a farmer and also trades in cattle. Emmanuel has been in this kind of business for 13 years. He has a challenge of inadequate market demand and has a desire to venture into urban markets. Emmanuel needs the loan to buy cattle to sell.

loans.use: to buy cattle for resale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine A. O. is a sole proprietor business lady who is a tailor.  She offers her tailoring services at the Kariobangi Market in Nairobi.  She has been in this business for the last 10 years.  Her monthly income is KES 40,000.    

Josephine is 46 years old, married to Samson Odera, and they have three children.   She was introduced to KADET by a friend.  Josephine has a good credit history with KADET LTD and this is her fourth loan from KADET.  She plans to use this loan to buy clothes materials to make dresses for sale. 

In the future, Josephine hopes to grow her business and own a very big material shop.

loans.use: to buy materials to make dresses for sale

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
María, resiD. en San Francisco Gotera, departamento D. Morazán, se dedica a atender una tienda D. productos domésticos, vive con su esposo quien trabaja D. repartidor D. gaseosas, juntos ven la manera D. proveer ingresos y ayudar a sus hijos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra D. productos comestibles como, pan, galletas, sodas, jugos, pastas, embutidos y huevos, esta compra será una gran ayuda para surtir el negocio y generar más ingresos.
Los sueños y aspiraciones D. María son crecer a sus hijos y que estudien, además D. tener un negocio que cada día sea más rentable.
texts.en:
María resides in San Francisco Gotera, a department of Morazán.  She tends a household products store.  María lives with her husband, a soft drink delivery man.  Together they proviD. earnings and help their children.

She is asking for a loan to buy edible products like bread, cookies, sodas, juices, pastas, sausages and eggs.  This purchase will be a big help in stocking up the business and generating more earnings.

María’s dreams and aspirations are to raise her children and that they study, in addition to having a business that every day becomes more profitable.

loans.use: purchase bread, cookies, soadas, juices, pastas, sausages and eggs.

loans.name: Floria

texts.en:
Floria is 49 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  She has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for nine years.

Floria requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell to customers.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is from the village of Lower Tiparak Tambulig Zamboanga del Sur. She is 23 years old. Juan is married with three school-aged children. She raises ducks for sale. Juan has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Juan joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Juan is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed and other supplies. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Leonie

texts.en: Leonie is 31 years old. She has two children who are aged five and six. Her husband sells foodstuff while Leonie owns a restaurant in which she serves African dishes. She has run a restaurant for the past six years and it’s going well. This business has enabled her to feed her family and make some savings. Leonie is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuff for her restaurant and make more profits. She plans to save all her profits and later on build her own house.

loans.use: to buy foodstuff.

loans.name: Magaly Alexandra

texts.es:
Magaly Alexandra tiene 23 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con la hijo. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz.

Magaly se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es salir adelante con la familia.

Le gusta dialogar con el esposo.
texts.en:
Magaly Alexandra is 23 years old, and she is married.  She lives with her husband and her child.  They live in the Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.

Her Communal Bank is called San Francisco de Sibimbe.  It is located in the Sibimbe precint, which is in the Ventanas canton.  The communal bank has 20 members who grow short cycle corn and rice.

Anibal devotes herself to growing corn and rice.  She makes her purchases in Ventanas every month, and she sells at the fair in the same place.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and natural and chemical fertilizers.  The support of the loan will help her financially in order to supply her necessities.  

Her dream is to get ahead with her family.

She likes chatting with her husband.

loans.use: to buy seeds and natural and chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Ramon Justo

texts.es: El Sr. Ramon de profesión sastre desde hace varios años, su  taller se encuentra en la misma casa donde el vive y aparte que la casa es propia. El cliente de muy buena actitud el cliente es casado tiene dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, también vale recalcar que el señor tiene muchos clientes ya que su mano de obra es muy buena y actualmente tiene varios contratos vigentes por las festividades de la de la zona y la entrada universitaria, para esto solicita el crédito para la compra de telas. Nuestro cliente ya trabajo dos años con nuestra institución, es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Ramon is a tailor by profession.  He has been in this business for several years.  His workshop is located in his home which he owns.

Ramon has a good attitude.  He is married and has two school-age children.  We should also stress that the gentleman has many customers as his labor is very good and he has several current contracts for the area's festivities and also the 'entrada universitária' parades.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy fabric.

This client has been working with our institution for two years.  He is a responsible and very hard-working person who si grateful to the institution for the support he has received.

loans.use: to buy material and fabric

loans.name: Tobias

texts.en:
Tobias has operated a block selling business for the past five years, selling to contractors and house builders. He faces a major challenge of competition from other block supplies in the market. He dreams of improving his livelihood in the future.
 
Tobias and his wife live in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase coral blocks to offer for sale. He decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase coral blocks to offer for sale

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. Erlinda has a food shop that sells breads, papaya & jackfruit salad. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients for making salad & viands for sell. Erlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making salad & viands to sell

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
