Irene is a lady aged 41 years old who supports six members of her family. Her children are eighteen, sixteen, thirteen, seven and four years old.

Irene sells secondhand clothes in the Kamoywo trading center in Kapsabet. She has been in business for five years, earning a monthly income of 8,000 KES.

Irene is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES from KADET LTD. This will be her fourth loan, and she intends to use it to purchase three bales of secondhand clothes to sell. She plans to use the anticipated profits to provide for her family’s basic needs.

Irene hopes to be self-sufficient in the future.

loans.use: to purchase three bales of secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Vegelyn

texts.en:
Vegelyn is a 40 year old married woman with 3 children aged 15, 14 and 12. She earns a living growing and selling rice and corn. Vegelyn works hard to send her children to school. It is her dream to see them succeed in the future.

Vegelyn has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. This loan will help Vegelyn achieve her goals.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Twitange Group

texts.en:
Hadija, who is in her mid 20s, is single with one small child. She has had a stall place for one year now where she sells sodas, juice, water and bites (like small cakes). She works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to sell mandazi (fried bread similar to donuts), vitumbuwa (a breakfast dish), small ice cubes, sodas, juice, water, bites and for household expenses. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to increase her stock of sodas, juice, water, bites, mandanzi and boiled sweet potatoes. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Twitange" which has a total of 20 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase stock of sodas, juice, water, bites (small cakes), mandanzi (like donuts), and boiled sweet potatoes

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: El Sr. Ricardo es  una  persona   responsable  y  muy  trabajadora, actualmente tiene   en  su casa  un  negocio  en  el  cual   se  dedica a la  elaboración de  dulces  mexicanos  que es lo que le  permite   salir  adelante  día  con día, el  se preocupa  por  tener  en existencia  los   diferentes  productos   disponibles a  la  hora  que  sus  clientes  se los requieren,  es por  ello  que  se acerco  con nosotros  para   que lo apoyemos  en la realización de  su   proyecto  , el cual consiste   en realizar  la compra  de materia  prima   para  la  elaboración de  los  dulces, agradece  el  apoyo  brindado  para  concluir   su proyecto.
texts.en: Ricardo is a responsible and hardworking man.  He has a store in his home where he makes Mexican candies.  This is what allows him to get ahead day by day.  He wants to make sure he has all of his different products available when his customers need them, so he approached us for support to complete his project.  He wants to purchase the ingredients for making candies, and is thankful for the support given so that he can finish his project.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make Mexican candies.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: Jose describes himself as god-fearing. He is a loving father of three school-aged children. Jose and his wife are working together to improve their living. His wife cooks and sells snack foods nearby in the school in their village. Jose is good at wood carving and runs a furniture making business in their village. Jose and his wife's priority is to prepare for their children’s education; they will enter college in the next school year. To gain extra income, Jose engages in a pig raising business. He has been doing this business for 11 years and uses his income to improve their house. Jose wishes to maintain the business. He is requesting a loan of P35,000 to buy feed for his pigs to grow. The loan will make a good contribution to maintaining his business and uplifting their family living standards.

loans.use: to buy feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS DE RUMICHACA ALTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Nicanor; el tiene 20 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de jardinero en un hotel, el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo el socio quiere salir adelante, el socio quiere terminar de construir su cuarto.  El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, yeso, clavos y arena.
 
 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Nicanor, 20, belongs to the “Manos Juntas de Rumichaca Alta” communal bank located in Urubamba District belonging to Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.  He is single.  He alternates his daily chores with working as a hotel gardener.  He works from 7am until 6pm.  He wants to get ahead through his job and wants to finish building his room.  He is asking for the loan to buy building materials and supplies like cement, plaster, nails and sand.  He is happy with the loan and commits to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Edgar German

texts.es:
Edgar German tiene 58 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los sobrinos en el cantón Chillanes provincia de Bolívar
LA VRC SAN JOSE, está conformada por 21 socios y socias se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao.
Edgar se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en la Parroquia San José del Tambo. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar los productos. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia, vías de comunicación y las plagas. El sueño es ofertar vender productos de buena calidad para obtener mejores ingresos.
Se considera una persona responsable, honrada y le gusta disfrutar del carnaval.
texts.en:
Edgar German, 58, is single and has no children.  He lives with his nephews in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “San José” communal bank consists of 21 members, both men and women, and is located in San José del Tambo Parish sixty minutes from the office.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn, banana and cocoa bean farming.

Edgar is a corn, banana and cocoa bean farmer.  His purchases and sales take place in San José del Tambo Parish.  He’s asking for a loan to buy seeds and farm supplies like urea, Matamonte [herbicide], fertilizer and weed killer to maintain his crops in good condition.

The loan will be of great help for him because he’ll be able to improve his products.  The challenges he faces are very frequent: competition, the roads and pests.  His dream is to have high quality products to sell in order to earn better income.  He considers himself to be a responsible, honest person and he enjoys carnival.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is a married man. He lives in the community of Minallo of the province of Ilagan.

Last season, due to the natural disaster of a drought, his small plot of rice did not grow properly. This disaster made him fail to get the income he used to get and needs to get by in life. 

Pedro is a  man who is loved and respected in the place where he lives. He is dedicated to his work, agriculture in season, and in his free time, he works in tire repair. Pedro is asking for the loan to buy fertilizer and seed to improve his crops and increase his production in order to increase his earnings and have a better quality of life. The loan will really help Pedro in the hard work that he does.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer to grow crops.

loans.name: Whitney

texts.en:
Whitney is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Whitney is making and peddling snacks like rice and cheese cakes. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Whitney has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Whitney hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Javier Isaias

texts.es: Javier  de 42 años es un hombre casado tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 15 y 18 años y vive en la población de San Jacinto en el departamento de Bolívar, tierra de artesanías, mochilas y hamacas en tejido vertical, que producen las mujeres y han transmitido de generación en generación. Allí tiene un negocio a través del cual ofrece servicios de hospedaje, aprovechando la oportunidad del estacionamiento que hacen los conductores de cargas pesadas, para descansar y continuar su camino por las carreteras de Colombia. En este municipio donde hay muy pocos hospedajes  y muchas veces los transportadores,  deben quedarse en los parqueaderos donde están estacionados, Javier cuenta con un familiar muy especial que es el mayor promotor de este negocio, pues como cuida los camiones en un estacionamiento, recomienda los servicios de este hospedaje. Su necesidad de financiamiento está basada en que son pocos muy pocos los hospedajes que hay en el pueblo y esto  genera que   permanezcan colmados y con el cupo completo y los potenciales huéspedes pasen mucho trabajo al llegar al municipio. Esta es la razón por la cual Javier acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual  acondicionará habitaciones para aumentar el servicio, adecuará cuartos de baño, pintará y  embaldosará estas habitaciones. Su inversión es exitosa porque la hace con base en una necesidad de su creciente clientela, en la temporada de fin de año, época en la cual se incrementan el paso de los conductores de carga pesada, por San Jacinto,  así como también los turistas visitantes y Javier no se quiere quedar atrás con el desarrollo turístico de su región..
texts.en:
Javier, 42, is a married man with two children, 15 and 18. He lives in the town of San Jacinto in the department of Bolívar, a land of traditional vertical-woven  handicrafts, shoulder bags, and hammocks made by the women, who have passed the trade down from generation to generation. Javier has an inn where travelers with heavy loads can avail themselves of the opportunity to rest before continuing along Colombia's roadways. In this town, where there are very few inns and truckers often need to stay where their vehicles are parked, Javier has a very special relative who is the primary promoter of Javier's line of business; he looks after the trucks in the lots, and recommends people to the inn. 

Javier needs financing because there are so few inns in town that they're always full, so it's a big problem when potential guests come to town. He's seeking a loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo so he can air-condition the rooms for better service, and paint and tile the bathrooms to bring them up to snuff. The investment will be a success because he's doing it in response to his clientele's growing need during the end of the year, when more heavy-load truckers are passing through San Jacinto.  The are also tourists and Javier doesn't want to miss out on the developing tourism industry in his region.

loans.use: to air-condition rooms for better service, and to paint and tile the bathrooms to bring them up to par.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita, 31, earns a living selling barbecue to her community. She started this business eight months ago. Lolita sells chicken and pork barbecue. She also sells hotdogs on sticks. Lolita earns about 4,000 PHP per month with her business. She plans to use her loan to buy pork and chicken meat, sticks, soy sauce and charcoal.

Lolita works hard to support her family of a husband and two children, ages 10 and 6. Lolita hopes to have a progressive business in the future.

loans.use: to buy pork and chicken meat, sticks, soy sauce and charcoal.

loans.name: Pat

texts.en: Mrs. Pat, 41, a loving mother of 3 single children, is a rice farmer with experiences. She has been in this business for ages in Prey Chor district. She has a life partner in her husband who in the same type of business. This couple works very hard on their own farmland both in rainy season and dry season for livelihoods. Together, they typically earn an income of $ 4.00 per day to cover household expenses. At the present, Pat is preparing her soil to grow her dry-season rice, yet she requires some funds to make a good process. Thus, she would like to request a loan from Kiva, through HKL to purchase organic fertilizers to put in her farmland. Her business goal is to increase her output by enlarging her farmland in a next few years.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers for his farmland.

loans.name: Micheal Angelo

texts.en:
Micheal Angelo is a 25-year-old single man, living in Bacolod, Ozamis City: Philippines.

To earn a living, Micheal Angelo runs a business planting and harvesting bananas for sale in the local community. He has been doing this for 15 years, and each month it earns him PHP 3,600. 

He requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In 2008, Micheal Angelo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. 

Micheal Angelo's objective is to save money to have a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Noth

texts.en:
Mrs. Noth is 37 years old and lives in Reussey Keo commune. Noth and her husband have four children, one of whom is a garment worker.

To earn a living, she is in the business of selling fish in a local market in the city. She has been engaged in this business since 2005 and she notes that she has many loyal customers. Noth’s husband is a driver for a bus company, which allows him to earn a decent income but which causes him to be away from home most of the time.

Now, Noth is seeking her first loan from HKL and Kiva, which she will use to buy necessary construction supplies to expand her present house. She has already hired local construction laborers to perform this task. She plans on enlarging her present store because it is not large enough to operate her business out of. In addition, she will use the loan proceeds to ensure that her children receive a good education.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials in order to expand her house.

loans.name: Daniel Mugeta

texts.en:
Daniel was born in East Gem in Siaya district. Daniel is married with children and has been involved in Motorcycle Business for three years, he wants to make a difference in his community by owning  a motorcycle to support the community health work in his community. Daniel is to be linked with CHW working in Siaya  and and will  support the community health worker by providing transport on set days, this will give the needed capacity to the CHW to be able to reach many more families during  counseling appointments and health visitation. 

Daniel is excited with his new venture, he hopes to recruit other members of his business organization to join in supporting community health outreach programme in his community.

Daniel will also use the income generated from his motorcycle taxi business to support his family. He hopes to become a CHW volunteer in his community once he has finished paying for his motorcycle

loans.use: To buy motorcycle for Community Health Work and Livelihoods

loans.name: Esmara Victorina

texts.es:
La señora  Esmara de 27  años  de edad,  es casada   tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella, vive en casa propia  ubicada en una aldea de Amapala,  se dedica desde hace 3 años al negocio de venta de arroz, frijoles, manteca, maíz, maseca, frescos, agua, etc. es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante con su familia y su esposo le apoya en sus gastos.
Doña Esmara está solicitando el préstamo para compra de una refrigeradora de segunda ya que  no tiene donde helar sus frescos y sus carnes, con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar su negocio y tener más utilidades, es un cliente nuevo..
Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2015.

loans.use: para la compra de una  refrigeradora para su negocio.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Mrs. Regina O. is a 56-year-old woman with six  children.  She trades in food items. She lives in an urban area of Benin City in Edo State of Nigeria. She will appreciate it if this amount she needs is loaned to her, to help her increase her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for sale

loans.name: Alofa

texts.en: Alofa exclaims, “I love being a business woman – what a blessing and privilege. Not just being a mother of four but a shop-keeper!  I hope all business women feel the same way!”  After Alofa’s husband died, she needed to support her four children on her own.  In dire need, Alofa built up the courage to apply for an SPBD loan to open a small village store.  Now she is able to earn enough to meet the basic needs of her family and has earned the pride and self-satisfaction of being a successful entrepreneur.  Having repaid her first loan, Alofa is applying for an additional loan to upgrade her shop and enhance her product line.  A loan to Alofa will ensure that she can continue to keep her store fully stocked and in good condition so that she can provide food, clothing, shelter and an education for her four children.

loans.use: Stock and upgrade her shop

loans.name: Aya

texts.en:
Aya is divorced and has an 8-year-old son, Nikita. She is the only breadwinner for her family. Aya runs a business selling footwear in the central city market. She has been in this business for eight years. Currently, Aya has about $800 in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about $200-300. 

Aya is a focused entrepreneur. She knows her clientele and knows how to meet the needs of the elderly ladies who shop in her kiosk. She has made a good reputation in the market. 

Her current inventory is better for winter and spring, so Aya is requesting a loan of $800 to re-stock her inventory with shoes for the warm and sunny summer season. To take her clients all the way through summer, she will buy comfy sandals, trainers, mocs, and slip-ons in bulk. These types of footwear will be a great, freeing alternative to regular shoes and she will provide a good comfortable fit for her customers.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Description of the Business

Ms. Gladys has a business where she sells breakfast, lunch and dinner in a premise she set up in her own home. She started this business with $80 dollars on savings she had from another small store she had in her house. Her two young sons help her out in the business.

Use of the Loan

She needs this loan because she wants to buy tables and chairs, she would also like to purchase a new industrial kitchen because the one she had is big not enough for all the cooking she has to do. The other part of the loan will be used to buy more merchandise for the store.

Personal Information

Ms. Gladys is 41 years old, she has four sons, one is a student. Her home is made of cement and she lives in a functional family. Her main goal is to get her business in progress and ensure a job for her sons, since they already know the business. She also wants to provide for their education.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Gladys tiene un negocio de venta de desayunos, almuerzos y meriendas en un local que acondiciono en su propia casa. Este negocio lo comenzó con los ahorros que le genero una tienda que tiene en otro local de su misma casa. Con $80 dólares, le ayuda en el negocio sus dos hijos que son jóvenes

Uso del Préstamo

Ella necesita el crédito porque ha pensado en comprar mas mesas y silla que le hacen falta además tiene que adquirir otra cocina industrial por que la tiene no le abastece para axial atender mejor a sus clientes. Otra parte del crédito piensa en comprar mas mercadería para la tienda

Información Personal

Ella tiene 41 años y cuatro hijos de los cuales una estudia su casa es de cemento y tiene estabilidad familiar. Su principal meta es de poder progresar en su negocio para asegurarles un trabajo a sus hijos que ya conocen del negocio y la educación de su hijos

loans.use: Comprar mas mesas y sillas

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is married, has 3 children and is 29 years old. Together with her husband she owns a locally conservatory dedicated to the cultivation of flowers. In addition, she involves herself in crafts and embroidery of tablecloths and blankets. She sells her products in the city closest to her community. She belongs to the Estrellas 1 group along with doña Juana Pérez López (Artisan). The wish to invest their loan in fabrics and thread for embroidering. Doña Juana will give additional help in the family business buying pesticides and fertilizers for the conservatory.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

JUANA, es casada tiene 3 hijos y 29 años de edad, junto con su esposo tienen un invernadero ya que es una característica de la zona dedicarse al cultivo de las flores, además ella se dedica a la artesanía bordando manteles y mantas, venden sus productos en la ciudad mas cercana a su comunidad. Pertenece al grupo Estrellas 1 junto con doña Juana Pérez López (artesana). Esperan invertir el préstamo en telas e hilo para sus bordados y doña Juana apoyara además el negocio familiar comprando pesticidas y fertilizantes para su invernadero.

loans.use: Craftwork

loans.name: Sophallin

texts.en:
Mrs. N. Sophallin got married in 1989 and has one daughter and three sons. She is currently in the business of selling custard apples. She buys custard apples from her district and resells them in a market in Phnom Penh. Her husband does construction work , grows rice, and raises chickens and pigs. With these businesses, the couple has been able to support their children's education and pay for a new house to be built. She is in the process of building her new house and is short of money to finish it.

She is therefore seeking her first loan from MAXIMA, for about $1,200, with which to complete her house.

loans.use: Repairing her house.

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr:
Mrs. Béatrice Toudeno is 42 and a mother of six children. Her husband has been unemployed since 2004. Mrs. Toudeno owns a sewing supplies store in the main market in Kpalimé. She buys the supplies wholesale in Lomé and then sells them retail in her store. This business earns her enough income to completely pay for her family’s expenses and her children’s education. With this loan, she would like to build up her inventory so she can satisfy her constantly growing, loyal customer base.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Mme Béatrice Toudeno est agée de 42 ans, mère de 6 enfants. Son mari est au chômage depuis 2004. Mme Béatrice T. est propriétaire d'une boutique de vente de fourniture de coututre sise au grand marché de kpalimé. Elle s'approvisionne à Lomé en gros et revend en détail dans sa boutique . Cette activité lui procure le revenu qui finance à 100% les charges de famille et de l'éducation de ses enfants. Par le présent emprunt elle désire augmenter le stock pour satisfaire sa clientèle qui lui est fidèle et en pleine croissance.

loans.use: Purchase of sewing supplies in Lomé for retail sale in Kpalimé

loans.name: Rumput

texts.en: Rumput, 35, and her husband, R., are vegetable farmers. They sell their crops at the market and earn about US$ 40 a month. She is asking for a loan of US$ 125 to expand their business and as a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: expansion of their small vegetable farm business

loans.name: Maher

texts.en: Maher lives with his wife and three children in Saida, in south Lebanon. Maher is a 36-year-old carpenter who also works as a fisherman. This is the fourth time Maher has applied for a loan from A. Majmoua, and he intends to use this new loan to buy supplies for his carpentry work and repair his fishing boat. He will use the revenues generated by the loan to pay for his children's tuition.

loans.use: To buy material for a carpentry shop and to repair a fishing boat

loans.name: Kitima Adzovi Et Adzato Ami Group

texts.fr:
K. Adzovi, 43, and A. Ami, 45, are two married women who have 7 and 6 children, respectively. They own a small restaurant located at the marketplace in Avetonou, a small village situated about 120 km from Lomé, the Togolese capitol. The restaurant has a good location in the marketplace to allow people to eat while they are shopping. The women hope to use this loan to buy five sacks of rice, two drums of oil, and five boxes of canned tomatoes for cooking purposes. This will enable them to increase their restaurant's capacity in order to meet customer needs and thus to make a larger profit to improve the condition of their families.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

K. Adzovi, 43 et A. Ami, 45 sont deux femmes mariées qui ont 7 et 6 enfants respectivement. Elles sont propriétaires d’un petit restaurant situé au marché d’Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Le restaurant est bien localisé au marché pour permettre aux gens de manger pendant leurs courses. Elles comptent utiliser ce crédit pour acheter 5 sacs de riz, 2 bidons d’huiles et 5 cartons de tomates en boîtes pour cuisiner. Ce qui leur permettra d’augmenter la capacité de leur restaurant pour répondre aux besoins de la clientèle et par là dégager plus de profits pour et améliorer les conditions de leurs familles.

loans.use: To buy five sacks of rice, 2 drums of oil, and 5 boxes of canned tomatoes

loans.name: George

texts.en:
B. George sells and rents bicycles. He is married and has 4 children. He is running out bicycles and he wants to increase sales.

He is asking for $525 to buy more bicycles to sell.

loans.use: To buy more bicycles to sell and rent.

loans.name: Eneida

texts.es:
Eneida has been selling typical foods from the villages of the Peruvian jungle for 13 years. In the capital, she wanted to launch a business,and couldn't think of a better way than to sell the delicious dishes of her native area. At 8 o'clock every morning she moves the tables and chairs out to the sidewalk alongside her home and sells until past midnight. Eneida has requested loans on various occasions with which to buy the ingredients she needs to prepare her dishes. She would like to expand the exterior portion of her home and install a canopy and a cement bar that would serve as a table for additional diners, thus allow her to seat more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Eneida vende comida de la Selva desde hace 13 años. En la capital, ella quiso poner un negocio y no encontró mejor forma que ofrecer al público platos de su tierra natal. A las 8.00 de la noche ella saca mesas y sillas en la vereda de su casa, y vende hasta pasada la medianoche. Eneida ha solicitado préstamos en distintas ocasiones para comprar los ingredientes de los platos que ofrece. A ella le gustaría ampliar la parte exterior de su casa y colocarle un toldo o una barra de cemento que sirva de mesa, y así tener más comensales.

loans.use: To buy the ingredients for the prepared foods she offers

loans.name: Martha Maria Cristin

texts.es:
Ten years ago, when Martha’s husband died leaving her with three children and no money, she had to find a means to support her and her children. She attended a training class in making decorative candles and with the money that she had saved, she started her own small business. With the income from this business she has managed to support her children.

Martha requires a loan for $975, repayable over six months, to fulfil her existing orders and to purchase basic materials for making decorative candles, since from around this time of the year she has to start preparing for the festive season in December.

With your support, Martha can grow her business further.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Martha es viuda y tiene 3 hijos por lo que tuvo que buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos comenzó hace aproximadamente 10 años cuando enviudo al no tener ya el dinero que le proveia su marido para su manutencion y la de sus hijos, tomo un curso para la elaboracion de velas decorativas y con dinero que tenia ahorrado, empezo su negocio comprando materiales para elaborarlas, de ahí en adelante emprendio su microempresa y gracias a esta ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses ya que desde estas fechas empieza a prepararse para la temporada fuerte de diciembre con la elaboracion de diferentes tipos de velas, ademas de surtir lo pedidos que tiene pendientes, por lo que necesita dinero para adquirir materia prima. Con tu ayuda Martha consolidara su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of basic materials

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 39 year-old Ruth M..  She is married, and has three children aged 5,10 and 13. In 2007, Ruth established her crops business. Working six days a week, and nine to twelve hours a day, she earns about US $10 every month from this business. Ruth requires a loan in order to have more stocks of rice. She thanks you for your support.  


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To more stock of rice.

loans.name: Les Lingueres De Falokh Group

texts.fr:
Through the loans obtained over the past two years from the UIMCEC organization, the women of this group are now shining examples. Each of them has organized her own retail business, where the residents of the area come to resupply themselves with basic need goods. With the income drawn from their businesses, they are able to pay for the medical and educational costs of their children and parents.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

A travers les prets obtenus depuis deux (02) ans au prés de l U-IMCEC,les femmes de ce groupement sont aujourd'hui des exemples .chacune d 'entre elle a monté son propre commerce de détail ou les habitants du quartier viennent se ravitailler en produits de prmieres nécessites. Avec les revenus titrés de leurs activités elles s'assurent les frais médicaux et de scolarités de leursenfants et parents.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mame Bousso

texts.fr: Mame Bousso F. est née le 02 janvier 1960 à Diourbel, elle est mariée et vit avec son mari au qauartier champs de course à Diourbel. Elle a une expérience de 15 ans dans la vente de légumes. Elle sollicite ce pret pour renforcer son fond de roulement.
texts.en:
Mame Bousso F. was born on January 2, 1960 in Diourbel, is married, and lives with her husband in the Champs de Course district in Diourbel. She has fifteen years of experience in selling vegetables. She is requesting this loan to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell vegetables

loans.name: Hor

texts.en: Mrs. Hor C. is married with three children who live in Kampong Svay Commune, Kampong Thom Province. She fishes with her husband in a local lake in her area which supports them with enough fish for her family. C. always wakes up early in the morning to go fish and is back home in the late evening. She sells the fish that she catches in the lake to customers from her house. Because fishing is the main income in the family, C. needs a loan of 600,000 to purchase more fishing tools such as nets and traps for expanding her fish catching.

loans.use: Hor would like to purchase more fishing tools such as nets and traps for expanding fish catching.

loans.name: Ellada

texts.en: Ellada was born in 1985. She lives in Khachmaz town. 2 years ago she started a beauty salon business. Ellada is single. Now she needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy the necessary things for this beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy the necessary things for this beauty Salon

loans.name: Solidah

texts.en:
Solidah B. sells vegetables and is requesting a loan to purchase more tomatoes. Solidah is 29 years old and married. Her husband is a policeman. She has six children and they all go to school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Man M. is 56 years old and widowed. She lives in Kandal Province, where she runs a little store selling various kinds of groceries such as prepared food, canned food, and sweets for kids. Most of her customers are neighbors. She started her business in 1990, and it is doing very well, and she currently earns approximately of $5 a day. She has three children: two are single and one is married. To help meet the family's expenses, two of her sons are employed as motorcycle taxi drivers.

Man M. hopes to build a washroom, but she is lacking the money to do that. Therefore, she would like to apply for a loan to build a restroom for her family. (She and her son are pictured.)

loans.use: To build a restroom.

loans.name: Naut

texts.en:
Naut S., 33, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She grows rice and raises pigs to earn a living, and is able to make US$2 each day. Her husband, Mao Thy, 36, is a salesman in a busy market, selling various kinds of plates and rice. He makes an average of US$7 per day. The has three children, two of whom are students while the third is too young to attend school.

Mrs. Naut S. is requesting a loan to purchase more land to expand her farming.

loans.use: To purchase land for farming.

loans.name: Akbarhon

texts.ru: Акбархон мужчина в возрасте 39лет имеет 2 детей,жена работает в столовой поваром.Акбархон занимается продажей различных аксессуаров для сотовых трубок и их самих.Он арендует небольшой ларёк в центре Худжанда.У него свои постоянные клиенты , которые крупными партиями закупают его товар и перепродают сами.Акбархон получив займ хочет пополнить свой товар, новыми видами , марками сотовых трубок и и различных аксессуаров.
texts.en:
Akbarhon H. is a 39 year old man with two children, whose wife works as a cafeteria chef. Akbarhon sells various accessories for cellular phones as well as the phones themselves. He rents a small booth in downtown Khudzhand. He has regular customers who buy his goods in large quantities and resell them. Akbarhon wants to use a loan to augment his inventory with new types and brands of cellular phone and various accessories.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Bancomunal Santa Rosa de Villa.
Maria es madre soltera tiene 52 años, cuatro hijos, mayores.
Maria empezó llevando menús a diferentes construcciones, hasta que se presento  para  consignación en una empresa grande en la cafetería, allí estuvo por años, por las tardes se dedicaba a la venta en su carrito  sanwichero 
Desde que esta en Finca Maria aprendió a ahorrar, a ser puntual en sus pagos, aprendió ha invertir a podido comprar un refrigeradora, las reuniones del Bancomunal son muy familiares.   
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para empezar un nuevo negocio de venta de caldo de gallina.
El sueño de Maria es tener un restaurante propio de venta de Caldo de Gallina.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Santa Rosa de Villa Community Bank. She is a single mother, 52 years old, and has four grown children. Maria began bringing home-cooked food to different buildings, until the opportunity arose to work in a big business in the cafeteria. She was there for many years, and in the afternoons she worked selling from her sandwich cart. Since joining Finca, Maria learned to save, to be punctual in her payments, and has learned she needs to invest to be able to buy a refrigerator. The Community Bank meetings are very familiar. Maria needs a loan of 1000 soles to begin a new business selling chicken soup. Maria's dream is to have her own restaurant selling chicken soup.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maria needs a loan of 1000 soles to begin a new business selling chicken soup

loans.name: Vera

texts.en: Vera is married with one son, who is almost 2 years old. Vera sells office supplies at her own small store in a little city named Luchki. She has been in this business for six years. Her income is not big but it is stable. Vera believes she can make her business grow even more by attracting more clients and increasing sales. She would like to borrow 7,000 UAH to increase her inventory. Vera would spend additional income to raise her son.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Сулаймонова  Шарофат 37 летняя женщина, мать троих детей, занимается продажей мелкого ассортимента товаров ( носки, колготки, нижнее бельё ). Муж работает водителем городского маршрутного такси. Его заработная плата хватает на минимальное проживание. Поэтому ему помогает его жена , своим доходом от бизнеса. Шарофат  сама ездит в Бишкек и привозит товар по оптовым расценкам. Также продаёт по цене ниже , чем у других продавцов. Исходя из этого у неё много клиентов, которые закупают товар крупными партиями, кроме этого Шарофат продаёт товар и в розницу.  Для увеличения бизнеса , она решила получить  кредит в Микроинвесте.
texts.en:
Sharofat S. is a 37 year old woman, the mother of three children and sells a small assortment of products (socks, pantyhose, underwear). Her husband works as a driver of a city minibus. His salary is only enough for minimal survival. This is why his wife helps with the income from her business. Sharofat travels by herself to Bishkek and brings back products at wholesale prices. She also sells her products at lower prices than those of other sellers. Because of this, she has a lot of customers who purchase her products in large quantities. In addition, Sharofat sells her products individually. In order to grow her business, she decided to get a loan from MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for sale

loans.name: Jobir

texts.en:
Since he was very young, Jobir M. has been in touch with the countryside. His family has dedicated themselves to cultivating fruits and vegetables. Jobir always imagined he’d be in the business of selling produce. Fortunately, he realized this dream. At the age of 28, he began to sell vegetables in small markets. Little by little, he saved money so he could set up his own shop. Thanks to his efforts and the love he has for this business, Jobir’s business has been growing gradually.

Jobir believes it is time to inject more capital into the business so that he can buy at wholesale and obtain better prices. As a result, he is soliciting a loan of $550, which he will repay in twelve months. With your help, Jobir will be able to move his business forward and offer his wife and five children a better future.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To buy vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena and Alain P. raise their family in a peaceful community located at Barangay Monguia, Dupax Del Norte in the province of Nueva Vizcaya. Both of them are only high school graduates since their parents could not afford to finance their studies in college. In this regard, they plan to send their three children to college for they don’t want them to follow in their steps. They are doing their best to make their ambitions a reality.

Alain, who is her husband, is engaged in the hog-raising business while Rowena manages their sari-sari store (typical community based store) at home. She sells groceries, soft drinks and vegetables. She is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 for her store. She acquires most of her selling products in Bambang Public Market. Rowena is thankful for having at least PHP200 daily income from her business and now she wishes to increase it in the coming days through the support of the lenders.

loans.use: Business Capital

location.town: Monguia, Dupax Del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Genie

texts.en:
“Habang maikli ang kumot matutong mamaluktot” said Genie B.. An idiomatic expression that means: learn to maximize things from limited resources. She further explains that each of us must know how to adjust ourselves in times of crisis and must learn to economize and save for the future. She took this as her own principle in life in order to face challenges. Her family lives in the rural community of Barangay Buliwao Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Elizaldy B. and they are blessed with two children. Her eldest child has already finished a vocational course while her youngest is still studying.

Genie has maintained a hog raising business for many years, while her husband is a driver of a passenger jeepney. The couple aims to increase their standard of living and give their children a better future by continuing to send them to school. Genie is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 7,000 in order to sustain her hog raising business and become progressive in the future. She hopes to buy additional piglets to raise for her business.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets for her business

loans.name: Nnechi

texts.en: Nnechi N. is 46 years old, married, and has 2 children. She retails in medicine to her customers. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN150,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell.

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly S. is from the village of Masabod, in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Jelly is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jelly owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising hogs for sale. Jelly has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 1,800.00 PHP a month from these activities.

In June 2009, Jelly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jelly is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jelly from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Akossiwa Venunye

texts.fr:
Cette femme s’est lancée en 2001 dans le commerce de pagnes, elle exerce son commerce de  façon ambulante et à ce jour elle dispose d’une clientèle élevée et maîtrise son commerce. Son avantage est qu’elle exerce son commerce de façon ambulante ce qui lui permet  de toucher plus de clients et de connaître leurs préférences. Voulant reconstituer son stock elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 20 pagnes de nouvelles qualités.
Elle  est mariée et mère d’un enfant
texts.en:
This woman began selling fabric as a street vendor in 2001, and today she sells her fabrics to a respectable clientele. She has an advantage as a street vendor, because this allows her to sell to more clients and to better understand their preferences. In order to refill her stock of fabric she is asking for a loan from WAGES that will allow her to buy 20 new fabrics. She is married and has one child.

Translated from French by Chloe Mark Translator, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fabric

loans.name: Esther Betsabe

texts.es: Esther Betsabe B. A. vive en Cojutepeque municipio del departamento de Cuscatlán. Esther tiene tan solo 19 años de edad se encuentra acompañada con Walter de 21 años quien trabaja como albañil y da un aporte de $100 US, con ellos vive la madre de Esther quien ayuda a su hija en el negocio. Esther posee una pupuseria la cual es administrada por ella y cuenta con el apoyo de su madre para atender el negocio. Esther obtiene buenos ingresos a través de sus ventas ya que no posee competencia en la zona. Esther solicita este crédito para comprar materia prima que le permita aumentar su producción al igual que sus ganancias.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Siaka

texts.fr:
Monsieur Siaka K. a 36 ans, marié et père de trois enfants, il vit avec sa famille à Noumousso, un des quartiers de la ville de Kadiolo (dans la troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur  K. est dans le domaine du commerce il ya plus d’une année maintenant. Aujourd’hui il commence à se faire un chemin et dispose d’une boutique où il vend des articles tels  le ciment et les céréales.  Très apprécié et sollicité sa clientèle  ne cesse de croitre. 
Alors pour satisfaire cette clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse, il collabore avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Il  est à son troisième prêt  individuel  après avoir correctement remboursés les deux précédents.
Avec ce  prêt, il compte acheter,  50 sacs de ciment et 4 sacs de 100kg de maïs. Il s’approvisionne auprès des commerçants grossistes  à Kadiolo ville et environnants avant de les revendre en détail à une clientèle composée d’hommes, de femmes et surtout de forains.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 65.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers.

loans.name: Florentine

texts.fr: A. Florentine est née le 01/01/1985 à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Florentine est mariée à SESSOUKPE Daniel, un cuisinier. Ce couple a à sa charge cinq enfants tous scolarisés dont trois sont les leurs. La famille réside depuis huit ans à Fridjrossè Kpota, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. C’est le mari de Florentine qui assure les charges de la famille. Florentine mène comme activité la vente de boissons alcoolisées appelées localement SODABI, produit au Bénin. C’est à Agonli, localité spécialisée dans la production de cette boisson que Florentine achète son produit et elle le vend de façon ambulante. Florentine a déjà huit ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Florentine a déjà eu deux crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour  mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle de plus en plus importante, Florentine sollicite un troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
A. Florentine was born on January 1, 1985 in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married to SESSOUKPE Daniel, a cook. This couple has five children to support. Three of them are their own; they are all in school. For eight years, the family has been residing in Fridjrossè Kpota, a district of Cotonou. Florentine’s husband is the one who ensures that family expenses are met. Florentine runs a business selling the alcoholic drink locally called SODABI, which is produced in Benin. Agonli, a town specialized in producing this drink, is where she purchases her merchandise, which she sells door-to-door. She already has eight years of experience in this business. Florentine has had two loans with ALIDé and has repaid them. She was able to use the loans to raise her level of business. To satisfy further the demands of her expanding customer base, she is requesting a third loan to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy five 50-liter drums of the drink SODABI

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie G., 41 years old, raises pigs to help augment their family’s income in support to her husband Jaime, a jail officer. They live in Bagong Silang, Caloocan City. They have three children; the eldest is in high school, another attends pre-school, and the youngest is not yet of school -going age.

Angie has been raising pigs in their backyard for three years now. When the pigs are ready for slaughtering, she brings them to the neighborhood butcher. While waiting for her pigs to mature, she finds time to attend to her other business – selling electronic load credits for mobile phones. She liked this business because she doesn’t need to leave the house every time. Angie earns more than P5,000 net per month from her business activities.

She has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative since 2007. She has just finished repaying her previous loans with said cooperative so she has applied for a new loan in the amount of P12,000 to purchase more electronic load credits to retail to her customers.

Angie dreams of having a mobile phone shop in the future.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: to purchase electronic load credits for retail

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is an energetic businesswoman engaged in vending different snacks in her village. She sells quail eggs and cooked snacks in the afternoon. In addition, she also sells Tupperware products for additional income. She has been in this business for five.  She needs more capital to sell her products.  She is requesting a loan of PHP5,000 from KIVA lenders.

Caridad is 40 years old and married to Jessie, a farmer. They are blessed with five children who are all studying. She aims to succeed in her business to supplement her family’s income. She hopes to give all her children a complete education so that they’ll live a better life someday.

loans.use: To be used as additional capital for business expansion

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad, 32 years old, is from the village of Larion Alto Tuguegarao City where farming is the major source of income of the residents. The couple is blessed with two children and both of them are studying. Her husband Ronald is 39 years old and works as a security guard.

Natividad has been raising pigs for eight years. She engaged in this business with a desire to assist her husband provide the daily needs of their family and send their children to school. They hope that the children will finish their college education. For this reason, Natividad and her husband are working hard for their future welfare. Sometimes her children also help her maintain her hogs, especially during weekends. 

She believes that with their cooperation and patience, a lot of improvement will happen to their business. In this regard, Natividad wanted to ask for additional business capital from the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP10,000. She intends to use the loan to buy a sufficient supply of feed so her hogs will be healthy and free from sickness.

loans.use: To buy feed for her hogs

loans.name: Léa

texts.fr: S. Léa est née en 1971 et est mariée à HOUNSOU Philippe, un mécanicien. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés, dont quatre sont à leur charge. La famille vit à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis 13 ans. Léa vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la maison. Léa n'a pas été à l'école, mais a appris la couture. En plus de ce métier, Léa a une cabine téléphonique et vend également des cartes de recharges téléphoniques et des articles de mercerie à Ekpè. Cela fait trois ans que Léa mène cette activité. Léa s'approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C'est une cliente de ALIDé ayant déjà bénéficié une fois de crédit à ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé. Afin d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et la taille de son activité, Léa sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
S. Léa was born in 1971 and is married to Hounsou Philippe, a mechanic. The couple has six children, all of whom attend school, four of whom are currently in the couple's care. For the past 13 years, the family has lived in Ekpè, in the district of Sèmè-Podji. Léa helps her husband pay for their family's expenses. Léa did not attend school, but learned sewing. In addition to this trade, Léa has a phone booth, sells refill cards of phone credit and also sells a variety of goods for dressmaking in Ekpè. Léa has had this business for the past 3 years. Léa supplies herself in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is a client of ALIDé and has already received one loan, which was fully repaid. In order to grow her business' funds and the size of her business, Léa is requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase dressmaking materials and phone recharge cards

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Nuestra socia NORMA es una madre de familia, tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Ellos viven en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS” de la Asociación Arariwa.

La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza. Ella lleva un catalogo en la mano y ofrece sus productos a sus amigas, vecinas y familiares. Ella hace pedido a la tienda mayorista cuando unos de sus clientes esta interesado en el producto. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital haciendo más pedidos a la tienda mayorista como perfumes, aretes, collares y aretes. 
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our partner Norma is a 37-year-old mother who is married with three children. They live in the imperial city of Cusco. She belongs to the community bank “Manos Juntas” (“Hands Together”) from the Arariwa Association. The partner alternates her household activities with her business of selling beauty products. She carries a catalog with her and offers her products to her friends, neighbors, and relatives. She places orders at the wholesale store when one of her customers is interested in a product. She has worked in this business for several years and it has gone well thanks to all the determination she has put into her work. Our partner is a hardworking mother and entrepreneur who has improved the well-being of her family. She needs the loan to increase her capital, making more orders to the wholesale store for perfumes, earrings, and necklaces. She is very grateful for the opportunity presented to her by these means and for her part she promises to complete her payment according to the timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The partner needs a loan to increase capital, placing orders to the wholesale store for perfumes, earrings, and necklaces

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es: Demetria tiene 39 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora que vive al lado de su pareja y su hija Margot de 5 años.Desde hace un año se dedica la venta de productos de belleza, que les ofrece a sus amigas y a personas conocidas, lo hace buscando un ingreso extra para el sustento de su familia;  ya que gracias a ese trabajo puede sentirse capaz e independiente, además  tiene  la disponibilidad de tiempo para poder distribuirlo entre las labores de su  hogar y el trabajo. A Demetria le gusta vender y ha pensado en ampliar el negocio, ya que en el  futuro quiere aperturar  un bazar donde pondrá vitrinas, entre otros accesorios,  para así vender en mayor cantidad; además de este negocio en las tardes se dedica a vender anticuchos (plato típico peruano hecho a base de corazón de res frito), así transcurren los días en  la vida de Demetria, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación se las ingenia para  salir adelante.Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete ser responsable y puntual en cada una de sus cuotas ya que no quiere quedar mal con la  institución que le brinda confianza.Con el dinero del crédito comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería en productos de belleza para que sus ventas sean mayores durante la campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Demetria, 39, is a hard-working woman who lives with her life partner and her 5-year-old daughter, Margot. For the last year she has sold beauty products to her friends and associates. She does this in order to earn extra income for family expenses. Thanks to this work she feels independent and able; besides, she has time to do it while still taking care of her household duties. Demetria enjoys sales and has thought about expanding her business by opening a store in the future with display cases, among other accessories, to sell a greater amount of product. Besides this line of work, in the early evening she sells anticuchos, a typical Peruvian dish based on fried beef heart. Demetria's days go by thus. With much effort and dedication she manages to forge ahead. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to be vey responsible and punctual with each payment because she doesn't want to fail the institution that has shown confidence in her. With the funds she will buy a greater amount of beauty products so that her sales during the Christmas season will increase.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of merchandise.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La señora Guillermina R. tiene ya más de siete años de dicandose a la venta de abarrotes. 
Está solicitando un préstamo para poner le vitropiso en el negocio, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la mejora. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio de abarrotes en general. 
Desea que su negocio tenga una mejor presentación y así sus clientes se sentirán con más confianza para ir a comprar.
texts.en:
Guillermina R. has had a grocery store for over 7 years. She is asking for funding to install tile flooring in her store because she doesn't have enough capital to make this improvement. She plans to repay the loan with some of her profits from the store. She wants her store to be more presentable so that her customers will feel more attracted to buy from her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install tile flooring in her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is a mature gentleman who is 42 years old. He is married and has four children. He has a diploma and is a sophisticated person. 

He owns a camera shop. He has taken full advantage of his first loan and was able to make some changes to his his shop. His shop is in a convenient location adjacent to the Security Office. He bought a duplicator and other essential materials for his shop with his second loan. He now has permission to borrow more money from Al-Thiqa, because he is dependable. In addition to owning his shop, he also draws and takes photographs, as do his employees.

He purchased most of his merchandise by using the second loan that he received from Al-Thiqa. His income is now higher, which will enable him to bring up four children in tough circumstances. He always avoids being late in order to be a trustworthy customer. He has a acquired a lot of experience in his business.

loans.use: To buy a camera and copy machine

loans.name: Mimasuyanday Group

texts.en: Isatu S., on the right of the photo, is the leader of this group of local entrepreneurs who named their group "Mimasuyanday". They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders for the first time to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person for the purpose of expanding their businesses. Twenty-three-year-old Isatu sells a wide variety of items – fish, soft drinks, bathing soaps, candles, glue, water, etc. She has been a businesswoman for 3 years now. Married to a soldier, they have 2 children; one is in primary school and the other is not of school age. Isatu wants this loan in order to expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items in large quantities.

loans.use: to buy fish, soft drinks, bathing soaps, candles, glue, water, etc.

loans.name: Komla Christophe

texts.en: Komla Christophe F. is 43 years old. He lives and works in the Adidogomé district of Lomé, Togo selling charcoal. He is married to a seamstress and has two children. Mr. F. began this business in 1998 and is now asking for his second loan from WAGES. He will use this loan to purchase 30 sacks of charcoal for resale. This loan will help support both his business and his family.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Bezhan Group

texts.en:
Maleha is the group leader of Bezhan group.  Maleha is single and lives in the 11th district of Kabul, Afghanistan.  She lives in a household that has 5 members.

She wants to take a loan for her beauty salon business. Maleha wants to buy more cosmetics and some needed furniture so she can expand and progress her business and help with her family. She is very happy with this small loan process in Afghanistan that helps the poor people.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and furniture.

loans.name: Ploak

texts.en: Ploak S., 34, is single and resides with her parents in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the famous Angkor Wat Temple. She has a business of selling various kinds of groceries for an income of about USD 4 per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more groceries to stock her store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to expand her current business. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy groceries to stock the store.

loans.name: Ivah

texts.en: Ivah is 34 years old and lives with his wife, daughter and father in Bayan-Ulgii province,Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife, Manat, is a nurse in a local hospital. They have 2-year-old daughter named Aimerei. Ivah operates a taxi service in his town. He purchased a car in 2007 with a XacBank loan. Since that time, he has been successfully operating his taxi service. His daily net profit is between 5,000 – 10,000 tugrugs (~ 3 – 8 USD). Ivah repairs his car monthly and always provides good service to his customers. Previously, Ivah operated a meat trading business between 2005 and 2007. Since he has started his business, his family's quality of life has been improving. He is focused on the future and says, “I would like to expand and renovate my car.” Ivah is requesting a 700,000 tugrug (~  500 USD) loan to purchase four dampers and four tires for his car.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his car

loans.name: Levocatte

texts.en:
Levocatte is 50 years old and married with children between the ages of 3 and 15 years old.  Levocatte is well known for her business selling a variety of goods, mainly cosmetic goods like body lotion, soaps, Colgate (toothpaste), etc. as shown in her photo.  This is her fourth successful year in her business. She works from early in the morning until late in the evening hours.

Levocatte is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her shop by purchasing a large quantity of foodstuffs, mainly rice, peas, beans, wheat, etc.  With this additional business, Levocatte hopes that she will earn more profits to help her take care of her family and keep reinvesting for better progress in her business.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods, mainly cosmetic goods like body lotion, soaps, Colgate (toothpaste), etc.

loans.name: Ayao

texts.fr: ce monsieur est âgé de 33 ans, il est un responsable de famille avec un enfant à sa charge et une femme qui est revendeuse de produits génériques. il fait ce commerce depuis 2009. il s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé dans une boutique. il fait face en une rupture de stock, pour éviter cela et bien satisfaire ses clients, il sollicite de WAGES un prêt pour l'achat de divers produits d'alimentation générale. C'est avec le revenu de son activité qu'il subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who is 33 years old. He is the head of household with one child to support and a wife who is a retailer of generic products. He has been operating his business since 2009 and stocks up from a store at the big market of Lomé. He is facing shortages. To prevent this and to satisfy his customers, he is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy various grocery items. With the revenues from his business, he provides for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying grocery items

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou S. est une femme de 59 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 06 enfants et tutrice d'un garçon et d'une fille confiés par des proches. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SAMBA 15 ANS2 depuis le 17 juillet 2006, date de création dudit Banc Villageois. Elle fait du commerce de tissus, elle va jusqu'au Mali, un pays frontalier au Sénégal pour s'approvisionner en marchandises. La plus part de son produit est vendu à la capital (Dakar) et de là bas elle achète de l'encens pour revendre dans son quartier. Son nouveau crédit lui permettre d'accroître son activité afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices et répondre aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Fatou S. is a 59-year old woman who is a widow and mother to six children; she is also guardian to a boy and a girl who were entrusted to her care by close relatives. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in SAMBA 15ANS2 since 17th July 2006, the date the aforementioned Banc Villageois was set up. She trades in fabrics and goes to Mali, a country which borders on Senegal, to get her supplies. The majority of her products are sold in the capital (Dakar), and there she buys incense to resell in her neighborhood. Her new loan will allow her to grow her business in order to make more money and respond to the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the level of her production

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina O., 72, is a widow from the village of Mapang. She has one adult-aged child.  To make a living, Agustina owns and operates a general store, selling household items in the local community.  Agustina has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Agustina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agustina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 65,000 PHP from PMPC.  Agustina is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP for additional capital for her business. This loan will be her 12th from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

---------------------------------------
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Socorro se dedica a la venta de comida rápida en la vía publica como: pollo frito, tripitas (vísceras de pollo) hace 15 años, Ella tiene 5 hijos pero solo 3 están bajo su cuidado, Como es separada de su esposo y no tiene apoyo económico, tiene que trabajar diariamente con la ayuda de sus hijos.  Socorro es una mujer optimista, así que el préstamo que se le otorgo está destinado a la compra de insumos para su negocio.
Ella esta agradecida a Edaprospo y Kiva por la confianza depositada en ella.
texts.en:
Socorro has been selling fast food on a public street for 15 years. She sells fried chicken and “tripitas” (chicken intestines). Socorro has five children, but only three of them are still under her care. She is separated from her husband and he does not provide financial assistance. Therefore, she must work every day to support her children.

Socorro is an optimistic woman and will use this loan to buy supplies for her business. She is grateful to EDAPROSPO and Kiva for placing their trust in her.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her fast food business

loans.name: San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Sebastián está conformado por tres mujeres ejemplares una de ellas es Erika C. quien desde joven se dediaca a la producion y comercio de buñuelos dulces tradicionales hechos a base de yuca, queso y miel. Ella tiene ocho hijos de los cuales solo dependen de ellas siete de 19.18, 17,14, 11,8 y 3 años de los cuales dos de ellos no estudian la pequeña y la niña de 11con capacidades diferentes. 
Las otras integrantes son Onelia Dávila que se dedica desde hace diez años a la realización de bordados y Miguelina M. quien tiene una zapatería desde hace 15 años.
texts.en:
The group San Sebastián is made up of three exemplary women. One of them is Ericka C. who has been making and selling "buñuelos" (traditional candies made of yucca, cheese and honey) since she was young. Ericka has eight children of whom seven are dependen on her. Their ages are 19, 18, 17, 14, 11, 8 and 3. Her youngest child is not in school and her 11 year old is also not in school because she has special needs. The other members of the group are Onelia Dávila who has been doing embroidery for ten years and Miguelina M. who has had a shoe store for 15 years.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase yuca, cheese and honey

loans.name: Zina's Group

texts.en:
Zina U. is the leader of this group. She is 38 and married. She has a daughter and three sons. The first son studies at university and the others are at school. 

Zina works in a pharmacy and her husband is a tractor driver. A year ago the husband’s sister suggested that Zina should open a pharmacy, and with an initial investment of 10,000 soms she started her business activity. With money received from the loan, Zina wants to purchase a variety of medicines in order to increase the turnover of her business.  In the future she plans to expand her business, contribute some money to her older son’s wedding, and save money to be able to pay for her children’s education. 

Dokturkan T., 53, is married. She has two sons and two daughters. The older son went to work to Russia to earn some money, two daughters are married and live separately with their families, and the youngest son studies at university. A year ago with the initial investment of 10,000 soms Dokturkan purchased nine sheep for breeding. Selling some sheep after fattening, she makes 3000 soms per month. With money received from the loan Dokturkan wants to increase the number of her livestock and purchase five more sheep. 

Sabyrkul E. is the treasurer of the group. She is 50 and married. She has three sons and two daughters. The sons study at university and the daughters are at school. Sabyrkul works in a pharmacy and her husband is a private driver.  In order to cover the family expenses, Sabyrkul and her husband started to breed cattle. Selling some cattle after fattening, they make 5000 soms per month. With money received from the loan Sabyrkul wants to purchase two bulls in order to increase the number of cattle she has. In the future she plans to build a bigger house and purchase a vehicle.

Guluipa K. is 45 and married.  She has three sons and a daughter.  The oldest son went away to work in Russia; the other two sons are at school and the daughter is not yet.  A year ago Guluipa got a loan in the amount of 5000 soms and started to breed livestock. And now selling some sheep after fattening, she makes 3000 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase five more sheep for breeding.  In the future she plans to increase the number of livestock, purchase a vehicle, and save some money to be able to pay for her children’s education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of medicines

loans.name: Kuljamila

texts.en: Kuljamila B. is 53 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Bayan-Ulgiy province of western Mongolia. She and her family have been living at the same location for 30 years. Her husband currently is employed as a construction worker, and all three of her children currently attend universities. Kuljamila operates a dairy product business at the local market in her town. In the summertime, she purchases a variety of dairy products from wholesalers and resells them. Kuljamila started her dairy business in 2000 and has built a stable business over the years. She is a very hardworking businesswoman and uses her earnings to provide for her children's educations. In the future, she hopes to continue to make her business better and plans to one day open her own dairy shop.  Kuljamila is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a surplus of dairy products to sell during the upcoming winter months when prices for such products traditionally rise.

loans.use: To purchase a surplus of dairy products

loans.name: Gregoria Alexandra

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

Aquí conversamos con la señora Gregoria, ella es madre soltera de tres hijos uno mayor y dos pequeñitos por los que ella lucha día a día para sacarlos adelante.

Ella es vendedora ambulante, vende ropa interior de todo tipo pero lo que más vende son interiores de hombres. Trabaja  todos los días en la  terminal terrestre desde las 8 am hasta las 2pm en algunos días  y desde las 12pm hasta las 8pm en otros días. Su mercadería la compra en Picoaza en un lugar donde le dejan a crédito y buen precio, dice que  a pesar de la crisis económica le va más o menos bien.

Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 26 ciclos y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos  y está muy agradecida con la Fundación Espoir por la ayuda que siempre le ha brindado.
