Este crédito lo va emplear para incrementar su negocio, en especial comprar  camisetas interiores que sus clientes le piden mucho.
 
Sus sueños son tener un local con vitrinas y bien surtido.
texts.en:
The community bank named May 3 meets every two weeks in the district of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. The location is known for its commerce, for its traditional feast days of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the generally happy population. Gregoria is a single mother of three children. One is independent and two other little ones that still live with her. She struggles every day to support them. She sells undergarments of all kinds but the product that sells best is men's undergarments. She works every day at the bus station from 8am until 2pm. Some days she works from 12 noon until 8pm. She buys her merchandise in Picoaza where she acquires her items on credit and at a good price. Despite the economic crises her business has fared fairly well. She has been a member of the community bank for the past 26 loan cycles and she enjoys it because the loans are very quickly. She is very grateful to Fundacion Espoir (Kiva Field Partner) for the support they have provided her. This loan will be used to increase her business, especially to purchase t-shirts, product that is always in high demand. Her dreams are to have a well stocked store equipped with display cases.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase undergarments and t-shirts.

loans.name: Enrique Alexander

texts.es:
Enrique es un padre de familia de 34 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Pacasmayo, ubicado en la provincia del mismo nombre, en la región La Libertad, a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace mas de diez años a la comercialización de pescado fresco, el compra su mercadería en el terminal pesquero de Santa Rosa, ubicado en el distrito del mismo nombre que pertenece a la región Lambayeque (ubicado a casi tres horas de la zona en donde vive), y luego la distribuye en los principales mercados de la ciudades de Pacasmayo y San Pedro de Lloc. Esta actividad le permite contar con los ingresos necesarios para hacerse cargo de la economía de su familia por lo que siempre trata de mantenerla para sacarla adelante.

Enrique desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas pescado fresco para aumentar su nivel de ventas y percibir mas ganancias, para lograr su meta ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1700 nuevos soles.

El es una persona entregada a su trabajo y que siempre trata de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Enrique, 34, is a father living with his family in Pacasmayo district, Pacasmayo province, La Libertad region, located over two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. He has been a fresh fish merchant for over 10 years. He buys his merchandise in Santa Rosa’s fishing terminal located in Santa Rosa district which is also part of Lambayeque region. It’s located almost three hours away from the area where he lives. He then takes it to sell at the main markets in the cities of Pacasmayo and San Pedro de Lloc. This activity provides necessary income for him to be able to meet family expenses so he always exerts his best effort to see it succeed. Enrique would like to expand his business buying more fresh fish to increase sales levels and thus earn more profits. To reach this goal he has deemed it advantageous to request a 1700 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa. He is a person who is dedicated to his work and is always seeking ways to improve his family’s quality of life. He has had previous financings with Edpyme Alternativa and has been responsible and punctual with his repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
This is Lorna D. C., 39, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Nolan D. C., a driver, and mother of three children, two of whom are already in college while the youngest child is still enrolled in high school. By the grace of God, Lorna has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send all of them all the way through college. A dream for most Filipino parents like Lorna as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Lorna maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are counting on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Lorna dreams to be able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: buying items ordered by customers

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda A. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 47 years old, married, and has 5 children. Her eldest child is 28 years old while the youngest is 20. Minda is engaged in farming and a hog-raising business. Before, she only earned through farming. When she joined CEVI, a microfinance institution in the Philippines and a partner of KIVA, her income from farming improved and she was able to start her own piggery. She hopes to be able to manage both the farm and the piggery so she can earn more and provide for her family.

Minda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase feed and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase feed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Hermogenes

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MERCAMUEBLE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Hermogenes; el tiene 53 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 2 hijos; el socio se dedica a realizar diferentes tipos de muebles, el tiene una carpintería donde realiza sillas, mesas y camas y después los vende en diferentes ferias de la ciudad de Cusco, el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 a.m, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como madera, telas y pegamentos para hacer los muebles. 


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Hermogenes, 53, is single and has two children.  He is a member of the “MERCAMUEBLE” communal bank located in Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

He manufactures different kinds of furniture.  He has a carpentry shop where he makes chairs, tables and beds for subsequent sale in various markets in Cusco.  He works from 7am until 6pm.  He wants to expand the business and is asking for funds to buy such materials like: wood, fabric and adhesives to make the furniture.

He thanks all those who share in his dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy materials like wood, fabric and adhesives to manufacture furniture.

loans.name: Lois

texts.en: Lois D. is 45 years old and is married with a husband that is a soldier.She has 3 children. Lois is currently in the business of selling beer at a bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, Lois hopes to be able to build up a house.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah C. is a 42-year-old business lady married to Joseph C., a public transport driver.  They both work to support the family. She has seven children between the ages of 17 and 2 years old. 

Sarah is a resident of Kipsirichet centre, 3 km from Londiani Town, Kericho district served by the Kadet Koibatek office. She runs a general product kiosk at Kipsirichet centre and also sells clothes in small quantities.

This will be Sarah's first loan from KADET, totaling 15,000 KES. She intends to use 8,000 KES of the loan to restock her shop and use the remaining amount of 7,000 KES to buy young chicks (broilers and layers).

She anticipates using her profits to purchase more chicks to boost her income in the future. Her hopes are for her poultry business to grow, so that she will be supplying broilers and eggs to Londiani, Kericho, and other nearby towns.

loans.use: To purchase goods for the store and to buy poultry

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old. Agnes is single. To make a living, Agnes owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk food in the local community. Agnes has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Agnes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Agnes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Agnes is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like biscuits & beverages. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Agnes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like biscuits & beverages

loans.name: Rosa Gladys

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PADRE ETERNO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Rosa; La socia tiene 45 años de edad, es casada; la socia trabaja en la Instituto Nacional de Cultura, la socia paralelamente trabaja vendiendo ropa, ella suele viajar en las vacaciones para la ciudad de Lima y trae de las fábricas de ropa, ella trabaja vendiendo a sus compañeros en su institución, la socia también tiene a una de sus hermana en Lima y le envía novedades y ropas cuando ella le solicita. La socia requiere el préstamo para viajar y traer mercadería de verano. La socia solicita el préstamo para hacer de el un capital para la compra de ropa al por mayor.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: This member belongs to the "Eternal Father" community bank which is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco. Her name is Rosa. She is 45-years-old and is married. She works at the National Institute of Culture and also sells clothing. She travels on holidays to the city of Lima and brings her clothing with. There she sells to her coworkers at the Institute. Rosa also has a sister in Lima and sends new clothing when asked. She is requesting the loan so she can travel and buy summer merchandise and to purchase wholesale clothing.  Rosa is happy with the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy wholesale clothing

loans.name: Rex

texts.en:
Rex D. is from the village of Mapuroc San Mateo. He is 37 years old. Rex is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rex owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rex has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rex joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rex is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rex from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young plants to raise

loans.name: Hilda Yaneth

texts.es: Hilda Yaneth L. A.:Inicio su negocio hace 10 años vediendo blusas de tela variada, cuando ella se caso con su esposo empesaron a confeccionar blusas,con dos maquinas conforme paso el tiempo compraron mas maquinas y asi mismo tener mas venta, actual mente tiene 2 hijos y cuenta con pedidos desde la capital, y an incrementado sus ventas, su sueño es seguir luchando y aumentar sus ventas y ser grandes confeccionistas de blusas hasta poder exportarlos.
texts.en:
Hilda Yaneth López A. started her Business 10 years ago selling blouses of assorted fabrics.  When she got married she and her husband started manufacturing blouses with two sewing machines.  As time went by, they bought more machines and increased sales.  

She currently has two children and has standing orders all the way from the capital.  Her sales have increased and her dream is to continue fighting and increase sales  becoming major blouse manufacturers even exporting them eventually.

loans.use: To buy clothes making fabric.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a married woman who lives in Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store. Her husband Rony, who is 43 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have no children. Nora joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nora has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 9,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 1/000 after paying her amortization and less expense, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000 to use as additional capital for her sari-sari store so that she can continue to save up for future expansion of her business. Nora is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: Additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima M., from Labuyo Tangub City, is 53 years old, married and has three grown children. To make a living, Felicisima owns and operates a business venture providing motor transport services. Engaged in her venture for over 15 years, she earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month.

In 2009, Felicisima joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from GDMPC, she is now requesting her third loan for 15,000 PHP to repair a vehicle for better service. Felicisima plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair vehicle for better service

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a 51-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a sari-sari store and a farming business. She lives in San Carlos, Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari store and farming business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3,500. 

Edna is borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can buy stocks to sell in her general store. This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Edna aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to buy stocks for the general store

loans.name: Jenila

texts.en:
Jenila is a married woman with three children who are all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jenila is 47 years old. 

Jenila has a selling of dry goods business in the Philippines. Jenila requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional dry goods and plastic ware.

Jenila has been in this business for 15 years.  In the future, Jenila would like to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional dry goods and plastic ware

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 38 years old and lives in the Congo Town area. She dropped out of elementary school in grade one. Her husband is presently not working and  he, along with their five children, depend on her for a livelihood. 

Annie is selling food items in a local market, she sells fufu (starchy dumplings made from cassava, yam, plantain or rice that are eaten with soup or stew), oil, and pepper amongst other things. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, and fufu for her business. 

She hopes to build her own house and improve her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice and fufu for her business

loans.name: Maria Leonor

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 52 años de edad que vive con su hijo en una casa propia de condición humilde, en el distrito de Monsefú, Lambayeque. María vive en una zona urbana dentro de una comunidad cuya gente se caracteriza por ser gente emprendedora con muchos  deseos de salir adelante.

Desde hace 20 años María se encarga de venderle a los monsefuanos (oriundos de Monsefú)  productos para sus desayunos como salchichas, jamones, quesos, mantequilla, etc .Es decir embutidos y otros alimentos necesarios para complementar los banquetes matutinos. El negocio de María se encuentra ubicado en  una esquina estratégica de la zona donde circulan los transportistas  y es por ello que ella conoce muy bien de su negocio y tiene una clientela ya establecida. 

María solicita un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa, para comprar una congeladora  con la que pueda mantener en buenas condiciones sus embutidos  y además comprar más productos ya que por ser tan conocida en la zona , su demanda ha aumentado  en los últimos días. Los productos que María brinda son muy requeridos porque son de muy buena calidad.

María cuenta con un buen comportamiento de pagos, anteriormente manejó siete créditos cancelados  puntualmente.
texts.en:
María is a 52-year-old woman living with her son in her own humble abode in Monsefú District, Lambayeque.  María lives in an urban zone within a community whose residents are noted for being enterprising people with a strong drive to get ahead.

For the last 20 years María has been selling “Monsefuanos” (people from Monsefú) breakfast items like sausage, ham, cheese, butter, etc.  That is, cured meats and other food items needed to complement their breakfast banquets.  María’s business is located on a strategic corner busy with transportation providers so María knows her business very well and has a well established clientele.

María is asking for a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy a freezer to keep her cured meats in good condition and also to buy more products because, since she’s so well known in the area, demand has increased recently.  The items María provides are in high demand because they are of very good quality.

María has good repayment behavior.  She has managed seven previous loans and has repaid them on time.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and more cured meats for her business.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 44, married, and has seven children. With five children in school, Rosalina works very hard to provide for them. 

Rosalina runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy items like canned goods, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store. 

Rosalina has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as egg, canned goods, sugar and other groceries. 

In the future Rosalina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to collge.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods and groceries to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman with three children.  The oldest child is 26 years old.  

Edna is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del Sur. She has been growing rice for 30 years. She earns 4,000 PHP per month doing farming.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other farm inputs. In the future, she hopes to be successful in her livelihood and in her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a married parent of 2 children, Virginia works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (variety) store and food vending.  Virginia is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for motorcycle maintenance.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase materials for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: 8 Liên Hà - Hoằng Thanh - Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Ms. Hoà is applying for a loan to improve her business. She works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle.

Hoà is 23 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 8 Liên Hà - Hoằng Thanh - Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. Hoà lives with her two dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2007, Hoà joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hoà has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hoà has been involved in this business for three years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hoà hopes to provide for her kids, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby pigs to raise and livestock-feed.

loans.name: Redentor

texts.en:
Redentor, 39 years old, lives in the rural village of Ilagan. He is a simple and hardworking man and lives in his own house with his wife, Cielito. They have been married for 16 years. They have two wonderful children. 

Redentor has been engaged in growing rice for 10 years and puts into practice everything he learned from his parents. He plants twice a year. The first period is during the rainy season, when crops grow without having to be watered, and the second is in the watering season, when they grow with the help of irrigation.

What he enjoys most about his work is taking care of his produce, because he feels like he has done a good job each harvest time when he goes to the wholesale market in town. He also has a cow that he uses to plow the fields. He plows for his own farm and for others' also who pay him extra money, around 150 Philippine pesos (PHP) per day. He is now preparing to plant the rice, and he is hoping for a good harvest.

He belongs to one of the leading microfinance institutions in the Philippines, Alalay Sa Kaunlaran Inc. (ASKI), where he counts on the help of the lenders to assist him in his business. He is committed to paying back the loan on time. Redentor is requesting a loan of 17,000 PHP. The loan will be used to buy various sacks of organic fertilizer to begin planting his rice.

In the future, Redentor dreams of having a small store to earn extra income for his family, to be able to meet all their needs.

loans.use: to buy various sacks of organic fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is a married man with eleven children; four children attend school while seven have graduated from school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling from door to door to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality especially during the cold rainy season when the availability of customers is low. 

With the Kshs 10,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Vuqar

texts.en: Vuqar  is a small business retailer. He sells different kinds of home products. He is 41, married and has four children. He has about three years of experience in sales. He applied for a 1000 AZN loan in order to purchase more goods and expand his business. Vuqar is promising to pay back on time.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in West Point, Liberia. She is 38 years old and has a third grade education. She is married to a police officer and has five children between eight and 24 years old. Some are in school and some live at home.

For the past five years Sarah has been selling slippers. The problem she is facing is a small inventory. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 LRD to buy more slippers to sell.

Sarah’s hope is to build a house and send all of her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more slippers to sell.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora D. 57 años D. edad, vive con su esposo en su casa propia, sushijos viven independientemente, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana D. la provincia D. Chiclayo.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad comercial, transporte público y turismo.

DesD. hace 10 años aproximadamente Dora se ha dedicado a la venta D. abarrotes (productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos), verduras D. todo tipo y bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en un puesto que tiene en el mercado D. lamisma zona donD. vive, con las ganancias por la venta D. sus productos  trata D. cubrir  todos sus gastos y necesidades D. su casa.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  D. 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías para abastecer su negocio, con el único objetivo D. que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos que ofrecerles a sus clientes;  para cubrir su préstamo y sus obligaciones.  Dora es una mujer dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por tener más comodidades para su familia al igual que mejorar económicamente.
texts.en:
57-year-old Dora lives with her husband in her own home.  Their children live independently.  Dora's home has all basic services and is located in the urban area of Chiclayo province.  This area is noted for its commercial activity, public transport and tourism.

For ten years Dora has sold groceries (everyday products such as milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna and eggs), all types of vegetables, and drinks.  Her business in located in the local market.  She uses the profits she makes from selling her products to cover all her household expenses and needs.

In order to expand her business, Dora has requested a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She will buy more merchandise to stock her business.  Her sole aim is to grow her business and have more products to offer her customers.  This will enable her to repay her loan and meet her obligations.  Dora is a committed and hard-working woman who works to proviD. her family with more comforts in life and improve her financial situation.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to stock her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora María, trabaja como profesora además de ser artesana. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción (estuco, pinturas, enchufes para electricidad, etc.) ya que realizará el acabado de su casa que ha estado construyendo por fases. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Las Lomas en la ciudad de La Paz, es casada y  tiene un hijo. Maria es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2006 y esta es la tercera vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva, por su excelente historial de pagos y las condiciones del crédito que mejoran cuando el crédito se coloca a través de los financiadores de Kiva.
texts.en:
María works as a teacher and she’s also a craftswoman.  She needs the loan to buy building materials and supplies (stucco, paint, electrical sockets, etc.) because she will finish building her house in stages.  She lives in her own house located in the city of La Paz’s Las Lomas zone.  She’s married and has a son.  

María has been an IMPRO client since 2006 and this is the third time her loan will be channeled through Kiva because of her excellent payment history and because the loan conditions improve when the loan is placed through Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy stucco, paint and electrical sockets.

loans.name: Mery Estanislada

texts.es:
Mery tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y madre de cuatro hijos, reside en el municipio de La Vega en el departamento de Santa Bárbara, y se dedica a la venta de mercaderia.

Mery inició vendiendo ropa para niños y adultos de forma ambulante y lo hizo por 12 años consecutivos hasta que en el año 2003 pudo obtener su propio local. Aprendió de una de sus primas y actualmente trabaja de manera independiente. Su horario de atencion al cliente inicia desde las 8:00 am y culmina a las 8:00 pm. Para comprar la mercaderia que vende en su pequeña tienda viaja hasta la ciudad de San Pedro Sula porque encuentra precios comodos y de esa manera puede ofrecerles a sus clientes precios baratos. De vez en cuando le va mal con la recuperacion del dinero de la mercaderia que da al credito pero a pesar de eso sigue adelante.

Mery solicita el prestamo para la compra de mercaderia como zapatos, ropa de niños y adultos, sandalias, zapatos, cosmeticos, entre otros productos. Con el apoyo del prestamo ella podrá surtir de mas y variados estilos y sus clientes tendran diferentes opciones para elegir.

Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio y convertir su tienda en una de las mejores de la zona, para tener una vida digna y darle una mejor condicion de vida a sus hijos. Este es su segundo ciclo en FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas de forma puntual y espera seguirlo haciendo.
texts.en:
Mery is 43 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in the town of La Vega in the Santa Barbara department.  She works selling merchandise.

Mery began selling clothing for children and adults as a street vendor.  She did this for twelve years, until 2003, when she was able to obtain her own store.  She learned from one of her cousins and now works on her own.  She serves customers from 8:00am until 8:00pm.  To purchase the merchandise she sells in her small store, she travels to the city of San Pedro Sula because she gets good prices there and she can then offer her customers lower prices.  Once in a while she is not able to recover money for goods bought on credit, but in spite of this, she continues ahead.

Mery is asking for this loan to purchase merchandise such as shoes, clothing for adults and children, sandals, cosmetics, and other products.  With the support of this loan, she will be able to stock more and varied styles and her customers will have more choices.

Her goal is to grow her business and make her store one of the best in the area so that she can have a dignified life and give her children a better way of life.  This is her second loan cycle with FAMA and she has repaid her past loan on time and she hopes to continue doing so.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, clothing, cosmetics, and other items.

loans.name: Ablavi Mathilde

texts.fr:
Ablavi est une femme âgé(e) de 39 ans. Elle est mariée à un chauffeur avec 02 enfants en charge.
Ablavi travaille comme revendeuse de produits pharmaceutiques et des parfums depuis 1996. 
Elle est aidée par 01 personne et vend les produits dans un marché de la place après achat à Lomé et au Ghana.
Ablavi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des gammes multiples de parfum
Ablavi voudrait voir ses enfants prospérer et aider son mari.
texts.en:
Ablavi is a 39-year-old woman.  She is married to a driver and has two children in her care.  Ablavi has been working as a re-seller of pharmaceutical products and perfumes since 1996.  She is helped by one person and sells her products in a market after buying them in Lomé and in Ghana.

Ablavi has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy multiple lines of perfume.  She would like to see her children do well and help her husband.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical products and perfumes

loans.name: Angélica Maria

texts.es: Angélica madre soltera, humilde, su objetivo es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda poco a poco, con el préstamo anterior recibido lo invirtió en el cambio de techo que estaba en mal estado y se le pasaba el agua.  Mejorando la condiciones que estaba. Con este ciclo de préstamo será para la compra de materiales de construcción como: Cemento, arena, piedrín, hierro, tablones, estribu, entre otros materiales para repechar las paredes y levantar una pared de la casa que está cubierta con laminas de zinc viejas siendo de gran peligro ya que es la que da a la calle. Así estará con mayor seguridad y tendrá la tranquilidad que su hija estará bien cuando ella no esté en casa. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo continua al desarrollo de su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Angélica is a humble, single mother.  Her goal is to gradually improve the infrastructure of her home.  She invested her previous loan in replacing her roof which was in a bad state of repair and let in water.  She thereby improved the condition of her house.  This loan cycle, she will buy building materials such as cement, sand, gravel, iron, boards, supports etc. to carry out some work on her walls and also to re-build a wall in her home which is covered with old sheets of corrugated metal.  It is very dangerous as it is the wall which faces the street.  This will make her safer and she will have more peace of mind knowing that her daughter will be fine when she isn't at home. Angélica thanks the financial institution for the continual support that they give her in improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Milka

texts.es: Milka tiene 40 años, es una mujer trabajadora y muy alegre. Vive en compañía de sus tres hijos a los que quiere mucho y son su motivación para salir adelante. La actividad que realiza Milka es la venta de pescado, para esto cuenta con un pequeño puesto en el mercado informal de Bellavista. Pero sus productos lo consigue en el puerto fluvial de Yarinacocha, que desde muy temprano lo adquiere para luego llevarlo a su puesto de venta. Ha sabido ganarse a su clientela, pues es muy alegre atendiéndolos y eso le ha dado ventaja para sus ventas. Tiene doce años trabajando continuamente y ahora con la ayuda de sus hijos no deja de vender. Ella esta a gusto con su negocio, pues le genera ganancias, que le permite pagar los estudios de sus hijos. Sus hijos son su mayor motivación y le animan a seguir esforzándose. Considera rentable su negocio ya que cuenta con regular clientela que le compran su producto. Este sería el primer crédito con la institución MFP, se siente contenta con la oportunidad que le dan, asimismo manifiesta que será puntual en sus pagos para poder acceder a más préstamos futuros. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de más pescado.
texts.en: Milka is 40 years old. She is a very happy and hard-working woman. She lives with her three children. She loves them very much and they are her motivation for making progress. Milka has a business selling fish. She has a small stall in the informal Bellavista market. However, she gets her products from Yarinacocha’s river port. She gets these products very early, so can take them to her stall. She has been gaining customers and she is very happy to have them. This has given her an advantage for her sales. She has been continuously working for twelve years. Now, with the help of her children, she hasn’t stopped selling. She is pleased with her business. It generates money that allows Milka to play for her children’s studies. Her children are her main motivation and they encourage her to continue to put in a lot of effort. She considers her business to be profitable now that she has regular customers who buy her products. This will be her first loan with MFP organization. She is happy about the opportunity given to her. She will be punctual with her payments in order to obtain other loans in the future. With the requested loan, she will invest in the purchase of more fish.

loans.use: purchase more fish.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
At her age of 61, Dominga is still strong and determined to acquire income and provide sustenance for her family. She is a widow and has four children. To make a living, Dominga raises hogs to fatten and breed and in future sell to butchers. At present, she had three pigs to sustain. Dominga has been in this business for five years and earns approximately P7,000 whenever she can dispose of a pig. 

Dominga is now asking for a loan of P17,000 to buy hog feed, medicines and vaccines for her hogs sustainability. She had insufficient funds so she is asking for a loan and she wants to provide good nutrition for her hogs to offer them at a higher cost upon sale. 

Despite her status in life, Dominga still aims to keep growing as an entrepreneur and in future achieve financial independence.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, medicines and vaccines.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is married with 3 children. Thelma is 68 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Thelma is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan of 15,000 to  purchase fertilizer for her rice crops.

Thelma has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Thelma hopes to save money for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her rice crops.

loans.name: Herwin Edgardo

texts.es:
El señor Herwin tiene 44 años de edad, vive en el barrio el Porvenir y se dedica a la venta de leña, Herwin  es muy trabajador, tiene 5 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de leña, en la actualidad se a quedado con poca leña y no tiene el capital suficiente para abastecerse de nuevo.
Junto a el vive su esposa y su hijo, el es muy responsable y honrado, trabaja muy fuerte para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Herwin is 44 years old, he lives in the El Porvenir neighborhood and he engages in selling firewood. Herwin is a very hardworking man, and he has been engaged in this activity for 5 years. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy firewood: his stock has run down, and he has not enough money to buy new firewood.
He lives together with his wife and child. He is a deeply responsible and honest man, and he works very hard to provide his child with a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy firewood.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a 47-year-old, married woman. She has two children: one is 22 years old, and the other is 13 years old.

For ten years, she has been operating a sari-sari (general) store business. At her store, Nelia sells canned goods, chips and various other products, and she cooks food to sell to her customers. Nelia explains that she does her best to support her family.

Nelia has requested a loan to buy additional meat, vegetables and other items to sell, including canned goods and soft drinks. Nelia hopes to expand and improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional meat, vegetables and other items (e.g., canned goods and soft drinks) to sell.

loans.name: Yourn

texts.en: Yourn is widowed and resides with four children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. One of her children runs a business selling utensils in the market and three more children are employed at the garment factory. Yourn is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to raise capital for her son's business by buying more utensils to sell. In the future, she would like to renovate her house and purchase a small truck for carrying utensils to sell.

loans.use: to raise capital for her son's business by buying more utensils to sell.

loans.name: Camelo

texts.en:
Camelo is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. 

Camelo is a fisherman and sells his catch to the local community in the public market. He has been doing this for twelve years. He requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy materials he needs for fishing.

Camelo has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Camelo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy materials he needs for fishing.

loans.name: 06. Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dung operates a food stall selling roll of pork. She is requesting a loan to purchase pork to make roll of pock to resell.
 
Dung is 54 years old and she is married and has 2 children. Dung is the group leader of the 06.09.06-Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. Dung lives with 2 dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Dung's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Dung has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Dung faces in her business is the lack of capital. In the future, Dung hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase pork to make roll of pork to resell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 50 year old mother who has three children. They are currently living in a rural community and make their living through farming. 

Gloria aims to improve her hog-raising business to generate sufficient income in order to help in sustaining the necessities of her family and to finance the education of her youngest child. 

Having insufficient capital, Gloria would like to avail an additional  PHP7,000.00 to buy additional piglets, hog feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her hogs. She hopes and believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve her business someday.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, hog feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her hogs.

loans.name: Flor De Maravillas 2 Group

texts.en:
Lorenza is twenty six years old, she is illiterate. Her parents did not give her education because they told her that women were only to have children. They only gave the opportunity to study to her male siblings.
At the age of twelve she began working, she joined with her couple and had her first child at the age of fifteen, now she has four children.
Now her life is better she does not suffer as before, only her husband works at the farm, she works in her store, selling staple products, with her new credit she will expand her business buying more products as chicken meat, groceries, cookies, sugar, flour.
Lorenza is the leader of Flor de Maravillas Group 2 (Flower of Wanders). The group is integrated by six women, two are from the Ixil Maya ethnicity, one from Qánjob’al Maya ethnicity and one is Ladino. The group will use their loans for agriculture, manufacture and retail, each with 33%. On average each member of the group has 5 children, their average age is forty one years old, 100% of the group is illiterate. The average amount of their loans is Q3,256.

loans.use: To expand her store buying chicken meat, eggs, groceries, cookies, sugar, flour

loans.name: Emil

texts.en:
Emil was born in 1982 year in Sumgait. After military service he could not continue his education. Because the family condition was very heavy. He is 24 years old. Emil has rented very small place near the market, has been busy with program service of mobile phones and sales of phone accessories. He do not have enough funds and he wants first loan from KIVA, to develop his business well enough. 
He applies for the loan $700 to expand his business area.

loans.use: To expand his business area

loans.name: Maimoana

texts.en:
Maimoana lives in the small Samoan village of Vaimoso. She runs the only shop in her area and provides necessary food and goods for local villagers. Maimoana has used previous SPBD loans to finance the growth of her village store. The success of her business is tangible and has greatly contributed to enhancing the lives of her family.

Maimoana’s husband is a wage earner at one of the Samoan shipping companies, and with their dual income, they have been able to provide a good education for each of their five children. Three of their children are now grown and have been able to secure good jobs, and the other two remain in school. Additionally, Maimoana’s entrepreneurial success has allowed her family to begin construction of a brick house, which represents a big step up in her family’s living conditions. Providing an additional loan to Maimoana will enable her to extend her shop still further, contributing to continued financial success for her and her family.

loans.use: Re-stock her village shop

loans.name: Tukhta

texts.ru:
Galamova, Tuhta has been in business for 12 years and an active member of “Microinvest” for 5 years. She is married with 5 children. She started her business by baking bread and selling it to her neighbors. After joining “Microinvest”, she began to sell bread in the central market “Panchshanbe”. She is asking for $1,000 to expand her business. Her son is shown in the photograph because she was at home baking bread at the time

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Джамолова Тухта в бизнесе 12 лет из них 5 лет является активной клиенткой Микроинвест. Она замужем, имеет 5 детей. Начинала свой бизнес с того, что выпекала лепешке в тандыре и продавала их своим соседям. После вступления Микроинвест, она начала продавать лепешки в центральном рынке «Панчшанбе». Она запрашивает 1000$ для расширения своего бизнеса. P.S. на фотографии ее сын, так как в это время она дома пекла лепешки.

loans.use:
To expand business

расширения бизнеса.

loans.name: Holniso

texts.en: S. Holniso has been trading for six years. She is currently married and has three children. She trades candies and cakes. She became a client of Microinvest in 2003 and her first loan was $100. Gradually, she increased her loan amount to $1000. Her turnover is fast, and she has many consistent and constant clients. These two summer months were very profitable for Holniso, because it is usually wedding time in Tadjikistan. Presently she plans to purchase the next batch of candies and cakes for the autumn months. She is requesting a loan of $500 for this.

loans.use: Business developing

loans.name: Mele

texts.en: Mele is a 49-year old mother of five children. She is married and joined SPBD two years ago. She heard about the program through her fellow villagers, and she decided to join. Mele and her family have been living on their plantation, which is their main source of income, for a long time. This is Mele's 3rd loan with SPBD and she believes the financial support she has been receiving has allowed her family to make ends meet. They have renovated their home. Mele is planning to export her taro overseas which she believes will generate a great source of extra income.

loans.use: To buy gromoxone chemicals (weed killer), fertilizers, wheelbarrow, and other supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Amirhamza

texts.ru:
Amirhamza S., 28, owns a taxi car. He drives it for 2 years servicing the residents of Dushanbe. At present, his car runs on gas, but, with gas prices rising every month, Amirhamza plans to use this loan to convert his car to run on natural gas. He plans to repay the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Сайдалиев Амирхамза, возраст – 28 лет, образование среднее. Амирхамза имеет собственный автомобиль на котором уже в теченние 2-х летзанимается оказанием услуг такси для жителей города Душанбе. На полученный кредит Амирхамза хочет купить и установить на своё автотранспортное средство газовое оборудование. Так как цены на бензин постоянно растут это негативно сказывается на его бизнесе, так как постоянно приходится поднимать цену за проезд, что вызывает недовольство у пассажировю. Установив газовое оборудование, жители города передвигающиеси на такси получат возможность это делать по приемлемам ценам, а Амирхамза будет предоставлять свои услуги , каждый раз объясняя клиенту почему повысилась цена за проезд. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 8 месяцев.

loans.use: Installation of natural gas fuel system

loans.name: Faia

texts.en: Faia is a 55 year old married mother.  She happily  give supports to her husband by working their taro plantation  six days of the week. She hardly ever asks her family living overseas for a financial support because she takes 3-4 bags of taro to the market twice a week and earns more than $300 WST ($120 USD) a month. She requests a loan to keep taking her children to school and to extend her 4 acre taro plantation.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy G. is a 30-year-old mother of two very young sons.  Her husband works as a chauffeur with her father in a competitive business.  They began this business with the initial investment from her husband’s savings.

They wish to expand the services of the business and refreshments for their clients.  The loan she is asking for will allow her to buy drinks like beer and soda, and other food goods for the customers to purchase. 

This is a young couple working together in their growing business.  They have the entrepreneur spirit and hope to provide more for their two children in the future.

loans.use: To buy wine, beer, sugar and other food goods.

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en: Elshan M. is a 33-year-old trader who sells food, cosmetics, perfume and other goods in his small store in a small village in the Saatli region. He has five years of experience in this field. The income he has is just enough to cover his family's needs but his wish is to expand the number of products he sells, because demand for perfume and cosmetics is very high. For this purpose he applied for a loan of $1100.

loans.use: To expand number of products

loans.name: Ailina Julia

texts.pt:
Ailina Júlia Parkin was born in the city of Maputo. She is 25 years old, married and mother of a 2 year old girl. She was able to study until the 12th grade. From 1994 to 1995 she worked at Tiger as a sales associate. In 2004, she worked at Petromoc as a cashier for 1 year. Since 2006 she has been working at GALP as a cashier. Ailina’s life has been difficult because of her low salary, but with her husband’s help they have been able to support the family.

She was introduced to HLUVUKU ADSEMA through friends and neighbors. She is requesting a loan of 15.000mt to buy construction material for her home. In the future she plans on requesting another loan to buy furniture and improve the home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 07 - Boane Cliente: Ailina Julia Parkin Actividade: Habitação Valor de empréstimo: 15.000,000 Aplicação: Compra de Material de Construção Inicio: 29/02/2008 Fim: 30/06/2009 Ailina Júlia Parkin Nasceu na Cidade de Maputo a 25 anos, casada e mae de uma filha de dois anos, teve oportunidade de estudar ate a 12ª classe. De 1994-1995 trabalhou na TIGER como promotora de vendas. Em 2004 trabalhou na Petromoc como caixa durante 1 ano. De 2006 ate então trabalha na GALP com a função de caixa e servente. Explica que a vida tem sido muito dificil, devido o nivel salarial que as empresas tem oferecido, mas com ajuda do esposo, ambos tem conseguido superar as dificuldades maiores. Conhece a HLUVUKU ADSEMA graças a conversa com vizinhos e amigos.

Nunca havia trabalhado com instituições de credito e pela 1ª vez solicita um emprestimo de 15.000,000MT cuja aplicaçao sera na compra de materiais diversos para conclusao da residencia familiar. A perspectiva futura e ter outro credito para a compra de bens de apetrechamento da sua residencia.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Cristobalina

texts.en:
Cristobalina is a young entrepreneur and mother of a unique three-year old son. Each day, she goes to a butcher shop to bulk-buy meat and then resells it to people in her community.
Shortly after her son’s birth, Cristobalina had to leave her studies to take care of him, but would like to resume her education and one day become a professional.
She will use her loan to buy more meat to increase her sales volume and move her business forward with this goal in mind.

loans.use: Purchase of fresh meat to resell in her community.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita sells soft drinks and beer wholesale and retail. Her store is located in her house, and has been operational for 6 years. She says that her best selling product is beer.

With this loan, she will be able to continue investing in her store and will restock it well with beverages. She will also acquire a refrigerator. With the earnings from her sales, she helps her children.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Margarita se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y cervezas al por mayor y menor. Su tienda está ubicada en su misma casa y ya tiene funcionando 6 años. Ella dice que la cerveza es lo que más vende.

Con los préstamos que ha obtenido ha podido seguir invirtiendo en su tienda y comprar más bebidas. Además, pudo adquirir una heladera. Con las ganancias de sus ventas, ella ayuda a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy more beverages and acquire a refrigerator.

loans.name: Llegando Lejos (Going Far) Groups 1 & 3

texts.en:
Eugenia, the group leader, has five children, ages 2, 6, 7, 11 and 16. She lives in a batey (which is a very poor community) of Haitian families in El Seibo, Dominican Republic. Families that live in bateys have small houses generally made of scrap tin and wood; the best possible accommodation is a cement-block house. These ¨houses¨ consist of only one room where the whole family lives together. To provide for her family, Eugenia has a small business killing chickens and selling their meat in neighboring bateys. In order to travel between bateys, Eugenia pays a small fee to ride on the back of a motorcycle.

By receiving loans, she and the other members of the Bank of Hope are better able to survive the economic fluctuations and frequent sicknesses that make work hard and volatile. With this next loan, Eugenia hopes to further grow her business by buying more chickens and travelling to more bateys. Someday she dreams of owning her own house. Eugenia also wants to be able to provide the best for her children, including a good education, so that they will have a bright future.

Eugenia is part of the Llegando Lejos (Going Far) group. The Bank of Hope with Esperanza International supports six groups in total, two of which are requesting new loans now.

Note: This is a group loan to 10 people.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and pay for transportation

loans.name: Ayesha's Group

texts.en:
Ayesha baji is the wife of N. M. and lives in Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. She has six children and owns a two-room brick house where she has lived for 10 years. For the last five years, her husband has made a living as a watchman.

In addition to taking care of her children and doing housework, Ayesha baji produces and sells milk. She has successfully repaid three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan), and is now applying for a new loan to buy an additional buffalo to increase her production of milk.

She is joined in her loan group by a four other people. Samina baji wants a loan to buy tools. Fatima baji, Zareena baji and Nusrat baji each want a loan to buy a buffalo for their own milk-producing businesses.

This is a group loan. Funds will be distributed among the members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 28 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 10 and 5 years old. She has been running a small shop since 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Janeth now hopes for a loan to buy more products for her business.

loans.use: To buy more products to increase her inventory

loans.name: Abdoul

texts.fr: Abdoul D. est né le 09 juin 1979 à Diourbel .il a abandonné les études très tot et avec l'aide de son frère il a pu avoir quelques chèvres qu'il élève et revend sur le marché à l'occasion des cérémonies religieuses.c'est dans le but de renforcer son troupeau qu'il sollicite ce pret.
texts.en:
Abdoul D. was born on June 9, 1979 in Diourbel. He left school at a young age and with the help of his brother, he managed to get some goats to raise and re-sell at the market before religious holidays and feast days. He is requesting this loan with a view to enlarging his flock.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raising goats

loans.name: Seum

texts.en: Seum S., 26, is a good housewife living in Kampong Cham with two of her children and her husband. Her husband has a business selling firewood to earn a profit of US$3 each day. Inflation makes it difficult, especially for poor people, to support their family. The price of rice and fertilizers has doubled in the past year while the price of meat and fish has increased 30 to 60 percent, according to the ADB reported lately. Mrs. Seum would like to take out a loan of US$800. She will use US$600 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to transport fish and US$200 to repair their house.

loans.use: Seum would like to purchase a motorbike and repair her house.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es:
Ronald vive en casa de sus suegros con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en la calle San Cristóbal de la zona de   Bajo Tacagua de la Ciudad de La Paz , en su domicilio tiene ubicado un pequeño taller donde se dedica a la elaboración de chamarras; con esta actividad mantiene a su familia ya que es su único medio de ingresos, la esposa realiza la venta de comida en la calle para ayudar a su familia y alivianar los gastos de la casa.
El crédito que solicita es para compra de material (cuero, hilos, cierres, etc.).

Es cliente de Impro y por la actividad puede acceder a un nuevo crédito, además de que el análisis de su flujo de caja le permite pagar las cuotas a tiempo.
texts.en:
Ronald lives with his wife and four children in his in-laws house, located in San Cristobal street in the Bajo Tacagua area of the city of La Paz. He has a small workshop in his house where he makes jackets. He supports his family with this activity since he is the only one that has an income. His wife sells meals on the street to help his family and the house expenses. The loan requested will be used to buy materials (leather, threads, zippers, etc.). He is an IMPRO client and he can have access to a new loan because his commercial activity, besides the analysis of his cash flow allows him to pay the quotas on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy leather, threads, zippers for this leather making business.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: Dilorom O., who grew up in a home where the principal work was and is agriculture, learned how to do this work when she was very young from working with her parents.  This has become her principal source of income, and she dedicates most of her time to the attention and care of her agricultural products.  Through her daily work, she looks to give her family security and economic reliability.  However, due to unexpected difficulties, she cannot cover all of her expenses, and she needs a loan to improve her products and increase her sales with the objective of constructing her house on land that she acquired a little while ago.  All of this can be possible with your help.

loans.use: To purchase the seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise such as sugar, tea, milk, cookies, drinks of all kinds, etc.

loans.name: An

texts.en: An S. is a professional tailor and makes approximately US$3 every day. She is 28 years old and lives in the Kampong Cham province with her husband and two of her children. She runs a small tailoring shop with her sister, while her husband is a construction foreman making about US$4 a day. An S. will use this loan to purchase another sewing machine to expand her shop.

loans.use: To purchase sewing machine.

loans.name: Agnès

texts.fr: Agnès T. est une femme de 59 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de charbons de bois depuis sa jeunesse à Lomé. Ce commerce est très florissante à cause de la demande sans cesse croissante ; puisque le charbon de bois est la principale source de d’énergie de la population togolaise. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit augmenter la taille de son commerce en s’approvisionnant en marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Agnès T. is a 59-year-old woman who is married and has five children. She has been a retailer of charcoal in Lomé since she was young. Business is booming because of the ever-growing demand, since charcoal is the main source of energy for the people of Togo. She would like to use this loan to expand her commerce by acquiring supplies of merchandise, so as to respond better to the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Karla Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Karla M. se ha destacado por preparar deliciosos platillos siendo su especialidad la elaboración de comida y dedicándose a esta actividad en el Mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega donde a diario atiende a sus clientes.

Es importante destacar que hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de la materia prima y así mejorar las condiciones de vida propia y las de su familia que tanto requieren de apoyo para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Karla M. has made a name for herself with her cooking. Her specialty is putting together tasty food dishes which she sells in Chinandega's Mercado Central, a place she goes daily to tend to her customers. It's important to note that she's applying for a loan from Ceprodel to buy basic supplies for her business and, in turn, improve not only her life but the lives of the members of her family, all of whom need help to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic supplies for food business.

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia G. is in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to open a bakery. She is 38 years old. Her husband is a peasant. She has four children and they all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Cicilia hopes to be able to build a hotel. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a bakery

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia B. is managing a small sari-sari store. She started her business in the year 2008 using her small savings of only Php 3,000. Now that she is 44 years old, she wants to grow her business more to support her two children. Aside from selling goods in their village, she also grows rice. She and her husband, Arnold B., till the land to support the needs of their family. 

She is requesting a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional stock for her business. She believes that her loan will help her attract more customers. She is also interested in looking for some other possible income areas to help her family expenses.

CEVI is helping her grow her business. Now she enjoys having CEVI credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her store.

loans.name: Nan

texts.en: Mrs. Nan S. lives in Rolus village in Takeo province. She sells prahok (fermented fish paste, condiment) in the local market. Since she has a lot of consumers who have many demands, she wants to expand her business. She has decided to request a loan to buy more prahok to add to her business and to support her customers. Her husband, Mr. Oeng Chen, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. Mrs. Nan S. is 25 years old and is the mother of a 4 month old child. She and her husband are presented in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more product to add her business and to support her customers.

loans.name: Jacinita

texts.en:
Jacinita M. is a member in good standing of Paglaum MPC of Progressive Center Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental.

She's been a member for almost nine years. Currently, she's availing her sixth cycle for additional capital for hog raising, to purchase sacks of feeds for two pig's daily consumption.

Jacinita is very thankful to our Almighty God that there's an institution like Paglaum Cooperative who helps her a lot in terms of financial assistance.

loans.use: Purchase feed.

loans.name: Marichelle

texts.en: Marichelle Y. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. Marichelle owns and operates a "sari-sari" or general store, selling daily use products such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste, etc. in the local community. Marichelle has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Marichelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Marichelle is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to sustain her family's needs. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife D. is a resident of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old and married with two children. She has been a good member of Paglaum Cooperative since December 2008 and has obtained a loan amounting to Php 7,000 intended to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her garden.

Marife is also thankful to Paglaum micro-finance for their programs and services that help the poor people and encourage them to work hard for their future. She wishes to have a better living and be able to give their children a good future.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticide for her garden

loans.name: Loeb

texts.en:
Loeb M. is a 44-year-old woman who lives in Phnom Penh City in Cambodia. She stays at home to care for three school-aged children and cooks for her family. Besides her housework, she also works as a requirement worker for a profit.

The family income is contributed to by her husband who works selling a few cooking tools and cradles. For a year, Loeb M. has been planning to expand her husband’s business because she thinks that it is a profitable one for her family. That is why she requested a loan that will enable her husband to purchase additional items to sell.

loans.use: To enable her husband to purchase addition items to sell

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Âgé de 31 ans, Monsieur Mamadou T.  vit avec son épouse et son enfant  dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Sanoubougou II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
    Monsieur Mamadou T. après l’obtention du D.E.F. (Diplôme d’Etude Fondamentale du système éducatif Malien correspondant au B.E.P.C.)il abandonne les études pour s’essayer à beaucoup d’activités génératrices de revenus mais sans succès. Alors , il décida d’apprendre le commerce, notamment celui de l’achat et de la vente des téléphones portables et accessoires (façades, batteries, chargeurs, écouteurs, etc.) depuis plus de cinq ans. Il mène cette activité au carrefour du nouveau de Médine où il dispose d’une boutique. Monsieur T. est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ une année. Il est à son deuxième prêt individuel après avoir remboursé  sans difficulté le  précédent. 
    Avec ce nouveau prêt, il compte acheter, 30 téléphones portables de marques différentes, 3 cartons de façades, 10 chargeurs, 20 paquets de carte mémoire, 5 grosses montres, 6 cartons de carton de batterie, 4 douzaines d’écouteurs, etc. 
   Il s’approvisionne à Bamako et pour revendre ses articles à une clientèle composée généralement de jeunes et surtout de forains qui viennent aux foires hebdomadaires tous les samedis et Dimanches.
   Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamadou T., 31, lives with his wife and child in a big extended traditional family in Sanoubougou II, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

After receiving his D.E.F. diploma--which, in the Malian educational system, corresponds to a Middle School leaving certificate, Mr. Mamadou T. left school to try out a number of money-earning activities, but without success. Then, he decided to learn a commercial trade, more specifically buying and selling cell phones and accessories (covers, batteries, chargers, headphones, etc.) which he has been doing for more than 5 years. He does business at a crossroads in Médine where he has a little shop. Mr. T. is much sought after by his clientele due to the quality of his products.

Wishing to satisfy his ever growing clientele, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso about one year ago. He is on his second individual loan after having reimbursed the preceding one without difficulty.

With this new loan, he intends to buy 30 cell phones of various brands, 3 boxes of covers, 10 chargers, 20 packets of memory cards, 5 big clocks, 6 cartons of batteries, 4 dozen speakers, etc. He buys his merchandise in Bamako and resells his wares to a clientele composed generally of young people and especially itinerant merchants who come to the weekly fairs every Saturday and Sunday.

With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 200,000 F CFA which will be used essentially to add to his working capital, contribute to covering family expenses, and pay the interest on the loan, investing any remainder back into his business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing cell phones, accessories and watches for resale

loans.name: Immaculate's Group

texts.en:
N. Immaculate is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is a very hard working lady with a business of selling second hand clothes from Lugazi and the neighboring towns, especially from the daily markets.

This is her first loan with the group and her main motive is to recapitalize her business with more quality and quantity of clothes so that she can make more profits to pay school fees for her children and to take care of their other needs. She is happy to be a part of this group because it is not easy to find someone to give you money these days.

loans.use: Buying more stock of clothings for business continuity.

loans.name: Honorine's Group

texts.fr: K. Honorine Afi est une femme de 47 ans  mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de plastiques(cuvettes,gobelets,pots et bassines)à kpalimé. Avec ce prêt, Afi voudrait élargir son étalage en achetant en gros des plastiques de lomé pour revendre à kpalimé. Dans l’avenir, elle aimerait être une grossiste.
texts.en:
K. Honorine Afi is a 47-year-old woman who is married and the mother of four children. She is a retailer of plastic tubs in Kpalimé. With this loan, she would like to enlarge her display by buying plastic items wholesale in order to come to Kpalimé to resell them. In the future, Afi would like to become a wholesale merchant.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: achat de  diverses sortes de plastiques

loans.name: Ma. Jenalyn

texts.en: Ma. Jenalyn T. is a hard-working mother. She lives with her husband and their five children in their home in Agusan Del Sur. She cultivates a two and a half hectare of rice farm. To satisfy her family’s needs, she makes extra effort in farming to have good income. Jenalyn requested for a loan of Php10, 000, which will be used to purchase farm inputs and to pay the laborers who help her till the farm.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 40 year married with five children aged between 17 and 25 years. Four of her children go to school .She takes care of additional family members. Grace resides and rents a one roomed house where she is staying with five people. There is electricity and piped water at home  The family gets two meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala. Grace sells charcoal on Lubaga road one of roads leading to Kampala city. Grace incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping in villages and uses private means to and from villages.  She doesn’t pay rent for her business but pays monthly market dues. She sells to all categories of people both on retail and whole sale Grace has been in this business for thirteen years and with MCDT for five, servicing her tenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. Grace is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and starting going to the villages twice a weeks of now she buys on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Antony  Njoroge

texts.en:
Antony is separated and he takes care of his two children, Robbin and Allan.

He was introduced to KADET through existing clients and he has no previous credit history. Antony will use this loan to increase his stock of second-hand clothes and linens, specifically bed sheets and pillow cases.
