Antony's business location is densely populated with middle-income residents. With the extra income he hopes to establish another similar business in an identified strategic area.

His dream is to have a chain of imported new bedding and carpets. He describes himself as business-oriented, hardworking, focused, and determined.

loans.use: Increase his stock of second-hand bed sheets and pillow cases to sell

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en:
Chhem C. makes a living selling various groceries at home in her village, earning approximately $4 US per day. She is 44 years old and married with two school-age children. Her husband works full-time growing rice and purchasing rice from local farmers to resell. These businesses are able to generate an income of $3 US per day to help cover the family's expenses. C. lives in Kandal Province, Cambodia with her husband (pictured) and children.

Mrs. C. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, C. is asking for a loan of $1100 US to purchase rice and more groceries to stock the store. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy groceries and rice to sell

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin is married with 3 children. She is 42 years old. She sells colorful sarongs and laces at retail and wholesale prices to her customers in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. She has been in this business for a long time. The demands for her sarongs are high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. Toyin is requesting for a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs to sell. Toyin says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Nuestra socia ISABEL es una madre de familia, tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos: Luís, tiene 13 años, estudia en el colegio y esta en el segundo grado de secundaria, Vanesa tiene siete años, estudia en colegio y esta en el segundo grado de primaria y Nicolás tiene 3 años. Ellos viven en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS” de la Asociación Arariwa.

La socia y su esposo Nicolás tienen un carro que hace servicio de transportes. Los socios al principio alquilaban un taxi de su hermana pero les parecía muy caro y entonces decidieron comprar un carro en cuotas. Ya son varios meses que hacen  el servicio de taxi y les ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que ponen en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para seguir pagando las cuotas de la compra del carro y continuar haciendo el servicio de taxi.   
   
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our partner Isabel is 36 years old, married and has three children: Luis is 13 years old, studying in the second year of junior high; Vanessa is seven, currently in the second grade; and Nicolas is 3 years old. They live in the imperial city of Cuzco. She is a member of the "MANOS JUNTAS" communal bank of the Arariwa Association. She and her husband Nicolas have a car they use for transportation service. First they rented her sister's taxi but they thought it was too expensive so they decided to buy a car in installments. It has been already several months that perform the taxi service and they have done quite well thanks to all the dedication to their work. Our partner is a working mother and an entrepreneur who carries her family forward. The partner requests the loan to keep paying for the car installments and to continue working with the taxi service. The partner is very thankful for the opportunity given to her through this means and she is committed to fulfill the corresponding payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for car financing installments and keep using the car as a taxi

loans.name: Carlos Benjamin

texts.es: El señor Carlos Benjamín,  tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Actualmente habita con sus familiares. El señor se dedica a la compra-venta de ropa usada, generalmente compra varias porciones de ropa en Managua y las trae a vender. El señor dio inicio a este negocio hace  7 años con la ayuda de sus padre, que fue el que lo impulso a valerse por sí mismo en la vida. Como el señor ha llevado una buena administración, le ha ido bien en su negocio. El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de dos pacas de ropa variada, ya que desea aprovechar diciembre para incrementar la colocación de su producto. Obtiene ingresos adicionales ya que trabaja como ejecutivo de ventas de Panzyma, que distribuye productos farmacéuticos. Es por las tardes y los fines de semana que distribuye sus productos de ropa. El sueño actualmente es llegar a establecer una tienda enorme de venta de pacas al por mayor, que distribuya a las personas para no tener que estar viajando hasta Managua a realizar las compras.
texts.en:
27-year-old Carlos Benjamín is single and does not have any children. He currently lives with his family. He makes a living buying and selling used clothing. He generally buys his clothing in Managua.
He started this business 7 years ago with the help of his father, who encouraged him to be self-sufficient. Building on his father's good management, the business has done well. The requested loan will be used to buy bundles of clothing; he wants to take the opportunity now in December to increase his stock. He makes additional income as a salesman for Panzyma, a company that distributes pharmaceutical products. He distributes his clothing in the evenings and on weekends.
He dreams of establishing a large wholesale used clothing store so that people come to buy from him instead of him having to travel around Managua to make his purchases.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Asufaaniutu

texts.en:
Asufaaniutu P. is 27 and married with 3 children (ages 1 - 5years).  She is starting a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Asufaaniutu needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 25 tala or US $10 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Asufaaniutu joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Asufaaniutu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Asufaaniutu P. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated. For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Good Hope Group, Central

texts.en: N. Imelda is a friendly and hard working single lady with four children aged 11 - 21; she also takes care of 2 orphans. She is a businesswoman involved in the sale of produce (cereals) for six years and although her business is faced with price fluctuations, she is able to make a weekly profit of 120,000 UGX. Imelda is grateful because the loans enable her to have good quality products. In the future, she needs to get a maize mill for business expansion and to enable her to educate her children to the highest level. Imelda needs a loan to be able to buy more cereals for resale.

loans.use: Buying more cereals for resale

loans.name: Iris Amelia

texts.es: Iris Amelia de 35 años de edad es soltera,  trabaja para el poder Judicial de Nueva Guinea desde hace 3 años y medio como responsable de recursos Humanos, està solicitando su segundo crèdito con el cual pretende construir una habitaciòn con mejores condiciones para tener  mayor comodidad en el hogar, y espera seguir siendo beneficiada con el fondo kiva.  Viaja todos los fines de semana a pasar con su familia en el Almendro Rio San Juan, es una mujer profesional con alto espiritu de superacion profesional y laboral, es muy responsable, honesta y de buenas costumbres y  muy querida por sus amigos, compañeros de trabajo y su familia, ella se siente agradecida con AFODENIC por la atenciòn que se le a brindado.
texts.en:
Iris Amelia is 35 and single. She has worked for the Judicial Authority of New Guinea for three and a half years. She is in charge of Human Resources. She is requesting her second loan to build a room with better conditions to make her home more comfortable. She hopes to continue to receive the benefit of a loan from Kiva. Every weekend she travels to the Almendro Rio San Juan to spend time with her family. She is a professional woman with a great spirit for professional self-improvement. She is very responsible, honest, and has good habits. She is very dear to her friends, colleagues, and family. She is grateful to Afodenic for the attention that they have given her.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional tomatoes

loans.name: Kanha's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kanha C. is the village bank president of this 10-member group loan offered by AMK. The members are located in Kouk TrE. village in Takeo province. The members will each use the loan to purchase supplies, equipment or other items to support their different purposes. Mrs.Chart Pov and Mrs. Keang C., who are group guarantors are also present in the photo with the group loan members.

Mrs. Kanha C. and her husband, Mr. Khoeurn C., are farmers who rent a piece of land on which they cultivate rice. Aside from farming, Mrs. Kanha C. is also a silk weaver from which she can earn a small income to support her living.

Mrs. Kanha C. now is requesting 600,000 Riels to purchase a cart and an ice-cream box to support her husband’s new business.

This couple has four children, one of whom is a seamstress in the garment factory, two others are silk weavers while the youngest one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase a cart and an ice-cream box for her husband's new business

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.en:
Rafoat is a responsible and loving mother who is always thinking of the well-being and security of her children. She is dedicated to raising cattle and sheep. Her husband leaves very early in the morning and travels great distances to provide veterinary services to peasants in need of care for their animals. Rafoat's hope is to purchase more animals to expand her business. To reach this goal, she is requesting a loan of 6,000 TJS.    

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit:  www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Tackou Liguèy Group

texts.fr:
Tackou Liguèy  est groupement mis en place, il y’a tout juste 2 mois 20 jours par deux dynamiques  femmes que sont Madame Khémesse N. et  Madame Kadji D.. D’ailleurs, elles sont les deux membres du groupe et est dirigé par Madame N. alors l’autre assure pour le moment les tâches de  trésorière.
Quant à Madame N., la présidente, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants âgés de 20 ans, 15 ans, 12 ans et 7 ans. Elle vend des légumes et du poisson  depuis  presque 10 ans. Habitant à Diourbel au quartier Champ de course qui est loin du marché, Madame N. choisît  de mettre sur place une table pour vendre des légumes et c’est comme ça qu’elle a commencé ce métier. 
Elles sollicitent un prêt de 200 000 FCFA qu’elles vont se partager à part égale. Elles comptent toutes les deux renforcer avec ce crédit leur commerce étant donné que Madame Kadji D. gère aussi une table de légumes.
texts.en:
Tackou Liguèy is an association set up just 2 months and 20 days ago by two energetic women, who are Ms. Khémesse N. and Madame Kadji D..  By the way, they are the only two members of the group, which is lead by Ms. N., so the other handles the tasks of the treasurer for now.  Ms. N., the president, is married and the mother of four children, aged 20, 15, 12, and 7.  She has been selling vegetables and fish for ten years.  Living in Diourbel, in the district of Champ de Course, which is distant from the market, she chose to set up a table locally to sell vegetables. And this is how she started in this trade.  The women are requesting a loan of 200,000 francs CFA that they are going to share equally.  They both intend to use this loan to bolster their businesses, since that Ms. Kadji D. also runs a table for vegetables.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies of merchandise

loans.name: Seydou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Seydou Touré est âgée de 43 ans, père de 5 d’enfants et vit dans une famille traditionnelle avec ses épouses et ses enfants dans le hameau de Fantobougou, sous préfecture de Fana, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro République du Mali.
  Cultivateur de son état, Monsieur Touré fait également le commerce de céréales depuis maintenant plus de 5 ans. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, il  décida d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son  troisième prêt, les précédents ayant été correctement remboursés.
 Avec ce nouveau prêt, il compte acheter quatre tonnes de céréales.
Il s’approvisionne en céréales auprès des petits détaillants au niveau de sa résidence et  dans les villages environnants et la vente s’effectue au marché de Fana le plus généralement en gros à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, il estime réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 200.000FCFA au cours du cycle qui sera utilisé pour couvrir des dépenses liées à la scolarisation de ses enfants et à l’activité elle-même.
texts.en:
Mr. Seydou Touré, aged 43, is the father of five children and lives in a traditional family with his wives and children in the hamlet of Fantobougou, sub-prefecture of Fana, prefecture of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro, Republic of Mali.  As a farmer, he has also been doing commerce in grains for over five years. Concerned about satisfying his customers further, he decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his third loan.  The previous ones have all been properly repaid.  With this new loan, he intends to buy four tonnes of grain.  He stocks up from small retailers where he lives and in surrounding villages.  He sells at the Fana market, for the most part wholesale, to a customer base composed of women and men.  With this loan, he thinks he will make an average profit of 200,000 francs CFA over the course of the cycle.  The profits will be used to cover expenses associated with schooling his children and with the business itself.  

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying grains

loans.name: Asociacion Las Tres Estrellas Group

texts.es:
L. alcancía comunal “Asociación Las Tres Estrellas”, está conformada por 8 miembros emprendedores quienes viven en L. zona D. Santa Rosa, distrito D. El Agustino, departamento D. Lima, trabajan con EDAPROSPO-prosperidad desD. hace 4 meses.
Maximiliana quien es socia del grupo, tiene 50 años, es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos, asume el cargo D. presidenta recientemente. DesD. hace 3 años se dedica a L. venta D. verduras y tubérculos, se inicio vendiendo como ambulante y ahora lo hace en un puesto en el mercado. Con el esfuerzo D. su trabajo ha logrado comprar una salchipapera y L. construcción del baño D. su vivienda. El gran sueño D. Maximiliana es poner una tienda en su vivienda.
El  préstamo otorgado será utilizado para L. compra D. mercadería. Agradecen el apoyo brindado y se prometen cumplir con los pagos establecidos en las fechas pactadas.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Asociación Las Tres Estrellas” is maD. up of eight enterprising members who live in Santa Rosa, a district of El Agustino in the departament of Lima. They have been working with EDAPROSPO for four months. Maximiliana is a member of the group and has recently taken on the position of president. She is 50 years old, has two children and lives with her D. facto. She has sold vegetables and tubers for three years, starting as a street vendor and later setting up a market stall. Through her efforts she has been able to purchase a “salchipapera” (a mobile cart equipped for selling fried potatoes and sausages) and build a bathroom in her house. Maximiliana’s dream is to set up a shop in her house. This loan will be used to buy merchandise. The group is thankful for the support they have received and promise to make their repayments in the allocated time period.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna T. is a 56-year-old married who supports her family by operating three business ventures:  a general store, nipa production and E-loading.   She lives in Sitio Malabong, Brgy. Andulawan, Ilog, Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, nipa production and E-loading businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of P20,000. 

Lorna is now borrowing PHP 23,000 so that she can have additional capital.  This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of P20,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Lorna aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 55 years old. He is married with 10 children between the ages of 7 and 31. Five of the children are currently attending school.

He is a farmer from Kitale town in Western Kenya. Patrick has been farming for 30 years and has two casual employees. His main product is milk and maize, which he sells to the local market. He is also employed as a teacher in the same area.

His biggest challenge in farming has been disease, which is a threat to his dairy cows.

Patrick has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 62,400 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will enable him to acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk to sell and increase his income. He believes that the extra income from this loan will reduce his stress level caused by financial constraints.

In the future, he would like to increase his productivity by acquiring a high-yielding dairy cow.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Hayder

texts.es:
Don Hayder  S.  R. es un señor de 40 años de edad que vive con su esposa y 4 hijos en una comunidad llamada la Palma de Puerto Jiménez en la provincia de Puntarenas. Durante muchos años su población se dedico a la minería de oro y la explotación Forestal hasta que se creó el parque Nacional Corcovado,  que en conjunto con sus hermosas playas han abierto el paso a la industria turística siendo hoy la más importante de la zona. 
Don Hayder  se dedicó  toda su vida al negocio de la explotación maderera hasta que las regulaciones por el establecimiento del parque Nacional frenó la tala de árboles en los bosques de Puerto Jiménez. Gracias a la experiencia que había obtenido de sus labores, su buena actitud y el deseo de seguir siempre adelante, el obtuvo un   puesto en el departamento de Protección de recursos Naturales del Parque Nacional  Corcovado, siendo ahora su trabajo proteger los bosques que por años su familia dañó.
Su buen desempeño  en su trabajo,  le permitió ganarse una beca para que pudiera terminar su estudios secundarios así poder obtener un puesto administrativo en la misma área  en la que ya trabaja. Es por eso que Don Hayder solicita un crédito de ¢500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprar una computadora, la cual necesita urgente  para terminar sus estudios, y que usará  también para alquilarla durante el día a los turistas de la zona. 
Don Hayder S. R. es socio de Raíces Capitales S.A, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico.
texts.en:
Mr. Hayder S. R. is a 40 year old man who lives with his wife and 4 children in a community called La Palma de Puerto Jiménez in the province of Puntarenas. For many years his town has worked in goldmining and lumber until the national park Corcovado was created. Together with its beautiful beaches, they have opened up the tourist industry and today it is the most important one of the region. Hayder spent his whole life in the lumber industry until the regulations from the establishment of the national park put a stop to the cutting of trees in the forests of Puerto Jiménez. Thanks to the experience he had from his work, his good attitude and the wish to keep getting ahead, he obtained a post in the Department of Protection of Natural Resources of the Corcovado National Park. HIs job now is to protect the forest that his family damaged for years. His good performance at work allowed him to win a scholarship so that he could finishe his secondary education and obtain an administrative position in the same are in which he already works. That is why Hayder is asking for a loan of ¢500 000 (five hundred thousand colones) to buy a computer, which he needs urgently for his studies. He will also use it to rent out during the day to tourists in the area. Mr. Hayder S. R. is a member of Raíces Capitales S.A, one of 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his second loan and with it he hopes to continue growing personally and financially.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Remelinda

texts.en: Remelinda T. is from the village of San Jose, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 58 years old and is married with two adult children. Remelinda owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling bananas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Remelinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Remelinda plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Able God Group

texts.en:
Alfred K., who is holding the sign in the photo, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Able God. Alfred is 30 years old, married, and has two children who range from 1 to 5 years old. He was only able to attend school through the 7th grade due to poverty. 

For 3 years, he has been selling slippers in Redlight Market, Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. 

He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more slippers. He describes himself as a hard-working man.

His dream is to improve his business and continue to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more slippers for resale

loans.name: Imelda's Group

texts.en:
Imelda B. is from the village of Cebu San Isidro. She is 49 years old. Imelda is the group leader of a 12-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Imelda is married and has 7 children. To make a living, Imelda owns & operates a business venture selling fruits and vegetables. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from vending fruits, vegetables, and snacks in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Imelda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Xoljuyub No. 5 Group

texts.es: Doña Luisa P. T., tiene 55 años D. edad, es casada, tiene un hijo, D. lo cual esta a su cargo, se dedica al comercio D. ventas D. panes y D. esa  forma ha trabajado diario. Conjuntamente con otras vecinas deciden organizar un grupo para poder incrementar el volumen  D. ventas. Son 5  señoras  integrantes, las otra señoras se dedican a diversas actividades productivas, tales como: comercio, venta D. panes, la crianza D. animales, bordado D. blusas y ropas típicas. Quieren que su negocio sea rentable por lo que el credito les será D. mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luisa P. T., 55, is married and has a son in her care. She sells bread and has worked at this daily. Together with some neighbors they decided to form a group to increase sales. There are 5 members. The other women are in various kinds of productive activities such as: commerce, bread sales, animal raising, blouse and typical clothing embroidery. They want their businesses to be profitable so the loan will be of much help.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel P. is from the village of Calamagui. She is 34 years old. Maribel is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Maribel owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Maribel has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP when she sells her raised pigs.

In 2009, Maribel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in the future. Maribel is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Maribel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in thefuture

loans.name: Amsatou Lo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Ndock Sarré est creé le 18 septembre 2010.il est composé de 6 femmes issus du même village.leur activité est le petit commerce .

Madame Amsatou Lo assise à droite sur la photo est responsable du groupe de solidarité. elle est âgée de 49 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants et responsable d'un autre enfant en charge. 

Elle fait la transformation et vente d'huile d'arachide

Avec son nouveau crédit de 50.000 francs cfa elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement en arachide pour produire plus d'huile

Son objectif est d'accroitre son activité et de participer à la prise en charge de la sante et nourriture de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Ndock Sarré was created September 18, 2010. It is made up of 6 women from the same village. Their activity is small trade.

Mrs Amsatou Lo seated in the right of the photo, is head of the solidarity group. She is 49 years old. She is married, mother of 5 children and cares for one other.

She transforms and sells peanut oil.

With her new loan of 50.000FCFA she is going to increase her level of peanut supplies in order to produce more oil.

Her objective is to grow her business and to contribute to the food and health costs of her children.

loans.use: Transformation et vente d'huile d'arachide

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia tiene 39 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 13 años se  dedica a la elaboración de ladrillos, siendo el suelo arcillosos su materia prima y por el cual lo consigue pagando un derecho de explotación de esta materia prima en terrenos ajenos. Ya en su fábrica y con la ayuda de sus hermanos se encargan de la elaboración y distribución de su producción a varios de sus clientes. Pero cuando requiere de mayor producción tiene que contratar mano de obra, ya que lo pedidos superan el millar. Durante este tiempo ha visto el progreso de su negocio, permitiéndole cubrir la educación de su hijos y por tal, desea continuar con este trabajo. Es su crédito numero 19 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que conocen de su persona que es responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en el pago del arrendamiento de una nueva área de terreno que posee una buena capa de suelo arcilloso y también en la compra de aserrín. Ya que estos son materiales indispensables para la fabricación de ladrillos.
texts.en: Lucia is 39 years old and lives with her three children in her own home. For the past 13 years she has made a living making bricks, using clay soil as her raw material. She pays for the right to extract it from lands far away. Her brothers help her in her factory and are in charge of making and distributing the products to various customers. When she needs to increase her production she has to hire workers, since the orders can be in the thousands. During this time she has seen her business progress, allowing her to cover her children's education, so she wants to continue with this work. This is her 19th loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she is very content in knowing that she has financial support since they know she is responsible with her payments. Furthermore she is pleased to be part of her community bank because of all the members she has met who are responsible and stick together. She thanks all those who are managing her loan request, which will be very useful for her business' progress. With the loan she is requesting, she plans to invest in paying to lease a new plot of land that has a good layer of clay soil, as well as purchase sawdust, since these materials are indefensible in producing bricks.

loans.use: Lease land to extract clay and purchase sawdust, the main materials in making bricks

loans.name: Alice Nayausupat

texts.en:
Alice Nayausupat K. is 28 years old. She is married to Koileken Lagama and she is a mother of three school-going children. Alice is a farmer and she has been farming on her own piece of land for the last 13 years.

She learned about KADET through an awareness campaign done by KADET staff in her area of residence. This will be her second loan. She is planning to spend 50,000 Kenyan shillings to prepare the land for wheat planting and to buy seedlings for the same. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she intends to plant wheat in a bigger piece of land.

Her future dream is that she will be able to buy a bigger piece of land where she will be doing commercial farming. She believes she is hardworking and she only needs the resources to attain her goals.

loans.use: Preparing the farm and buying farm inputs

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 38 year-old woman married to Tanga, a tailor, who is 40 years old. Together, they are blessed with two children, ages 15 and 10.

Veronica has been in the retail business for 12 years. Over this period she has been able to identify many potential customers. Veronica was introduced to KADET by a friend, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use it to purchase stock for her shop, such as sugar, flour, rice, soda, and bread. Veronica will use the anticipated profits to educate her children to the highest level possible. Her hope is to one day own a supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her retail business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen T. is from the village of Western Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 52 years old. Helen is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk food in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Helen is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like junk food & beverages. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Helen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like junk food & beverages

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
La señora Rosalía P. M. vive en Axochiapan, Axochiapan, en el estado de Morelos México. ella tiene 52 años concluyó la educación básica, ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida para eventos sociales y su préstamo lo va a utilizar para comprar lo necesario para preparar sus banquetes, además para algunos arreglos de su vivienda La señora Rosalía tiene 10 años con su negocio, nos comenta que fue su suegra quien le enseño a preparar comida y después pensó en ofrecer sus servicios a las personas que tuvieran alguna fiesta, comenzando en pequeñas festividades y poco a poco la han ido conociendo, ahora ya la buscan para eventos grandes, nos comenta que le da gran satisfacción cuando la gente le dice que su comida esta sabrosa y la invitan para otro evento. Su trabajo es un su casa principalmente, las persona s que la contratan van hasta su domicilio por la comida y a veces la contratan para atender en las fiestas. Su negocio es importante para ella porque le da ingresos y utilidades para sacar adelante a su familia y para los gastos.
La parte favorita de su negocio es elaborar la comida para los eventos porque le gusta cocinar  y siente una gran satisfacción cuando la gente le dice que su comida esta sabrosa. Las personas que son atendidas por su negocio son de todas las edades, regularmente atiende 2 a 3 eventos por semana en el mes de Diciembre y Enero es cuando aumentan los pedidos de banquetes. La señora Rosalía no tiene competencia ya que ella es la única persona que da esa clase de servicio en la localidad. Las ganancias las utiliza para comprar lo que haga falta para su negocio,  para comprar parrillas, ollas  y par los gastos de su casa.
La señora Rosalía es casada, su esposo es empleado federal, ella tiene 3 hijos: Julio César de 28 años de edad trabaja en los Estados Unidos, Humberto de 21 años de edad trabaja en una farmacia y Briceida de 16 años estudia la preparatoria, además en su casa vive la esposa de su hijo Julio César, su nuera le ayudan en las labores de su trabajo y participan de las ganancias. Axochiapan  es muy bonito y le gusta vivir ahí porque es tranquilo y conoce y convive con sus vecinos. Valora mucho su negocio porque le ayuda mucho para sacar adelante a su familia, cuando se enferma o cuando necesitan para una emergencia. Algunas de las mejorías que desea hacerle a su casa son repellar las paredes de su vivienda, comprar herrería  y vidrios para las puertas y ventanas. Sus planes a futuro son construir una casa en un predio que tiene en la misma localidad y dejarles un patrimonio a sus hijos. Ella lo piensa lograr con la ayuda de los préstamos. La señora Rosalía quiere decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les agradezco por la ayuda que me han dado para que mi negocio siga funcionando mucha gracias”:
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalía P. M. lives in Axochiapan, Axochiapan in the state of Morelos Mexico. She is 52 years old and has completed her basic education. She has a business selling food for social events and she will use her loan to buy the necessary items to prepare for the banquets, in addition to some housing arrangements. Mrs. Rosalía has been in the business for 10 years.  She says that it was her mother-in-law who taught her to prepare food and then thought to offer their services for peoples' parties, starting with small festivities and gradually are looking for large events. She says that she is satisfied greatly when people tell her that her food is tasty and hire her for another event. She works mainly out of her home and the people who hire her either come to her residence for the food or sometimes she is hired to serve at parties. Her business is important to her because it gives her an income and profits to raise her family and pay for the expenses. 

Her favorite part of the business is to produce food for the event because she likes to cook and feels great satisfaction when people say that her food is tasty. The people who help with the business are of all ages, regularly attending 2-3 events a week in the month of December and January because this is when banquet orders increase. Mrs. Rosalía does not have competition because she is the only one who provides that kind of service in the town. Earnings are used to buy whatever it takes for her business, to buy grills, pots and even the cost of her home.

Mrs. Rosalía is married and her husband is a federal employee. She has 3 children: Julio César, 28 and works in the U.S., Humberto, 21 and works in a pharmacy, and Briceida, 16 and in preparatory school. Also, the wife of her son Julio César lives in her house. Her daughter-in-law helps with the work and participates in the profits. Axochiapan is very nice and she enjoys living there because it is quiet and she knows and lives with neighbors. She greatly values her business because it helps to raise her family, when they get sick or need for an emergency. 

Some home improvements she wants to make are plastering the walls of her home, buying iron and glass for doors and windows. Her future plans are to build a house at the same location and leave an inheritance for her children. She intends to achieve these things with the help of loans. Mrs. Rosalía wants to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad "Thank you for the help you have given me for my business to continue running. Many thanks.”

loans.use: To buy vegetables, meat, spices, red and green mole.

loans.name: Abibu

texts.en: Abibu is a thirty-two-year-old single female with three children. She owns a house in Kasese. She has been dealing in poultry for the last two years during which she started with fifty birds and now has more than two hundred birds. Her hardships include the death of birds plus very expensive feeds. Her vision is business expansion plus educating her children. Abibu intends to use the loan to buy more hens.

loans.use: Buying more hens

loans.name: Family (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Family se encuentra formado por 15 mujeres luchadoras, alegres y muy trabajadoras que laboran en diferentes actividades lo cual les ha permitido ayudar en la economía de sus hogares, viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad es la tercera  más importante del país, es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad nombrada así en diciembre de 1999.

La Señora Carmelina S. vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su hermana. Tiene 42 años, es divorciada y tiene n3 hijos de 22, 20, 11 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven independientes, su última hija estudia en la escuela, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 
Doña Carmelina se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la marca Yanbal, esta actividad la realiza hace 2 años, sus productos los vende recorriendo la ciudad y labora de lunes a sábados, el dinero de su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mas cosméticos Yanbal. Su sueño es que su hija se supere en sus estudios.

La Señora. Icela María M. vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 25 años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, su primer hijo está en el jardín de infantes. Su esposo se dedica a laborar en el área de la construcción ya que es albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 
Nuestra socia se dedica a las venta de cosméticos de la marca Avon, actividad que la realiza hace un año, sus productos los vende recorriendo la ciudad sin horario y de domingo a domingo.
Este es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue su vecina quien le ha motivado para que ingrese en el grupo, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más productos Avon. Su meta es  tener su casa propia. 

En esta ocasión nos acompaña en la foto la señora Mónica Yamdum que es la Promotora de Educación de la Fundación.
Ella está parada al lado derecho de la foto con una chaqueta blanca.
texts.en:
The communal bank named Family is made up of 15 defiant, happy, hardworking women who carry out various business activities that permit them to financially support their households. They live in various locations in the city of Cuenca. This city is the third most important of the country and it was named a World Heritage site on December 1999. 

Carmelina S. lives in the city of Cuenca. She is on her second loan cycle with her communal bank, to which she was invited to join by her sister. She is 42 years old, divorced, and she has 3 children, aged 22, 20, and 11 years old. The two eldest are married and live independently. Her youngest daughter is in school. She doesn't have a house of her own so she rents their home. 

Carmelina sells Yanbal brand cosmetics and she has had her business for 2 years. She sells her products traveling throughout the city, working from Monday to Saturday. The funds from her new loan will be used to invest in the purchase of more Yanbal brand cosmetics. Her dream is to see her daughter complete her studies. 

Icela Maria M. lives in the downtown area of Cuenca. She is 25 years old, married common-law, and she has 2 children, aged 5 and 3 years old.  Her eldest is in kindergarten. Her husband works as a construction worker in the area. They don't have a house of their own, so they rent their home. 

She sells Avon brand cosmetics and she has had her business for the past year. She sells her products traveling throughout the city. She doesn't have a set schedule but she works from Sunday to Sunday. 

This is the first loan she accesses through her communal bank and it was her neighbor who motivated her to join the group.  The funds from the loan will be invested in the purchase of more Avon brand products. Her goal is to have a house of her own. 

Here in the photo we find Monica Yamdum, the Educational Coordinator for Fundacion (Kiva Field Partner).  She is seen standing at the right hand side, wearing a white jacket.

loans.use: To purchase Yanbal and Avon brand cosmetics.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna M. is from the village of Panghiwaan, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 47 years old. Myrna is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling snacks like rice and cassava cakes in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Myrna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients like eggs & flour, needed to make products for sale.  This will be the 1st loan taken out by Myrna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed, like eggs & flour, to make products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 29-year-old married man living with his wife. He is from Lebanon. He has owned a metal shop for the past 10 years. He makes alumni designs, motors etc. (all metal-related work). Over the years, he has built a good business reputation and he works closely with some metal companies. He took advantage of his first Kiva loan and he has been a reliable client and paid on his scheduled date. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase metal needed for his work to proceed in his operation properly. He is looking to expand his business further in the coming year and he is optimistic about the future.

loans.use: To purchase metal needed for his work

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng D., 30, is married and resides with her family in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known as the most populated city in the country. D. sells beverages and food, earning an income of USD 8 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 150 on food and USD 165 on the other necessary expenses. D. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more supplements to expand the current business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more supplements to expand the current business.

loans.name: Pan's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of sixteen members. The members of this group will use their money to support their different purposes. Mrs. Pan is a village bank president. She was selected as the village bank president by the other members. 

Mrs. Pan was born in 1984 and is married to Mr. Maen, who was born in 1987. Mrs. Pan stays at home and cooks for the family. She has a child who is attending a local school. Mrs. Pan's husband is a construction worker who is able to earn a small income to support his family. Aside from being a construction worker he also earns his living by fishing. In order to support her husband's fishing activities, Mrs. Pan is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets for her husband to use.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets for her husband to use

loans.name: Sairan Rysbaeva's Group

texts.en:
Sairan R., 49, is the leader of this group. She is a mother of four children, the oldest of whom is 19 years old. For six years, since the start-up of her business, Sairan and her children have worked hard for the major part of the daytime. The family buys young calves, breeds them and resells them at a higher price. Sairan says that the hardest part is covering all the costs related to feeding and providing healthy conditions for cattle breeding. Approximately every month, Sairan takes a head of cattle for sale to a local market. A couple of years ago she increased her stock from three heads to ten heads. The initial capital of 4,000 KGS was returned in a month of operating the business. Sairan believes in a bright future for her business, therefore decided to broaden her stock by applying for a loan from Kiva.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wine glasses, artificial flowers, silicon, and assorted ribbons.

loans.name: Anacita

texts.en:
Anacita is from the village of Bunawan in the municipality of Calamba in Misamis Occidental Province. She is 58 years old. Anacita is widowed and has five grown children. To make a living, Anacita operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling firewood in the local community. Anacita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years, and she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Anacita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anacita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Anacita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional firewood to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Anacita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood to sell.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she operates a food stall business that contributes to her other source of living. She faces the major challenge of competition from other vegetable stall operators in the area. 

With the KSHS 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of vegetables, cooking oil, beans and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of vegetables, cooking oil, beans and wheat flour.

loans.name: Odessa

texts.en:
Odessa is married but she has never been blessed with offspring. She is 49 years old and lives in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To earn a living, she has a mini grocery store at home. There, according to her, she creates friendships with everybody. The mini grocery also helps her to buy their daily needs. 

She earns approximately $202 per month, but Odessa wants to have more capital so that she can multiply her sales. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP at GDMPC to purchase soft drinks and canned goods to sell. 
    
Odessa has been member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, she wants to have a large grocery store with an available area for refreshment.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 46 años reside en la comunidad nativa de Sanchirio (selva central peruana). Ahí formó su familia junto a Herminio, su esposo desde hace 26 años. Ambos tuvieron 5 hijos a los que cuidan y protegen en su casa propia. Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura, desde niña le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra, producirla y vivir de ella. Es por ello que desde hace 25 años comenzó a sembrar café en sus 5 hectáreas de terrenos y plátanos en sus 6 hectáreas siguientes. Lo que más le gusta es el cultivo de plátano, ya que cada 15 días cosecha los frutos maduros, obteniendo así ganancias continuas. Más le disgusta la época cuando los precios se inestabilizan en el mercado. Pero eso no la desanima, ya que continuamente recibe capacitaciones de la cooperativa donde vende sus sembríos de café y viaja continuamente a la ciudad de Huancayo; a vender sus cultivos de plátano. Además de ser una mujer hábil en los negocios; pues hace poco abrió una tienda de comestibles vendiendo productos de primera necesidad donde obtiene una ganancia extra. Ahora se encuentra en plena cosecha de café, donde está obteniendo una buena producción. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “El palomar al éxito” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde se espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Julia, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios kilos de arroz y azúcar para surtir su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Julia, age 46, lives in the native community of Sanchirio (central Peruvian jungle).  This is where, 26 years ago, she established her family with her husband, Herminio.  They have five children who they take care off and protect in their own house.

Her main financial activity is farming.  When she was a young girl she was taught how to work the land, how to make it productive, and how to live from it.  That is why 25 years ago she started to grow coffee on her five hectares of land and bananas on the next six hectares.  

What she likes the most is growing bananas.  She likes it because every two weeks she harvests the mature fruit, thereby obtaining steady income.  What she likes the least is the time when the prices are not stable in the market.  

However, this does not discourage her because she receives continuous training from the cooperative where she sells her coffee crops.  She continually travels to the city of Huancayo to sell her banana crops.

She is skilled in  business, and a short time ago she opened a grocery store.  She sells basic needs products, and she gets good earnings.

She belongs to the El Palomar al Éxito Communal Bank.  This is her fourth loan with MFP.  She hopes to receive your contribution in order to continue on with her objectives.  She pledges, once again, to make her payments as she has done with her previous loans.  

Also, it pleases her to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.  Upon receiving your support she will use the requested money to buy several kilos of rice and sugar to stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy several kilos of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Dalmacio

texts.en:
Dalmacio is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 

Dalmacio has a shop that sells detergents, breads & snacks. He has had this business for 25 years. He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & detergents.

Dalmacio has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Dalmacio hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & detergents

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en:
Rosaline is 50 years old and married with three children between the ages 17 and 23. She runs a plumbing materials store in Krootown inside Freetown. She also takes care of four relatives as well as their own family.

Rosaline has owned this business for 10 years and sells pipes, seat covers, cement and cables at her store. She also receives income from renting out a house to a tenant. She says that the main challenge to her business is customers always return damaged items after they pay for the product.  

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more plumbing materials. Rosaline says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her business and increase her savings. In the future, she would like to expand her business more.

loans.use: To purchase more plumbing materials, pipes and cement for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 42 years old.  She is married and has five children.  For four years, she has been farming to earn a living. She mainly practices dairy farming and poultry farming.   So far, she has managed to employ two people in her business.  Mary believes that through Faulu Kenya, she will improve her farming.  
Mary hopes to expand her business and employ more people in the future.  She has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Birame Bigué

texts.fr: -Monsieur Birame  est un jeune homme de 30 ans, il Habite au Sénégal. Il est célibataire. Il  gère un atelier de couture chez lui. IL a choisit son métier par amour ; mais aussi par  souci d’avoir une source de revenu qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins.IL est sociétaire dans l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis 2004. Il sollicite un prêt de 170 000. Ceci lui permettra d’acheter une machine à coudre afin de bien préparer la fête de Korité. Ainsi, son financement  l’aidera  à réaliser ses projets et à satisfaire ses besoins.
texts.en: Mr. Birame is a young man, 30 years old. He lives in Senegal and is unmarried. He runs a tailoring shop in his home. He chose this trade for the love of it but also out of concern for having an income enabling him to support himself. He has been an associate of one of the U-IMCEC branches since 2004. He is requesting a loan of 170,000 francs which will allow him to buy a sewing machine, so as to be well-prepared for the holiday of Korité. Thus, his financing will help him to accomplish his projects and to meet his needs.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Maricela Antonia

texts.es: Maricela Antonia D. 64 años D. edad, vive en casa propia con su hijo el cual ya es mayor D. edad. Maricela se dedica a la venta D. paletas D. diferentes sabores y a la venta D. cosméticos. Es una mujer ejemplar ya que a pesar D. su avanzada edad no se cansa D. trabajar para salir adelante y poder dar a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida. Es muy honesta pero sobre todo emprendedora. Para ella lo más importante es su familia y es por la que cada día le piD. a Dios que le D. fuerzas para seguir trabajando y poder ayudarles en lo que le sea posible. Una D. las características más notables D. Maricela es que es una mujer muy emprendedora, tiene muchas ideas D. negocio y no le gusta dejar ir ninguna oportunidad D. la cual pueD. sacar un poco D. ingresos. Ha decidido hacer este crédito a INTEGRAL con el fin D. invertir en su negocio en la compra D. variedad D. paletas y D. cosméticos que le ayuden a atraer a más clientes  D. tal manera que pueda aumentar sus niveles D. venta para así poder tener acceso a una mejor oportunidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Maricela Antonia is 64 years old and lives in her own home with her son who is now an adult. She sells different flavored popsickles and also cosmetics. 
 
Maricela is an exemplary woman who, despite her advanced age, never tires of working to get ahead and to give her family a better quality of life. She is very honest and above all enterprising. The most important thing to her is her family and because of this she asks God everyday to give her the strength to continue working so she can help them as much as possible. One of Maricela’s most notable characteristics, as noted, is that she is enterprising; she has many business ideas and does not like to let any opportunity pass by from which she might gain a little income. 

She has decided to request a loan from Integral and invest it in her business of selling different kinds of popsickles and cosmetics, which will help her to attract more customers so that she can increase her sales volume and thereby have access to better life opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a variety of popsickles and of cosmetics.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan, es experto en ediciones de video y publicidad. El crédito lo requiere para la comprar una computadora portátil para  llevar los diseños a  sus clientes y de s esta manera hacer presentaciones más profesionales que impresionen a sus potenciales clientes. Vive en casa de sus padres  la misma queda  ubicada en la zona San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltero  y  no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un crédito esperando crecer como microempresario, por esto es que se canaliza el crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Juan is an expert in video presentations and publicity.  He needs the loan to buy a laptop computer so that he can take his designs to his customers and do more professional presentations that will impress his potential customers.  He lives in his parents’ house located in the city of La Paz’s San Pedro zone.  He’s single and has no children.  This is the first time the client gets a loan and he hopes to grow as a micro businessman and this is why the loan is being channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer.

loans.name: Didaikan's Group

texts.en:
Didaikan is the leader of this group. She is 54 and unfortunately she is a widow. She has raised two daughters and two sons. The younger son is  handicapped and the younger daughter works in Russia. The other children are married and live separately with their families. In order to earn money to support her livelihood, Didaikan cultivates agricultural products and breeds livestock. She has been running this business for twenty years. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further resale. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Festus

texts.en: Festus runs a computing school – a business that has been in operation for the last three years in Mwandoni, Mombasa. He is a 39-year-old married father of two children. Festus is a client of KADET and this marks his third loan to finance his business. With this loan, he plans to purchase an extra computer for his business. The profits that will be generated will be directed toward the gradual expansion of his business and the repayment of the loan. His dream is to own a computer college.

loans.use: to purchase an extra computer

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 51 years old and married with 8 children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Shirly is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Shirly has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from a computer shop.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Everth Omar

texts.es: Everth Omar tiene 42 años, su actividad es una pulpería. El es una persona emprendedora que disfruta de negocio. Esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos por lo que se siente muy contento, es un hombre emprendedor dispuesto a trabajar duro para alcanzar sus objetivos, le gusta estar adelante de la competencia, el piensa que para poder ascender a una meta la mejor fórmula es superarnos constantemente fue así que decidió realizar este crédito que le permita comprar golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, pan, gaseosas, entre otros productos. Eveth tiene la confianza que con su esfuerzo y dedicación lograra llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en: Everth Omar is 42 years old and has a grocery store.  He’s an enterprising person who enjoys business.  This is not his first loan request and he feels very happy.  He’s an enterprising man who is willing to work hard to reach his goals.  He likes to be ahead of the competition and thinks that in order to reach a goal the best formula is to constantly improve ourselves.  This is how he decided to take out this loan that will allow him to buy snacks, soft-drinks, basic grains, bread and beverages, among other products.  Everth trusts that with his effort and dedication he’ll manage to bring economic security to his home and an improved quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Adiba

texts.ru: Адиба целеустремленная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать 4 детей. Последние 10 лет она занимается купле- продажей продовольственных товаров. Она продает широкий ассортимент сладостей, также хозяйственных товаров. В бизнесе помогает ей муж, и они вместе дружно работают для обеспечения будущего своих детей. Адиба хочет расширить свой бизнес с целью получения большей  прибыли. С этой целью она запрашивает займ, и заранее благодарна вам за поддержку и доброту.
texts.en: Adiba is a goal-oriented and hardworking woman.  She is married and is a loving mother of four children.  She has been involved in buying and selling grocery products for the last ten years.  Adiba sells a wide variety of sweets and also household goods.  Her husband helps her in this business, and they work well together in order to provide for their children's future.  Adiba wants to expand her business with the goal of making a large profit.  This is why she is requesting this loan and thanks you in advance for the support and kindness.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Ms. Hoa,48 years old with two children, She has participated in loans from  our credit program  in 2007 and she is always in good repayment situation. She has  received 6 loans. She has a shop that sells motorcycle parts.Her monthly gross income is 6,000,000 Vietnam dong. Now,she wants to borrow  9,632,000 Vietnam dong to buy more motorcycle parts to attract more clients to come.

loans.use: to buy more motorcycle parts

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina sigue participando en el banco comunal “Choquequirao” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Marcelina sigue trabajando en la venta de artesanía como tejidos y ella elabora chalinas, guantes, gorros, mantillas, mantas grandes, ponchos y  chalecos.

Marcelina con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho en el negocio.

Marcelina solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo lana de alpaca y otras cosas más. 
	
Marcelina se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Marcelina continues to participate in the “Choquequirao” communal bank, which is part of the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.  She makes and sells artisanal materials such as scarves, gloves, hats, mantillas, large blankets, ponchos, and vests.  Her previous loan went very well and she received good benefits. For this reason, she is requesting another loan since it will help her business a great deal.  She is requesting the loan to purchase alpaca wool and other items.  She is grateful for the opportunity offered through this means and promises to make her payments in accordance with the re-payment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase alpaca wool and other materials.

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en:
Norberta is a 29-year-old married woman from Sikatuna, Bohol. At this time, she has no children.

Norberta works hard to support her family and makes candles to earn a living. She started this business one year ago. She has applied for a loan to buy wicks, wax, cans and other materials for candle making. Norberta hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy wicks, wax, cans and other materials for candle making.

loans.name: Orozbek

texts.en: Orozbek's first Kiva loan helped him to purchase cattle. Today he has a farm with two cows, two sheep, ten goats and one horse, which allows him to earn about 8,000 KGS a month. Now Orozbek plans to broaden his business activities by purchasing pedigreed calves, and for this reason he is applying for his second Kiva loan of 35,000 KGS.

loans.use: To buy pedigreed calves.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 42 years old and is married with four children ranging from six to twenty-four years. She describes herself as determined and visionary. She has been into poultry farming where she sells chickens, meat and manure. Her business challenge is the high cost of chicken feeds and the outbreak of diseases. She will be using the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more chickens. In the next five years, Josephine hopes and dreams to be a supplier.

loans.use: To buy more chickens.

loans.name: Gaudencia

texts.en:
Gaudecia has been engaged in farming for 10 years. The farm produces eggs, beans, milk, and vegetables for the local market. Gaudecia runs a hotel located near the local market for additional income. She currently employs one farmhand. 
 
She and her husband have four children. The eldest is 12 years old and the youngest is a two-month-old baby.

Gaudencia has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says this will boost her farm's milk output and provide supplementary nutrition for her family's meals. She reports that animal diseases are an ongoing challenge, but she has high expectations. She adds that she will use a major part of the increased income to improve her business and raise the family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia Vilma  se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias y mercados, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Vilma works in a business raising small animals like guinea pigs and chickens. She looks after them and then sells them to different markets. The group member works from 8am until 6pm and has been in this business for four years now. It is going very well but her dream is to have somewhere where she can sell the animals. She is asking for the loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens. She is very happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Santos De Jesus

texts.es: Don Santos de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas desde hace mas de 30 años y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto adicional en el lugar que muestra en la fotografia pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de todos los materiales de contruccion necesarios para poder tener una vivienda mas amplia y comoda.

loans.use: para la compra de todos los materiales de contruccion necesarios

loans.name: Happy

texts.en: Happy lives in Vituka area of Dar es Salaam.She is married with two children. She owns a small tailoring mart and employs two assistants.
