Thanks to the loans they can use their credit in the businesses that each of them owns and in this way they can progress and get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for the different businesses owned by the members: fish, groceries, meat, fruits, sweet, and drinks.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Aurora es socia del Banco Comunal “La Juleñita” desde hace 6 años, vive en el distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 43 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo. Ella estudió primaria incompleta, se dedica a la venta de comida al paso.  En sus tiempos libres se dedica al bordado.

Aurora nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para aumentar su capital y comprar más productos.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar pollo, maíz y aceite para la elaboración de sus comidas.

Su sueño para el futuro es comprar algunos muebles y otros para su comodidad y que su hija sea profesional. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad de pago de los préstamos y los ahorros
texts.en:
Mrs. Aurora has been a partner in “La Juleñita” community bank for the past six years. She lives in the Juli district, in the provence of Chucuito near the neighborhood of Puno. She is 43 years hold, lives with her partner and one child. She completed her high school studies. She works selling prepared meals as a street vendor. In her free time, she does embroidery. Aurora tells us about the first loan she had with the Manuela Ramos Movement which was for S/ 300 Peruvian nuevos soles which allowed her to increase her working capital and buy more products. She is requesting a loan of S/300 Peruvian nuevos soles with which she can buy chicken, corn and oil to make her prepared meals.  Her dream for the future is to buy some furniture to be more comfortable and to help her daughter study to become a professional worker. What she likes most about her community bank is the simplicity of the loan payments and the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chicken, corn and oil

loans.name: Me

texts.en: C. is 37 years old and resides in Takmao, the capital of Cambodia. To earn a living, C. sells fresh fish that she either buys in bulk from her suppliers or gets from her husband who fishes at the river. This couple has two children; both are students and depend on their parent’s money. C. and her family’s daily living situation is not comfortable because their old house needs repair and some changes. Because of this problem, C. is applying for a Kiva loan of $1,200 through HKL. She will replace the broken part of her existing house and build a restroom for the family.

loans.use: To replace the broken part of her existing house and build a restroom

loans.name: Fidèle

texts.fr: V. Fidèle est née en 1987 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Fidèle est mariée à DANMAMMI François, un commerçant, et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Fidèle vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Agbalilamè à Cotonou. En effet, le couple s’est installé dans ce quartier il y a trois ans environs. Fidèle assure, avec l’aide de son mari, les charges de la famille. Fidèle n’a pas fréquenté l’école ; et pour assurer ses besoins, Fidèle s’est mise depuis deux ans, dans la vente d’akassa (aliment local fait à base d’amidon de maïs). A côté de cela, Fidèle vend du riz et des pâtes alimentaires à son domicile, ce qui lui permet d’avoir plusieurs sources de revenus. Fidèle  avait bénéficié d’un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. La clientèle de Fidèle s’accroît de jour en jour. Cependant, Fidèle manque de moyens financiers en ces périodes, pour pouvoir satisfaire tous ses clients. C’est ce qui amène Fidèle à solliciter un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin de mieux faire face à la demande des clients.
texts.en:
Fidele V. was born in 1987 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Fidel is married to Francois Danmammi a businessman and she is the mother of 2 school-aged children. Fidele lives together with her children and husband in Agbalilame, Cotonou. The couple have lived in this neighborhood for about 3 years. Fidele and her husband are able to meet the needs of the family. Fidele did not attended school and to make a living, she has been selling akassa (a corn based food) for the last two years. She also sells rice and food pates from her home which provides her with several sources of income. Fidele has benefited from a previous loan with ALIDe which she has duly repaid. Her clientele is increasing daily. She is missing the working capital during this period to meet customer demand. For this reason Filele is requesting a second loan from ALIDe to better meet this customer demand.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn and rice.

loans.name: Maria Petrona

texts.es:
la señora Maria Petrona F. tiene 59 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Ubence Reina quien se dedica a la albañileria, a esta edad ningun hijos depende de ellos.
 
la señora F. se dedica a la venta de pescado y camarones, tiene 4 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad,  sus ventas son todos los dias de la semana.
 
Maria esta solicitando el credito para compra de pescado blanco, pescado rojo y camarones.
en estas fechas que se aproxima semana santa el pescado es muy vendido y quiere estar bien preperada para cubrir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes.
Maria es una persona muy responsable y honesta.
texts.en:
Maria is 59 years old and married to Ubence, who works as a mason. At their ages they have no dependent children. Maria has been selling fish and shrimp, seven days a week, for four years. Maria is asking for this loan in order to buy white fish, red fish, and shrimp. Fish sells very well during the approaching holy week and she would like to be well prepared to meet her customers’ needs. Maria is a very responsible, honest person.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fish for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional goods in bulk for her business

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a widow with two children. She is 47 years old and sells groceries and drinks in her stall. She loves her business because her customers pay cash when they come to purchase groceries. She does not tolerate credit because she does not want to incur debt in her business. She hopes for a loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She is determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana is 54 years old and manages a sari-sari (variety) store. She’s been in business for 20 years.  Joining Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in 2003 has helped her improve her business. She takes care of four children in her family. She wishes for them to have a bright future.

She is currently asking a loan of 17,000 PHP to purchase groceries for her store to help her sustain her business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a small-scale farmer in western Kenya, near Kitale town. She is 49 years old and married with six children, all of whom have finished their education. Ruth has been farming for 29 years now, selling her milk and staple goods to the Kenya Cooperative Creameries and local market respectively. She also runs a kiosk and posho mill in the same building. The two businesses have enabled her to earn a living and meet her family's expenses. 

She has requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Ksh 25,000 to improve her poultry project. The extra income from this loan will allow her and her husband to be independent and not forced to rely on family members for financial assistance. In the future, Ruth hopes to move to a more strategic farming location and be prosperous. She also wants to construct rental homes on a plot of land she acquired years ago.

loans.use: To expand poultry project.

loans.name: Bintou Akosua

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes, elle a plus de 15 ans d’expérience dans ce commerce ce qui fait qu’elle est très connue dans son  quartier. Elle fait face à une diminution de son stock de marchandise raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter une quinzaine de pagnes. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman has run an income-generating business selling pagnes (a type of brightly-printed West African cloth), and her more than 15 years of experience in this field has led her to be very well-known in her area. She is faced with a shortage in her stock of merchandise, which is why she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy about 15 pagnes. She is married and has two children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagnes (a type of printed West African cloth)

loans.name: Jasmines Group

texts.es:
Banco de emprendimiento LOS JASMINES, esta formado por 11 integrantes, el la cual son 9 mujeres y 2 varones, todos los socios viven en el torno, el siguientes barrios: B/ 6 de mayo, B/ mira flores, B/ villa feliz, todos cuentan con negocio como ser: licorería, venta de cosméticos, venta de charque, venta de refresco   
La capacitación de este banco de emprendimiento  fue de 3 días  lo cual todas las socias asistieron a las reuniones. 

Este banco de emprendimiento esta formado por una mesa directiva lo cual fue elegida por todas las socias 

PRESIDENTA: La Sra. Celia, nació en Cochabamba el 19/02/1986, cuenta con el negocio de licorería hace 3 años, tiene 1 hijo la cual ella es madre soltera, vive en el torno hace 5 años, el crédito que solicito es para comprar mas mercadería, como ser: Cerveza en lata, Singani Chapaco y Variedad de refrescos y asi poder surtir su licoreria, es una persona muy trabajadora esta desde las dos de la tarde hasta las tres de la madrugada porque en ese horario es donde mas venta tiene.

TESORERA: La Sra. Leidy, nació en el torno  el 11 de julio de 1989, cuenta con el negocio de licorería hace 3 años, la Sra. Leidy  es soltera, y vive en el torno hace 9 años, el crédito que solicito es para comprar mas mercadería como refrescos, Papas fritas, mani salado y hielo para surtir su licoreria y así poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

La SECRETARIA: es la Sra. Lucila, nació en el torno  El 31 de octubre de 1990, cuenta con el negocio de licorería, la Sra. Lucila  es soltera, y vive en el torno hace 5 años, el crédito que ella solicito es para  aumentar su capital de trabajo, las tres socias se dedican a esta actividad, de este modo se conocieron y entamblaron una muy buen aamistad.

El Banco de Emprendimiento LOS JASMINES le esta muy agradecido con emprender por ayudarlos a seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The Los Jasmines lending bank is composed of 11 members; 9 women and 2 men. They all live in Torno, in the following neighborhoods: 6 de Mayo; Mira Flores; Villa Feliz. They run businesses such as: liquor stores, cosmetics sales, meat jerky sales, and drink sales. The training for this lending bank lasted 3 days and all of the members attended the meetings. This lending bank is made up of a board of directors which was elected by all of the members. PRESIDENT: Celia, born in Cochamamba on 19/02/1986, has had a liquor store for 3 years. She has one child and is a single mother. She has lived in El Torno for 5 years. Her loan is for the purchase of more merchandise, like: cans of beer, Chapaco brand Singani [Singani is the national spirit of Bolivia], and different types of sodas in order to offer a wider range of products. She is a very hard-working woman who is in her store from 2pm to 3am, since sales are best between those hours. TREASURER: Leidy, born in Torno on July 11 1989, has had a liquor store for 3 years. She is single and has lived in Torno for 9 years. Her loan is for the purchase of merchandise, like sodas, potato chips, salted peanuts and ice so that she can better serve her clients by offering a wider range of products. The SECRETARY: Lucila, born in Torno on October 31, 1990, has a liquor store. She is single and has lived in El Torno for 5 years. The loan is to increase her working capital. These three members all do the same work, and this is how they know each other. The Los Jasmines lending bank is very grateful to be borrowing to help them continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beer, sodas, singani and snacks

loans.name: Nhaem

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhaem T. is 61 years old and is a villager who lives in Thmei village, Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Nhork Ro, are farmers who own a piece of land on which they grow beans and corn. In order to increase their income to improve the family living, Mrs. Nhaem T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

This couple has two children, both of whom are farmers who also support their parents’ farming. Mrs. Nhaem T.’s husband is shown with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Maria Américo nasceu no Distrito de Morumbeni, Província de Inhambane, sul de Moçambique, casada e mae de 1 filho de 19 anos de idade, que vai a escola. Fez 10ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 enteados que vivem com ela.
Saiu de Inhambane para Boane quando seu pai foi transferido em missão de serviço quando ela tinha apenas 2 anos. Trabalha como empregada domestica ha mais de 2 anos, tem um salário de 1.300.00mt por mês que aplica na despesas de casa e com ajuda do seu marido que trabalha como pedreiro consegue poupar algum através de xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de vizinhos que são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 11.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 5.000.00mt, 5.800.00mt, 6.000.00mt para habitação e comercio.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua obra.
texts.en:
Maria Américo was born in the Morumbeni District, Inhambane Province, in southern Mozambique. She is married and the mother of one son who is 19 years old and attends school. She completed school through the 10th grade but could not continue due to a lack of financial resources. She lives in her own home with her family and supports 2 stepchildren who live with her. She left Inhambane for Boane when her father was transferred for work when she was just 2 years old. She has been working as a maid for over 2 years and has a monthly salary of 1.300.00mt which she uses for household expenses. With the help of her husband who is a stonemason, she is able to save a bit of money through xitique (a traditional rotational savings plan). She has never had a loan with other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through neighbors who are clients of this institution. This is her 4th loan, in the amount of 11.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase construction material (cement, sand, stones, etc.) to continue building her home. Her previous loans were for 5.000.00mt, 5.800.00mt, 6.000.00mt for housing and business. She promises to pay back this loan on schedule in order to have access to additional loans. In the future she plans to request more loans to complete construction.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of construction material (cement, sand, stone, etc. )

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia O. is from the village of Madalag, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 58 years old, married and has 10 adult-aged children. Cresencia owns and operates a business selling fish. Cresencia has been engaged in her business for 29 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Cresencia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cresencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Cresencia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Cresencia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

location.town: Liloy-Madalag, Jose Dalman Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson A. is from the city of Ambalatungan Santiago. He is 24 years old. Wilson is single. To make a living, Wilson owns & operates a business venture operating a motorcycle-transport tricycle. Wilson has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Wilson joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Wilson is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services that he provides. This will be the first loan taken out by Wilson from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided.

loans.name: Anatalia

texts.en:
Anatalia B. is from Barangay 18, Gingoog City. She is 50 years old. Anatalia is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Anatalia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Anatalia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Anatalia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Anatalia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Anatalia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his field

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a hardworking single lady who does dairy farming. She is advantaged because her business is located in a favorable environment and she has a ready market. She also does arable farming for additional income.

Grace is grateful to Faulu Kenya for helping her to improve her financial status. Through Ikinu Clean Shine group under Faulu Kenya, she previously took out a loan of 20,000 KES. She is now requesting another loan of 40,000 KES to buy another cow.

Grace has five years of experience in her business and she hopes to own more cows in the future.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Patricia Yessenia

texts.es:
Patricia de 34 años, vive en una zona urbana llamada “Suburbio” caracterizada porque la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales. Ella hace cerámicas y las vende al por mayor y menor. 

Para poder solventa los gastos familiares ella comenzó aprender cerámicas para venderlas al por mayor y menor. Ella hace cerámicas de todo tipo imágenes animadas y otros dibujos. Aunque trabaja sola porque se separo de su esposo ella sigue trabajando para darle una mejor vida a sus dos hijos que están en escuelas fiscales. 

Para seguir haciendo cerámicas ella quiere comprar con el préstamo moldes, materiales de cerámica. En el futuro quiere tener un local con sus propias manualidades.
texts.en:
Patricia is 34 years old and lives in an urban area called Suburbio, which is characterized by the fact the majority of the people living there are informal merchants. She makes ceramics and sells them both wholesale and retail.

She began to learn ceramics to sell them at wholesale and retail in order to be able to cover the household expenses. She makes ceramics with all types of animated imaged and other drawings. Although she works alone because she separated from her husband, she continues to work in order to provide her two children, who are in public schools, with a better life.

In order to continue making ceramics, she wants to use the loan to purchase molds and ceramic materials. In the future she wants to have a shop with her own handicrafts.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ceramics, blocks

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita M. is from the village of Brgy. Sta. Cruz, Solano,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 58 years old. Conchita is single. To make a living, Conchita owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Conchita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Conchita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conchita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Conchita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Conchita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Brgy. Sta. Cruz, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: La señora Nora de edad de 49 años vive en la zona de km14 barrio Simón Bolívar hace8 años  la señora  oriunda  de  Samanchita Gran Chaco Tarija. Su Actividad es la venta de comida hace 1 año y como segunda actividad cuenta con el negocio de una relojería en la zona de la ramada el negocio de la relojería atiende  el yerno porque a ella no le da el tiempo por el negocio venta de comida, ya que es muy conocida por el buen sazón de sus platillos.Estado civil: soltera hace 15 años la señora no cuentan cuenta con ningún hijo a su poder porque todos son mayores de edad y ya tienen una familia.Al mismo tiempos ellos están agradecidos con nuestra entidad por apoyarlos y depositarles la confianza para adquirir su crédito porque lo necesita para la compra de más sillas y compra de un horno para hacer pollo al espiedo y el resto para capital de trabajo.
texts.en: Nora is 49 years old and lives in the Simon Bolivar neighborhood in the Km 14 zone.  She has been making and selling meals for about a year, and her second support is a watch business in the ramada area. Her son-in-law runs the watch business because she doesn’t have time while she’s selling meals; she’s very well known for her well-seasoned dishes. Civil state: single for 15 years. She has no dependants, all of her children are married and have their own families. They are happy with the support she is getting and they are confident she will receive a loan, as she needs it to buy more chairs, an oven to make chicken “espiedo” and the rest to use as business capital.

loans.use: To buy chairs and an oven

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
El Señor Ricardo O. de 58 años de edad esta casado hace 36 años con la Señora Guillerma Lopez de 55 años de edad; el matrimonio tiene seis hijos de los cuales dos ya estan casados, uno de ellos se encuentra viviendo en el exterior y los restantes tres de 33, 20 y 16 años viven con ellos.
Hace 36 años, Don Ricardo, era empleado de una empresa privada, al mismo tiempo seguía un curso para carpinteros que duró 6 meses, al final de este curso decidió emprender su propio negocio con un poco de ahorro que había juntado de su anterior trabajo.
Solicita este préstamo para la compra de maderas,  terciadas  clavos. Ya que tiene varios pedidos de muebles para las fiestas de fín de año. La gente solicita sus servicios por el trabajo fino que realiza.-
texts.en: Ricardo O. is 58-years-old. He's been married for 36 years to Guillerma Lopez, who is 55-years-old. They have six children, two of whom are married, one of whom lives abroad, and three or whom (33, 20, and 16-years-old) still live at home. Thirty-six years ago Ricardo was employed at a private company while he took a 6-month carpentry course. When he finished the course he decided to start his own business with a small savings from his previous job. He's requesting this loan to buy wood and nails because he has several orders for furniture for end-of-the-year parties. People request his services for the high quality of his work.

loans.use: Purchase of wood, slings, and nails

loans.name: Mariscal Santa Cruz Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Mariscal Santa Cruz” inicia su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, es un grupo nuevo que se ha reunido para recibir los servicios de crédito, capacitación y atención en salud.  Está compuesta por once integrantes.  Los negocios son diversos: tejido y venta de periódicos, venta de detergentes, venta de comida, venta de pescado, tejido y venta de verduras, venta de comida, panadería, taller de metal mecánica, tienda carnicería y confección de deportivos.

La presidenta de la banca comunal, señora Rosalía es una mujer joven de 24 años, madre de un niño ingresó a formar parte de la banca comunal porque necesitaba capitalizarse para llevar adelante su negocio de venta de comida.  La señora Rosalía vende comida en la zona de Tilata los días martes y viernes de 7:30 a 14:00, por ahora trabaja sola.    Su préstamo solicitado es por Bs.1000.- y será invertido en la compra de arroz, papa y otros.
Cuando se le consultó que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que le gusta la reunión que se tiene en el centro focal.
texts.en:
The “Mariscal Santa Cruz” community bank is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada regional office.  This is a new group which has come together to receive loan services, training and health services.  It has eleven members.  The members' businesses are all different: knitting and selling newspapers, selling detergents, selling food, selling fish, knitting and selling vegetables, selling food, bakery, metal workshop, butcher's shops and making sports shoes.

The president of the community bank, Rosalía, is a young woman of 24.  She has one child and joined the bank because she needed working capital to carry out her food sales business.  Rosalía sells food in the Tilata district on Tuesdays and Fridays from 7.30am to 2.00pm.  For now, she works alone.  She is requesting a loan for 1,000 bolivianos and she will invest the money in buying rice, potatoes, etc.

When we asked her what she liked about Pro Mujer, she told us that she likes the meetings which take place in the regional office.

loans.use: To buy rice, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, who is 49 years old, does welding for a living.  He has been in the business for four years and hopes that someday he will open a hardware shop.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business and employed two people.  He has also managed to send his children to school.

He has requested 60,000 KES to buy tubes, a buffing machine and a spraying machine.

loans.use: To buy tubes, buffing machine and spraying machine.

loans.name: Mericon

texts.en:
Mericon S. is from the village of Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 31 years old. Mericon is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Mericon owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. She also buys and sells vegetables & green bananas. Mericon has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mericon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mericon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Mericon is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as instant noodles & junk foods. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Mericon from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as instant noodles & junk foods

location.town: Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Sandagsuren

texts.en: Sandagsuren R. is 47 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Tuv province in central Mongolia. She and her daughter live in a house and enclosure. Her oldest son works as a teacher, her younger two children both attend university and her husband is a herder. Sandagsuren operates a meat trading business in her town. She sells a variety of meats to her customers in a rented stall at the local market. Tsevelmaa started her business in 2002 and has since gained a lot of experience as a businesswoman. Her business currently operates at a stable level and her earnings have enabled her to not only pay her children's tuition fees but also to provide for her family. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase and preserve more meat in order to increase her sales so that she can continue to afford paying her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase and preserve more meat

loans.name: Boldbaatar

texts.en:
Boldbaatar is 49 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Songino-Hairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia’s capital city. He and his family live together in a house and fenced yard. His wife is currently unemployed and his youngest son attends a school.
Boldbaatar operates a taxi service using his own car to support his family. His oldest daughter also drives a taxi using her own car. Boldbaatar started his taxi business in 2010 after working for the firefighting team as a driver between 2004 and 2010. He has gained a lot of experience as a driver. Boldbaatar is modest and honest and says, "All I want is to continue to run this business as a stable operation in order to provide my family." Boldbaatar is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to use for his household to repair his house and fence.

loans.use: To repair his house and fence

loans.name: Pich

texts.en:
Mrs. Pich Y. is 60 years old, and she lives in Kandal Leu village in Kandal province. She is single and she lives with three family members.

Mrs. Pich Y. earns her living by selling groceries in the local village. Because her business is doing well, she would like to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to sell.  With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve her standard of living.  She is pictured with her niece.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn P., from the town of Banga, is 48 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting rice for sale. She is working hard to improve her business.

Jocelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from CEVI, she is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: John Muriithi

texts.en:
John Muriithi is 27 years old and married to Alice Muthoni who is a housewife. He is a horticulture farmer and has been running the business for a period of about 10 years with an income of KES. 15,000 per month.

This is his third loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous loans well and in good time. He intends to use the loan to hire labor for his farm.

He hopes to build a better house for his family and expand his business in future.

loans.use: To hire labor for his farm

loans.name: Ma. Isabel

texts.en:
Ma. Isabel is a 51-year-old single woman who supports her family by operating a general store and an electronic reloading business.  She lives in Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and electronic reloading businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. 

Ma. Isabel is borrowing PHP 18,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell in her general store. This will be her 18th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 16,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ma. Isabel aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: purchase more stocks to sell in the general store

loans.name: Alberto Jose

texts.es: EL SEÑOR T. LABORA COMO AGENTE DE SEGURIDAD, ES ACOMPAÑADO, TIENE UNA PERSONA A SU CARGO, ES LE PRIMER CREDITO QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, AGRADECE EL APOYO QUE LE BRINDA ESTA INSTITUCION, CON ESTE DESEMBOLSO VA A PODER CANCELAR DEUDA   QUE UTILIZO PARA GASTOS FUNEBRE DE SU MAMA.
texts.en:
Sr. Alberto T. works as a security guard. He is married and has one dependent. This is the first loan he has received from CEPRODEL. He is grateful for the support that the Institution has provided.

This loan will be used to repay the debt he accumulated as a result of his mother’s funeral expenses.

loans.use: To pay for his mother's funeral expenses.

loans.name: Djénéba

texts.fr:
Djénéba Traoré est une célibataire de 31 ans et mère d’un enfant qui vit avec son enfant chez ses parents dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.
Mademoiselle Djénéba Traoré est élève dans une école secondaire de la place.
Pour subvenir à ses besoins tels payer ses études, elle décida de mener des activités génératrices de revenus. Elle opte pour l’achat vente de pagnes, chaussures et parfums. Avec 3 années d’expérience, elle maîtrise bien son activité.
Afin d’obtenir un fonds de roulement consistant, elle décide de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter une série de lots de pagnes, de parfums et  de chaussures. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de république du Mali) et effectue sa vente à la maison et en ambulant dans les différents quartiers de Bougouni. Sa clientèle est composée de toutes les catégories sociales.
Avec ce prêt, elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000 FCFA, qui lui permettra de d’améliorer son entreprise et  payer le prêt.
texts.en:
Djénéba Traoré is 31 years old, single, and lives with her daughter  and parents in the Torakabougou quarter of Bougouni. Miss Djénéba Traoré is a pupil at a nearby secondary school. In order to meet her daughter's needs, such as paying for her studies, she decided to launch a business. For the past three years she has sold wax cloths, shoes and perfume for a living, and knows her trade well.
In order to achieve consistent working capital she has decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso to purchase a job lot of wax cloths, perfume and shoes. She sources her goods from Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali) and sells her goods from home or via door-to-door sales in the various quarters of Bougouni. Her customers come from all walks of life. 
She aims to use the loan to help generate an average monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA which will enable her to improve her business and repay her loan.

loans.use: To purchase various items

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es: La señora Rosario se dedica al comercio de material escolar y de varios otros productos en su tienda de barrio-bazar, sus ventas son mayormente material escolar y peluches, se dedica a dicha actividad desde hace dos años cuenta con mercadería bien surtida, vive en domicilio en anticrético, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como peluches, regalos, material escolar y abarrotes ya que durante la época escolar las ventas se incrementan pero también tiene que surtir de mas productos su tienda para asi tener mas clientes, es una persona amable y trabajadora, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Rosario sells school supplies and other items in her store in the bazaar. She mainly sells school supplies and stuffed animals. She has been doing this business for years and has a good assortment of merchandise. She lives in a rented house with her husband and two children. She is asking for this loan in order to buy merchandise such as stuffed animals, gifts, school supplies and groceries. During the school year her business increases and she needs to provide a variety of products in her store in order to have more customers. She is a friendly and hardworking person. She is thankful for the institution that provides this opportunity to her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as stuffed animals, gifts, school supplies and groceries.

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en:
Arnulfo  is from the village of Lapasan, Clarin,Misamis Occidental. He is 40 years old. Arnulfo is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Arnulfo owns & operates transportation services. The main source of income for the business comes from operating "tricycle" transport services. Arnulfo has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Arnulfo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arnulfo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from GDMPC. Arnulfo is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Arnulfo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Marselina

texts.en:
Marselina is a 32-year-old lady and a mother of three children: Riniyati, 12 years old; Reinaldy, and Fresilia, 1 year old. Both Riniyati and Reinaldy are still at elementary school.

Marselina operates a pig breeding business as the income source for her family. She has been involved in this business for five months. Marselina was interested in operating this business because of the high demand for pork in the market as well as the fair market price for pork. Marselina thought that she had to take this opportunity to improve her family's lives. 

Marselina initiated the business by purchasing three piglets, aged 1 month, to be raised. She is expecting that from the business she will be able to generate more income for her family.
 
Actually, Marselina has sold one pig, but the income that she earned was not as much as her expectation since the pig could not achieve proper weight. Marselina realized that she is not able to feed the piglets with good fodder because she has only limited capital. 

Marselina plans to enhance her business by purchasing a piglet and fodder. She has been involved in TLM’s group lending program for two cycles and now she is moving to the Individual Lending Program and requesting a loan of IDR 4,500,000. The loan would be spent on one piglet and a few sacks of fodder. Marselina is hoping that TLM is willing to approve her loan application so she will be able to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase one piglet and a few sacks of fodder.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 24 years old and married. He has been operating a (bodaboda) motorbike transport business for one year. Since he joined Faulu Kenya his business has improved, which has allowed Peter to improve his living standards. This is in part due to the business management training he has received through the seminars conducted by Faulu Kenya. He has also managed to buy a second motorbike, thereby increasing his income. Peter hopes to venture into other businesses in five years and further improve his standard of living. He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy another motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.es: Estrella es una mujer valiente, es divorciada y vive con sus dos hijos en su propiedad. Tiene 20 años de experiencia en la venta de carne de ovejas y cerdos, animales que adquiere en la feria ganadera y los beneficia para venderlos en su puesto de ventas que es una carnicería que queda en el mercado central  dentro de su ciudad. Empezó con este negocio con la venta de carne de cerdo, de la cual pudo recuperar y tener una buena ganancia, desde entonces compra más animales. Ahora su prioridad es comprarse una refrigeradora que le permita guardar su mercadería y mantenerla en buenas condiciones. Además cuenta siempre con el apoyo de sus hijos para las diversas actividades de su negocio como el transporte y la venta. Estrella esta muy deseosa de continuar en su negocio que le permite sostener a su familia  por lo que ha decidido aumentar su capital de trabajo. Son 23 oportunidades de crédito que tiene y un buen record positivo que habla de su responsabilidad y compromiso en sus pagos, razón por la cual esta muy contenta  porque durante este tiempo de trabajo con MFP le ha servido para mejorar su capital de trabajo. Por ello pide una colaboración para pueda continuar con su trabajo. Ahora su dinero lo invertirá en la compra de más animales ya que han aumentado de precio y desde tenerlos como reservas.
texts.en:
Estrella is a strong woman, she is divorced and lives with her two children on her own property.   She has 20 years experience in selling meat from sheep and pigs, animals that she acquires at the cattle market and then benefits from selling at her sales location, which is a butchery in the central market in her city. She started this business selling pork, from which she was able to obtain and keep a nice profit.  Since then, she has bought more animals. Now her priority is to buy a refrigerator that will allow her to store her merchandise and keep it in good condition.  In addition, she also always counts on the support of her children for activities related to her business, such as transport and sales. 

Estrella is very eager to continue in her business, which allows her to support her family.  This is why she has decided to increase her working capital. She has had 23 opportunities for loans, and has a good positive payment record which speaks to her responsibility and commitment to her payments.

She is very happy because during this time working with MFP, it has served her in improving her working capital.  Therefore she calls for collaboration so that she can continue with her work.  Now your money will be invested in the purchase of more animals, because they have already increased in price and she can hold them as reserves.

loans.use: to buy more animals.

loans.name: Janylkan's Group

texts.en:
Janylkan, 48, is the treasurer of this group. She is a very hardworking woman. Together with her husband, she started cattle breeding. However, due to high investment needs, she switched to farming. It was 2002 when she, with her own funds of 4,000 soms, bought her first potato seeds and fertilizers. Soon she had generated enough revenue to organize the wedding ceremonies for her son according to Kyrgyz traditions. Janylkan’s purpose for this loan is to purchase fertilizers for proper care of her potatoes. Janylkan is grateful to Mol Bulak Finance for providing access to Kiva funds. She realizes how getting financial assistance in hard times is helpful for the continuation of business. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
	
 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Flor De Cielo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE CIELO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Luiza. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda, ayudante de albañil, venta de verduras, venta de papa, venta de fruta, venta de zapatos, venta de abarrotes.

La señora Luiza  indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de frutas que viene trabajando hace tres años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de frutas) que comprará de los mayoristas de la calle de Villa Dolores. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella vive en concubinato  y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta salud
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Flor de Cielo” (Flower of Heaven) is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Community Center. The group consists of nine members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Luiza. The members of the Communal Bank engage in different businesses such as managing a store, working as a masonry assistant, selling vegetables, selling potatotes, selling fruit, selling shoes, and selling groceries.

Sra. Luiza says this is her first loan cycle while working with Pro Mujer. She joined the organization after being invited by a promoter. Luiza currently has a business selling fruit and started working three years ago.

The loan she is receiving will be used to increase her capital for purchasing fruit, which she acquires from the wholesale vendors along Villa Dolores Street. Working in this manner makes it possible for her to generate income to support her family. Luiza is in a common-law relationship and has six children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Luiza said she enjoys the health services.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en:
Jemma is married with two children. Jemma is 30 years old and lives in Tangub City.

Jemma sells bananas to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more bananas for her retail business.

Jemma has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Manhiça, provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 6 filhos dos quais todos frequenta a escola. Fez a 5ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras, vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é negociante ha bastante tempo onde vende produtos diversos,e tem um rendimento de cerca de 10.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (batatas, peixe, arroz, amendoim, massa, e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
Pretende contruir um estabelecimento comercial para ampliar a sua actividade comercial, assim irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Alice was born in Manhiça, in the southen Mozambican province of Maputo. She is a married mother of 6 children who all attend school. Alice attended school up to the 5th Grade but left due to her financial circumstances. She lives in her own home with her family and does not support anyone else.

She has never lived outside of her home town. She has been running her own business for some time, selling a range of products, from which she earns a monthly salary of around 10,000MTs. This covers for household expenses and allows her to save a little in her Millennium BIM bank account.

She has never borrowed money from other banks. She heard about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a Hluvuku client. This is Alice's first loan with this institution, for 10,000MTs; she wants to use this to buy food products (potatoes, fish, rice, peanuts, pasta and other items) in order to increase her stock levels.
Alice wants to expand her business by building premises, and she intends to apply for further loans with Hluvuku to achieve this aim.

loans.use: to buy and sell food (potatoes, fish, rice, peanuts, pasta and other products).

loans.name: Alida

texts.es:
Alida tiene 44 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de bebidas y comida, es casada, tiene una hija y tres hijos, y reside en la Colonia Trochez en el municipio de Juticalpa. 

Alida aprendió de su oficio hace 8 años y fue gracias a una de sus amigas, ya que esta tenia un puesto de comidas y la contrató. Luego de unos meses la hija de Alida le comentó que en vez de trabajar para otros debía trabajar lo suyo de manera propia. Entonces Alida un dia sintonizando la radio escuchó la publicidad de FAMA y se abocó a las oficinas a solicitar un prestamo, el cual unos dia despues le fue otorgado por Lps. 2,000 y solamente con ese poco de dinero comenzó con una venta de golosinas. Actualmente su negocio a crecido y ahora es un comedor y se llama Comedor Ingrid, trabaja sola, y su horario laboral inicia desde las 6:00 am y culmina las 4:00 pm y tiene una muy buena clientela. Su meta es llegar a tener un local propio ya que donde tiene instalado su comedor es alquilado y el costo es alto. Ademas sueña en que poco a poco su pequeño comedor se ira convirtiendo en un restaurante de comida buffet.

El prestamo que Alida solicita lo necesita para comprar refrescos, agua, jugos, verduras, salsas, carnes, pastas, pollo, embutidos, frijoles, arroz, platano, azucar, cafe, lacteos, entre otros productos necesarios para la elaboracion de las comidas. Alida confia que con el apoyo de este financiamiento pueda comprar todo lo necesario para surtir su negocio y mantenerlo activo, y que pueda obtener ganancias para cubrir los gastos mas necesarios de sus hijos y hogar.

Alida tiene mas de 5 años de trabajar con los prestamos de FAMA y siempre ha cancelado sus cuotas puntualmente, y con tambien ha podido ampliar su negocio y ha mejorado su vivienda.
texts.en:
Alida is 44 years old, and works selling food and drink.  She is married with one daughter and three sons, and lives in La Colonia Trochez in the municipality of Juticalpa. 

Alida learned this trade eight years ago, thanks to one of her friends who had a food stand and hired her.  Several months later Alida's daughter suggested to her that instead of working for other people, she should work for herself.  So one day Alida was tuning the radio and heard the advertisement for FAMA, and she took herself to the offices to request a loan.  Some days later, they offered her Lps.2,000, and with only this small amount of money, she started selling candy. 

Today, her business has grown and now she has a diner called "Comedor Ingrid".  She works on her own; her works schedule starts at 6 a.m. and goes till 4 p.m., and she has a very good customer base.  Her goal is to be able to have her own premises for her diner, as it's rented and the cost is high.  She also dreams that little by little her small diner will be able to be converted to a buffet restaurant.

The loan that Alida is requesting is needed by her to buy soda, water, juice, vegetables, salsa, meat, pasta, chicken, sausages, beans, rice, plantains, sugar, coffee, dairy products, among other ingredients necessary for making the meals.

Alida trusts that with the help of this financing she can buy everything necessary to stock up her business and keep it going, and that she can generate earnings to cover the most necessary expenses of her children and household.

Alida has been working with loans from FAMA for more than five years, and has always paid back her repayments punctually.  She has also been able to grow her business and improve her home.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, sausages, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Erick

texts.es: Erick tiene 23 años, es un joven muy trabajador, vive en su propia casa junto a su querido hijo Dayron de 05 años; a quien le inculca aferrarse al estudio. Erick a su corta edad es un joven centrado en sus responsabilices y obligaciones, la vida le enseñó tropiezos pero no se amilana. Hoy trata de sobresalir cultivando plantas de cacao, café y frutas cítricas, los cuales después de cosecharlos los lleva a vender a la ciudad de San Francisco, en donde ya tiene diversos compradores, que sabiendo de la calidad de su producto no dudan en esperarlo para comprarle todos lo cosechado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva 06 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus chacras, ya que tiene que hacerlo con mucho cuidado por que los productos químicos no perjudiquen su salud. En adelante, espera seguir ahorrando sus ingresos por que desea comprar nuevas tierras. Este es su segundo cedito con MFP  y pro tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes ya que sabe que el dinero obtenido le será muy beneficioso en el progreso de su labor y se siente contento por pertenecer al grupo de socios de su banco comunal. Con el dinero solicitado, contratará jornaleros para que lo apoyen en el mantenimiento respectivo de sus cultivos como: la poda, el desmonte y la fumigación.
texts.en: Erick is 23 years old.  He is a very hard working young man who lives in his own home with his dear, 5-year old son, Dayron.  He instills in his son the importance of education.  Even at his young age, Erick is focused on his responsibilities and obligations.  Life has given him obstacles, but he is undaunted.  Today he tries to excel at growing cacao, coffee and citrus fruits.  After harvesting his plants, he brings them to the city of San Francisco to sell.  In San Fransisco, he has various purchasers who are familiar with the quality of his products and are always sure to wait for him to purchase his whole crop.  What Erick likes most about his work is planting his fields and making them fertile and productive.  He has been in this line of work for 6 years and feels that the most difficult part is spraying his parcels of land, which is something he must do very carefully so that the chemicals don't damage his health.  In the future, he hopes to keep saving his earnings so he can purchase additional land.  This is Erick's second loan with MFP, and he hopes each one of you can help him, as he knows the money he will be loaned will be very beneficial in the progress of his labor.  He is happy to a part of the group of members that make up his communal bank.  With the requested money, Erick will contract day laborers to help him maintain his crops: pruning, clearing and spraying.

loans.use: to contract day laborers.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad, a 39-year-old married mother of four school-aged children, lives in the village of Katipunan in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. For the past 10 years, she has been growing a variety of root crops, shrubs, legumes and spices on fertile and rich cultivated land, selling them in the local market and interested neighborhoods.

A member of GDMPC for five years, Trinidad has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to pay for land preparation costs. In the future, she hopes that the plants will continue to thrive and yield good financial returns. Trinidad plans to expand the cultivated area to earn more.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation costs.

loans.name: Roxana Marisol

texts.es:
Roxana, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, ella se dedica a vender mariscos en el mercado del pueblo, el oficio lo inicio hace tres años, todos los días vende sábado y domingo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar más mercadería (punches, pescado, camarones) para mejorar en las ventas y tener  variedad y aumentando la afluencia de la clientela.
El propósito de Roxana es comprar un vehículo, para transportar la venta a diferentes pueblos y tener más clientes y obtener  ganancias.
texts.en:
Roxana lives with her husband and two children. She sells seafood in the the town market. She started doing this work three years ago. She sells every day, including Saturday and Sunday.

She will use the loan to buy more merchandise (crab, fish, and shrimp) in order to improve her sales, have variety, and attract more customers. Roxana's aim is to buy a vehicle, so that she can transport her seafood to different towns, have more customers, and make profits.

loans.use: To buy fish, crab and shrimp.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Josefina works hard to support her family.

She has an entertainment (videoke) business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a coffee shop. 

Josefina is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy an additional unit for her entertainment business.

Josefina has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy an additional unit for her business.

loans.name: Aries (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  la ciudadela Las Orquídeas en la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las 10 sociss y 1 socio  del Banco Comunal Aries. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, servicios, entre otras cosas. Ellos unieron sus esfuerzos para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la Fundación Espoir, este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal  y esperan cumplir muy bien para seguir adelante en la institución.

Aquí conocimos a Suleyka, tiene 19 años  de edad, está soltera y estudia el tercer semestre de Auditoria en una Universidad de Manabí. Ella vive en la casa de una hermana.

La señorita Suleyka para obtener sus propios recursos y con estos poder solventar sus gastos de educación y personales se dedica en sus ratos libres a la venta de productos Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para dama), también trabaja en una oficina de encomiendas a nivel nacional, allí trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00. Realiza sus ventas en la universidad donde estudia en sus ratos libres, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente. Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien. Lo que más vende son los perfumes.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar perfumes, cosméticos, cremas y bisutería. 

Su sueño es terminar  sus estudios y ejercer su profesión. 

Las dos fotos pequeñas adjuntas son de un socio y una socia que por motivos de trabajo no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
In the old fortress “Las Orquedeas” (The Orchids) in the city of Portoviejo, the 10 female and 1 male members of the Aries Communal Bank meet every 15 days. They dedicate themselves to diverse activities including general commerce and services among other things. They united in order to gain access to benefits offered by the Espoir Foundation. This is the first loan cycle for their communal bank and they hope to comply fully in order to continue forward with the institution.

Here we get to know Sulayka, who is 19 years old, single, and studying in her 3rd semester at the University of Manabi. She lives in her sister's house.

In her spare time, Suleyka sells Yanbal products (beauty articles, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies accessories), to pay for her education and personal expenses. She also works in a national postal office from 8:00 am until 5:00 pm. She makes her sales in the university where she studies during her free time. Sulayka sells on credit and collects weekly. She has done this for a year and it is going very well. Perfumes are her best sellers.

Sulayka will use this loan to buy perfumes, cosmetics, creams, and ladies jewelry. Her dream is to finish her studies and exercise her profession.

The 2 accompanying small photos are of a male and a female member who because of their work could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and  costume jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.en:
Enrique is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Enrique provides motorcycle or habal-habal services. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy tools & to pay for gasoline.

Enrique has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Enrique hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & to pay for gasoline for the transportation services.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 28-years-old, married, and a mother of one child. She runs a boutique in Mwembe Tayari in Mombasa, a business that has been in operation for the last five years. The business is doing well.

This marks Catherine’s first borrowing from KADET to finance her business and with the money she plans to purchase more stock of clothes in her boutique. 

With the anticipated profits she hopes to be able to repay back her loan and to expand her business even further. She hopes to do well in business and to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothes for her boutique.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La señora Flora  tiene cuarenta  y un años de edad, es una señora trabajadora humilde  se dedica a la venta de pozole y a la  venta de pan desde hace cinco años.
Tiene la cantidad de  tres hijos  Dariana de un  año de edad Aries Iván de catorce años de edad y Juan Carlos de seis años de edad.
Ella nos cuenta  que lo que más  de su negocio es limpiar  el maíz para el rico pozole y destazar la carne.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de maíz para el pozole, pollos para la carne y chile, cebolla y platos.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para  seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Flora is 41 years old.  She is a hard-working and humble woman.  She has been selling “pozole” (a ritually significant, traditional pre-Columbian soup or stew from Mexico) and bread for five years.

She has three children.  Dariana is 1, Aries Iván is 14, and Juan Carlos is 6.

She tells us that what she likes the most about her business is cleaning the corn for the delicious pozole and butchering the meat.

She requested the loan to buy corn for the pozole, chickens for meat and chili, onions, and dishes.  She is grateful to the Fundación for the support they have given her in order to continue working.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make pozole.

loans.name: Big Five Neighbours Group

texts.en:
This is  Betty, a 48-year-old married mother of four children from Zimbabwe. Two are still at school. She also cares for four  other dependents from her extended family; among the dependents two are also still going to school. 

Betty runs a  business selling used clothes that she buys from South Africa and Mozambique. The business has been in operation for six years. Betty says the main challenge faced is stiff competition at the marketplace since some other traders have a wide range of stock. 

Betty has requested a loan of $400 to buy clothes in bulk for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to enhance the well-being of both families. In the future Betty plans to have a clothing shop selling new clothes.

loans.use: to buy used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Cilivia

texts.en:
Cilivia is 25-year-old a married woman with one child who does not attend school.  She has been operating a food stall in Yambio, South Sudan, for one year.

Cilivia is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase beans and onions. If she makes any extra income as a result of this loan, she plans to save the money in order to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 40 years old, married to James, and supports seven members of her family. She owns a cereals store in Kapsaos trading centre where she buys dry maize for resale.  She has been in the business for a period of three years earning a monthly income of Kes 10,000.

She is requesting a second loan of Kes 50,000 she will use the funds to purchase more bags of dry maize for resale. She will plough back the profits to purchase more stock for the business.  

Her hopes and dreams are to purchase a pick-up truck for distribution of cereals to a wider customer base and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To purchase dry maize for resale.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 52 years of age, married and blessed with five children. She is a house keeper and managing their rice field as well. She has been in this type of business for 30 years.
With her long duration in managing a rice filed business, Virginia claims that her expertise in farming is continually develop. She uses her expertise to produce good quality of crops and harvest a high yield. 
Virginia is asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and seeds to grow in her large field of rice. She will manage well her business, continue to be works hard in able to maintain her business and support her children needs in school and will hold a degree.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and seeds to grow in her large field of rice.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a baker. She bakes bread for sale at Adum Banso. She is married to a teacher and has one child. Lydia has been baking for three years now.  She supports her husband to feed and clothe their children. 

She will use her loan to purchase bags of flour, sugar, and oil for her bakery. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar, and oil for her bakery.

loans.name: Celestial Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxito una de ella es ESvetlana que se dedica a  comercializar venta de ropa y prendas de oro desde hace 1 año. Inicio con una pulpería luego con las ganancias fue diversificando su actividad comercial con los nuevos productos, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropas y prendas de plata, Ligia comercializa prendas de plata y Daysi vende ropa usada.
texts.en: This group consists of 3 successful entrepreneurs.  One of the members is Esvetlana who has been selling clothes for one year.  She started with a small store and later with the earnings she was able to diversify her commercial activity with new products.  She will invest this loan in buying new clothes and silver ornaments to sell.  Ligia sells silver ornaments as well and Daysi sells used clothing.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and silver ornaments to sell

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is a warrior woman, a fighter, and still strong at 41 years of age. She has dedicated her body and soul to her farming business and to her husband. 

Prisca has been characterized by her neighbours and farming friends as a friendly and charismatic woman. She dedicates herself to tending to the mixed farm that she began ten years ago. 

Prisca is tired of working just to survive and wishes to request a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase cereal grains. These grains will act as seeds during the planting season, food to Prisca’s family, and a commodity for trade. 

Enterprising farmers usually aggregate cereal produce from local farmers and sell it in lucrative urban markets that offer better prices. This trade helps farmers, like Prisca, to roll back cereal profits into the business and use the money to settle part of the high cost of inputs.

loans.use: to buy cereals to use for planting and for feeding her family.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga. She has a retail business selling animal feed.

Nga is 24 years old and she is married with 3 children.
She lives and works in Nong Cong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 3 dependents

This is Nga first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Nga has been involved in this business for 6 years.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having clean water syterm and hygeinic latrine.She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick…to build toilet and bath-room and water filter systerm .

In the future, Nga hopes for her business to do well, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: Xây mới nhà vệ sinh tự hoại

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en:
Nizami is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. He and his family settled in Sumgait city. Nizami was born in 1959. He is married, has 2 child. He sells of fruits and vegetables in his own car. He has not a shop. This car is his own. His car did not not work good. He had a problem with his car. This problem disturbed to him to expand his business.
Having borrowed a loan amount of $300, he repaired his car and bought the fruits and vegetables.
The second loan $500 he spent to buy 4 wheels and 1 accumulator and increased the amount of the fruits and vegetables. 
Now he needs a loan amount of $800 to build a shop. He plans to be busy with sale agricultural products.

loans.use: To build a shop. He plans to be busy with sale agricultural products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy a water tank

loans.name: Komla Amédzopé Achil

texts.fr:
Mr. Komla Amédzopé Achille S. was born in 1961 in Gbatopé in the Zio region. A married father of three (03) children, he is a carpenter by trade. This is a business that he has always continued, despite difficulties, as he is a dynamic and solid man. His wife does not have a significant source of revenue to be able to provide for the family, therefore; he is faced alone with miserable living conditions. His goal is to start a carpenting business, which would manufacture and sell furniture, beds and chairs. However, he does not have sufficient means to start it. He is therefore asking for a $1200 credit to buy wood and various tools. This would grow his income and would offer a better future for his family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur S. Komla Amédzopé Achille est né en 1961 à Gbatopé dans la préfecture de Zio. Marié et père de trois (03) enfants, il est menuisier de formation. Un métier qu’il continue toujours malgré les difficultés, il est toujours dynamique et solide. Sa femme n’ayant pas une source de revenu assez importante pouvant l’aider à supporter la famille, il est seule face à cette vie de misère. Il voulait relancer son activité en fabricant des meubles, des chaises, des lits à vendre. Mais faute de moyen. Il vient solliciter un financement de $1200 pour acheter du bois et divers outils. Ceci renforcerait ses revenus en vue d’un meilleur devenir de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying wood to manufacture and sell furniture

loans.name: Akouessoudé

texts.fr:
Married and the mother of four children, Mrs. Akouessoudé K. was born in 1967 in the prefecture of Vo. She currently lives in the village of Avéglodjigan where she runs a straw mat business. She buys the mats on credit from mat weavers and sells them from market to market. Once sold, she pays for them and makes do with anything left over. She admits that it would be a profitable business, especially if she had sufficient funds to pay for the mats in cash. To realize this plan, she is asking for a loan of $700 to invest in the business. This will enable her to improve her quality of life while giving her financial independence.

Mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants, Madame K. Akouessoudé est née en 1967 dans la Préfecture de Vo. Elle réside actuellement dans le village d’Avéglodjigan où elle exerce le commerce de nattes. Elle prend des nattes à crédit auprès des tresseuses et elle les met en vente de marché en marché. Après la vente, elle paye et se contente du surplus s’il y en a. Elle avoue que c’est un commerce rentable surtout si elle dispose d’un fond de commerce propre avec lequel elle achète au comptant les nattes. Pour réaliser ce dessein. Elle demande un apport financier de $700 pour investir dans ce commerce. Cela lui permettra d’améliorer sa qualité de vie en ayant une indépendance financière.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buy and sell straw mats

loans.name: Aicha

texts.en: S. Aicha is a fruit and vegetable seller in Treichville, in the south of Abidjan. She largely sells pepper at this time of the year corresponding to the production season of this product. She supplies various restaurants and some pepper paste artisan producers. S. Aicha is 31 years old and has 2 children. The elder is in primary school. She will use the loan to purchase batches of pepper from the production field.

loans.use: Sylla Aicha will use the loan to purchase goods from the production field

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Srey was married in 1988 and has three daughters. She has been in the business of weaving silk since 1988. She learned to weave silk from her mother one year before she got married. Her eldest daughter also weaves silk at home, and her other two daughters are studying at high school in the village. Her husband grows rice and looks after the cows.

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of $100. She will use this loan to repair the water pumping machine for her husband's business of growing rice.

loans.use: To repair water pumping machine

loans.name: Yoselin

texts.en:
Yoselin is in her late twenties and she has three children, two of them girls.  They go to the public school in her community.  Yoselin runs a small beverage store that she opened one year ago.  People visit her store to get different kinds of beverages such as beer, whisky, wine, ron and energy drinks.  Currently she has a lot of loyal customers.  On the weekends, to give customers the incentive to purchase at her store, Yoselin offers specials from 10:00 pm to 2:00 am.

The entrepreneur is requesting a loan to purchase more beverages to supply her business.  During the holiday season people usually buy more drinks.  “ I have to get ready for this very moment”, she says.
