Currently, the store is the principal source of income of Yoselin, and she wants to increase her income in order to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: Increase inventory to face big demands from customers during the holidays.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.en:
Mohira K. is 42 years old. She is married to a teacher and has two children. Their elder daughter is 18 and the younger son is 15 years old.

Mohira sells clothes in a store located in the one of the local markets. She has already been in this business for 2 years. Mohira started by selling childrens' clothing. However, with time she came to conclusion that it was more profitable for her to sell womens' clothing instead. As teachers are not paid very well at the present time, Mohira’s business is the main source of income for her family.

Today, Mohira requests US$600 to purchase womens winter clothes for sale. This is the second time Mohira will be receiving a loan from IMON. Mohira managed to pay the previous loan precisely and timely. The term of the loan is 6 months.

loans.use: To purchase women's winter clothes

loans.name: Naanjela

texts.en:
Greetings from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! Naanjela M. is 28 years old. She is married and has three children, who are 9 months, 4, and 7 in age. 
 
In 2000, Naanjela established an African batik cloth business. She works 9 to 12 hours a day, two to three days a week, and is assisted by her husband and mother-in-law. Naanjela has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA.  She now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $260. In the future, Naanjela plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of African batik cloth in bulk

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma belongs to the women’s marketplace group “Grupo Mientras Tanto Mujeres del Campo Ferial”, and makes her living selling crafts, sweaters, scarves, and woven ponchos. Her stand is located in the artisan market alongside the main plaza of the city of Huaraz in the Department of Ancash.

With the loan of US$125.00 (PEN 300.00) which will be paid in full in 4 payments, she will buy ceramic ornaments, ponchos, sweaters, and vests to sell to her clients.

She is 38 years old and has two small daughters. Her husband is a bricklayer and both help with the education and nurturing of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Norma, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Mujeres del campo Ferial, se dedica a la venta de artesanías, chompas, chalinas, ponchos tejidos su negocio esta ubicando al costado de la plaza de armas de la ciudad de Huaraz en la feria artesanal, de la provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 , el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará adornos de cerámica, ponchos, chompas, chalecos para ofrecer s a sus clientes.

Ella tiene 38 años, tiene 2 hijas pequeñas , su esposo es albañil y ambos se apoyan en la educación y alimentación de sus hijos.

loans.use: With this loan she will buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 29 year old Aziza M.. She is married and has three children aged five, eight, and ten. In 2005, Aziza established her general store business. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA and now requires a new loan to purchase additional stock of rice, oil, flour, soap, and soft drinks. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk for her general store.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Nguyen Thi N., 37 years old, is the fourth-year member of TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam). When she first joined TYM, she just borrowed 50 USD because she wanted to get used to the weekly repayments policy. The profit she earned after the first year was not a whole lot, yet it helped her gain more confidence for the next loans. With Ms. N.'s cleverness, there is a significant increase in her family income. The loan is used more efficiently. Each month she earns about 100 USD from making sedge mats. With the savings from many years, she is able to build a new house. Ms. N. is very happy because TYM Fund helps her have a better life and her children are able to go to school. Now Ms. N. is thinking about breeding fish. Since the cost of food is increasing, she needs more money to buy good food for her fish. Thus, she would like to borrow 375 USD to buy breeding fish and fishfood.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Nguyệt, 37 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ Tình thương. Vòng vốn đầu chị chỉ dám vay 50USD để làm quen với việc hoàn trả tuần. Lợi nhuận thu về sau năm đầu tuy không nhiều nhưng giúp chị Nguyệt vững tin để vay các vòng tiếp theo. Nhờ biết tính toán làm ăn, kinh tế gia đình chị đã có những thay đổi rõ rệt, đồng vốn đầu tư mang lại hiệu quả cao. Thu nhập hàng tháng của chị Nguyệt từ đan chiếu khoảng 100USD. Qua nhiều năm tích góp chị Nguyệt đã làm được nhà mới. Chị rất vui mừng và phấn khởi vì nhờ tham gia Quỹ, kinh tế phát triển nên các con chị được tạo điều kiện ăn học đầy đủ hơn. Hiện nay chị Nguyệt đang có dự án nuôi cá. Giá thực phẩm đang tăng, muốn cá nuôi nhanh lớn thì phải có nguồn thức ăn tốt. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 375USD để mua cá giống và thức ăn.

loans.use: Buy fishes and food for them

loans.name: Seang

texts.en:
Miss. Seang S. , 60, is single and lives with her daughter (shown in the picture on the left), Mrs. Ty S., 41, who lives along National Road number two about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Mrs. Ty and her husband were married in 1988 and have two sons, who are in school. Thy has been a garment worker since 1990, while her husband is a mason.

Miss. Seang has been in the farming business since 1980. She grows rice and vegetables such as: morning glory, bean, cucumber, and tomatoes. She sells her produces at Ta Khmao market.
Now Seang is requesting a loan of US$1200 to purchase one motorcycle for her nephews drive to school and to buy one pumping machine to use in her farming business.

loans.use: To purchase one motorcycle and one pumping machine

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María Luisa began her business helping her husband and improving their quality of life. As he didn’t have a job, she helped him by beginning to sell tamales. She began her business in 2005 with the money she had saved and decided to invest in the ingredients to make tamales, and she began to sell them.

She needs a loan for US$250, which will be repaid in 3 months, to buy ingredients and be able to improve her sales and make her business successful. With your help she will be able to accomplish her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Maria Luisa inicio el negocio para ayudar a su pareja y mejora su estilo de vida, ya que el no tenia trabajo y para ayudarle ella empezo a vender tamales.Comenzo su negocio en el año 2005 con dinero que tenia ahorrado y decidio invertirlo en materia prima para la elaboracion de tamales y empezo a venderlos.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar materia prima y poder mejorar sus ventas y salir adelante. Con tu ayuda ella podra lograrlo.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make tamales

loans.name: Haydee Berta

texts.es:
Haydee is a member of the communal bank called "Alondras."

Haydee is separated from her husband. She's 37 years old. She has 2 kids and one in the way. Haydee used to go to the city of Chincha every week to purchase eggs, but now that she's expecting she can no longer travel long distances. She gets the eggs delivered to her and she sells them by foot at the local supermarket in the city of Ayacucho.

Aside from that, she sells bread, which she purchases at wholesale price from local bakeries, and sells it every weekend with the help of her daughter.

Haydee would like to use this loan to purchase eggs. Haydee dreams to own a home, to continue to work and move ahead, and to own a car to lease and make more money.

Translated by a Kiva Volunteer.

Haydee es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras.

Haydee es separada, tiene 37 años, 2 hijos y esta esperando a su tercer hijo, Haydee viajaba semanalmente a la ciudad de Chincha en donde compra huevos, pero debido a su estado ya no puede viajar y solamente le envían, sus ventas lo realiza ambulantemente en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Además Haydee los días sábados y domingos vende panes que compra de las panaderías por mayor, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hija.

Haydee necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de huevos. Haydee sueña con tener casa propia, seguir trabajando para salir adelante y tener un carro que le genere mayores ingresos.

loans.use: To purchase eggs

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata W. est une femme veuve agée de 56 ans. elle habite à la cité Senghor et s'active dans le commerce de tissus depuis cinq ans.
texts.en:
Aminata W. is a widow aged 56. She lives in the Senghor development and has been selling cloth for 5 years.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of cloth

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru: Махмадалиев Бахтиер житель Джилликульского района. Работает мясником на рынке Района. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот . Получив кредит он сможет купить еще одного бычка . Это поможет ему получить дополнительную прибыль и улучшить условия жизни семьи. Он женат и имеет четверых детей. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Bahtiyor M. lives in the Jillikuli region. He is married and has four children. Bahtiyor works as a butcher at the regional market. He wants to take out this loan in order to buy an additional calf and thus increase his future sales. This loan will help him get additional revenue and improve the living conditions of his family. Bahtiyor is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a calf

loans.name: Younis

texts.en:
A young man, Younis K. is 34 years old and married with three children. He owns a petrol pump in Jalalabad city. He lives in Khewa Nangrahar province and he is an educated man. He has agricultural land and grassland in his village.

He says, "If I can buy animals for our own home, I can solve some of my problems at home and on the agricultural land." For this, he has applied for a 50000AF ($1000 US) individual loan for 25 months from AFGS so he can buy animals. He says, "It is very good that I can buy animals for our home. Thanks, lenders of Kiva."

loans.use: To buy farm animals.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella J. sells beer and is requesting a loan to buying more stock. Stella is 28 years old and married. Her husband is a government worker. She has three children and they all go to school. With the extra profits generated from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more beer to sell.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Luisa tiene 26 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijo. Ella posee una pequeña fabrica de chipas y  la misma esta dedicada hace mas de 9 años, además de esta actividad también vende en su domicilio artículos de mercería, también ropa especialmente para dama, etc.
Con estas actividades consigue  generar ingresos, y así aportar para cubrir los gastos de la familia, por supuesto se siente muy satisfecho en ayudarle a su marido para hacer frente a los compromisos familiares. 
Los préstamos obtenidos de la Fundación Paraguaya, lo invirtió en la compra de mercaderías en cantidad como ser almidón, quesos, leñas, aceites entre otros productos.
El objetivo de la señora Luisa es la instar frente a su domicilio un puesto de venta de chipas durante esta temporada de festividades de la virgen de Caacupé, ya que en años anteriores le fue muy bien y  logro registrar muy buena venta de sus productos.
texts.en:
Luisa is 26 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She has owned a small chipa (local cheese cakes) factory for more than 9 years. She also sells notions items and clothes, especially bed sheets, etc. With all these activities she manages to make some income and cover her family expenses. She is very proud of being able to help her husband to fulfill the family obligations. She used the previous loans obtained from the Fundación Paraguaya to purchase supplies such as starch, cheese, firewood and oils among other products. Luisa’s purpose this time is to open a shop in front of the home to sell chipa during the festivities for the Caacupé Virgin, as business was very successful on previous years and she managed to sale a large amount of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies such as starch, milk, cheese, eggs, vegetal oil, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.ru: Гулямхусейнов Ибрагим житель города Турсун-Заде. Кассир группы "Хидоят". Возраст 44 года , женат и имеет пятерых детей. Занимается торговлей фруктами и овощами уже 8 лет. Планирует получить кредит и увеличить свой товарооборот. Погасить крелдит планирует в течение 10 месяцев. Ибрагим очень активный и профессиональный бизнесмен , но если он сможет получит кредит , он сможет развивать свой бизнес еще быстрее.
texts.en:
Ibrohim G. lives in the city of Tursun-Zade. He is a cashier for the company Hidoyat. He is 44 years old, married, and has five children. For the past 8 years he has worked selling fruits and vegetables. He decided to take out a loan to increase his sales volume. The loan will be repaid over 10 months. Ibrohim is an energetic and very professional businessman, but if he can obtain a loan he will be able to develop his business even faster.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long Y., 59, is a traditional midwife in the Prey Veng province. On average, she makes about USD $4 a day, while her husband operates a moto-taxi and also earns about USD $4 a day. They have three children who are all are in school. Mrs. Long Y. is asking for a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a moto-taxi business.

loans.use: To purcharse a motorbike.

loans.name: Jannat

texts.en:
Jannat is an enterprising woman. She is always happy to do good work. Even when she was young, she had a desire for self-improvement. For about ten years she has been in the cattle and sheep breeding business. This activity allows her to support her three children who are the reason for her hard work. All of her children are studying at school. She wants to increase her investment capital so she can keep supporting them. With your support Jannat will be able to buy new animals and expand her business. Let's support this mother’s proposal.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase more cattle in order to expand the business and improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La cliente se llama Maria Zara S. de 44 años. Vive con el Señor Luis Meireles de 51 años de edad que es su marido que se encuentran casados hace mas de 25 años.  Ellos poseen dos hijos en la cuales ya son mayores de edad y cada uno tiene su trabajo y se ayudan entre todos, pero aun viven con ellos, poseen casa propia en el Barrio Santa Rosa.

Cabe destacar que Maria es costurera hace mas de 22 años y es propietaria de un taller de costura ubicado en pleno centro de la ciudad. Cuenta con muchisimos clientes por que tiene excelente calidad de trabajo y realiza costura de ropa para Damas, Caballeros y Niños. Tiene cliente que trabaja con ella hace años. Cabe mencionar que su marido le ayuda en forma economica con los gastos de la casa por que trabaja como chofer particular.

El destino del credito de 2.500.000 es para la compra de una maquina de coser Overloc nueva para asi ir mejoranda la calidad de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Maria Zara S. is 44 years old. She lives with her husband of more than 25 years, Mr. Luis Meireles who is 51 years of age. They have two children whom are of age and still live at home, each child has his/her own job and they all help each other; they own a house in Barrio Santa Rosa. It is noteworthy that Maria has been a seamstress for more than 22 years and owns a sewing workshop located in the heart of the city. She has many clients because of her excellent quality of work; she sews clothing for women, men and children. She has many clients whom she has worked with for years. Her husband contributes to household expenses by working as a private driver. The purpose of the 2,500,000 loan is to purchase a sewing machine and an overlock sewing machine to improve her quality of her work.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en: Domingo T. is a resident of Brgy. Santiago Iligan City. He is 51 years of age, a widower with 4 children. He engages in the bicycle "pedicab" transport business. Every day he strives hard to provide support and care for his children. He has a high school and college student, and one child who is working who help him with their daily finances. He is applying for a loan with HSPFI, a Kiva partner, for maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.use: Maintenance for bicycle "pedicab"

location.town: Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de pagnes et de produits cosmétiques. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants, le commerce qu’elle exerce lui permet d’aider son mari dans les charges du foyer. Actuellement son stock de marchandises est épuisé, elle voudrait se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter  25 pièces de pagnes et des produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
This lady earns her living by selling "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth) and cosmetics. She is married and the mother of 3 children. Her business allows her to help her husband support the family. Presently, her stock of merchandise is sold out and she would like to replenish her stock. She is asking WAGES for her first loan to buy 25 lengths of "pagne" and some cosmetics.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes" and cosmetics for re-sale

loans.name: Umedullo

texts.en: M. Umedullo is a young clothing merchant from Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He started his small business when he was in his late 20’s and gradually, though much hard work, has been able to develop it into quite a successful enterprise. Umedullo has the qualities it takes to succeed as an entrepreneur. Goal-oriented, hard-working and punctual, he is a natural business man. Funding from IMON International has been instrumental in helping Umedullo build his business. His first loan was for $600 and since that time he has benefited from one additional loan while establishing a great credit history. He has now requested a loan of 6200 Somoni to add to his available working capital. The ability to purchase large quantities of inventory in bulk saves time and expense for merchants such as Umedullo. He would like to buy a supply of women’s and children’s clothing that will boost his inventory before the busy summer season. Umedullo appreciates the availability of funding through IMON International. It allows him to take advantage of good opportunities and focus on growing his business so that he is able to adequately provide for himself and his family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing in bulk

loans.name: Senada

texts.en: Senada S. was born in 1967, and comes from the suburban town of Tuzla. She is married and has one son who is at the university and one daughter in secondary school. Her husband has steady employment in a mine and earns almost enough to feed his family. Senada breeds poultry to supplement their income. Previously she raised poultry just for their own use, but now Senada has decided to purchase more chickens that she can sell, thus establishing a poultry business. Senada is requesting her first loan from the Kiva field partner, Women for Women International, and hopes to earn enough to support her son`s school costs at the university.

loans.use: To purchase poultry and chicken food

loans.name: Ena

texts.fr:
Cette femme s’est lancée dans le commerce de KAOLIN l’an dernier, elle exerce ce commerce dans le marché local d’adidogomé. Les femmes togolaises consomment le kaolin, étant la seule à exercer ce commerce dans son quartier, elle réalise de bonnes recettes tous les jours. Elle veut agrandir son stock et sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour acheter du Kaolin.
Elle  est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman began selling Kaolin (a kind of clay) last year. She does this in the local market of Adidogomé. Togolese women consume this clay, and since she is the only one to sell it in her neighborhood, she makes a good profit every day. She wants to expand her stock and is asking WAGES for a first loan to buy Kaolin.

She is married and the mother of 3 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing  KAOLIN (a type of clay)

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Мухаббат – женщина 39 лет, замужем и мать 2-х детей. Её муж занимается купле -продажей скота на скотном рынке. А она откармливает крупнорогатый скот дома. Мухаббат помогает мужу в развитии его бизнеса, потому что хочет иметь больше прибыли, чтобы расширять семью, так как в сельских местностях принято рожать больше 3-х детей.  За счет займа они хотят увеличить количество скота и  получить больше прибыли. Мухаббат просит новый займ для закупки 2-х бычков.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is a 39-year-old woman, who is married and is a mother of 2 children. Her husband is involved in buying and selling livestock at the livestock market. And she feeds cattle at home. Muhabbat helps her husband with developing his business because she wants to have bigger profits in order to expand their family. It is customary to have more than 3 children in rural areas. They want to use this loan to increase their livestock quantity and make bigger profits. Muhabbat is requesting a new loan to purchase 2 bulls.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two bulls

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida es socia del Banco Comunal Kusirikuy que significa Alegrate en quechua.
Nelida es casada, tiene 31 años y 4 hijos, Nelida junto a su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de maíz pelado (maíz que se pela con ceniza, se utiliza para la preparación de platos típicos), su producto lo comercializa a los mayoristas.
Nelida necesita un préstamo de 450 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Los sueños de Nelida son construir su casa y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
The name of Nelida’s Community Bank is Kusirikuy, which means be happy in Quechua. Nelida, 31, is married and has four children. Nelida and her husband work together making dried corn (corn that is dried with ashes and used to prepare typical dishes). They sell their product to wholesalers. Nelida needs a loan for 450 PEN to buy wood. Nelida’s dreams are to build her house and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Lara

texts.en: Lara Z. is from the village of Lurugan, Valencia City. She is 43 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Lara owns and operates a business running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Lara joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Lara is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 8th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre N. is 41 years old, is single, and he takes care of four dependents aged between 33 and 8.

Jean Pierre has been in a restaurant business for the past four years. He employs five people who work from 5:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m.

It is after a big desire of increasing his restaurant size and improving the quality of service, be it on food or buying some new restaurant materials, that Jean Pierre is requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company. 

By receiving and using this new loan, Jean Pierre hopes to get as many clients as possible and, after that, he hopes to earn enough profit to help him to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for his restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilisers and to hire help for the harvest.

loans.name: Lukaia

texts.en: Lukaia is 32 years old, a wife and mother of four kids. Three of them are currently in school. She operates a clothing shop and has been selling jeans, clothes, blouses, skirts, women's slippers, dressing bags and headscarves for the past eight years. Lukaia is constrained by funds to run the business. She needs the loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes that the loan will help her to be more resourced to purchase good quality and large quantity to upgrade her inventory. She wants to use the loan to purchase jeans, clothes, ladieswear, headscarves and slippers.

loans.use: To purchase jeans, clothes, ladieswear and slippers

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sabougnouma sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 36 ans et 3 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Massigui, sous préfecture de MASSIGUI, Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parentés. 
Elles font le commerce d’articles divers et la restauration. 
Ces femmes collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci d’avoir constamment un appui financier pour leurs activités. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Quant à l’utilisation du nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter des habillements pour hommes et femmes et une grande quantité de céréales pour la restauration. Le plus souvent, elles partent acheter les habits en gros à Bamako et à Fana,  les céréales sont achetées en détail aux environnants et sont revendus au marché de Massigui à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles estiment réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 37 500FCFA  par mois qui sera utilisé  dans la nourriture, la santé et dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group Sabougnouma are married women, on average they are 36 years old and each have an average of 3 children. With their husbands and children, they live in large, traditional families and are residents of the village of Massigui, in the subprefecture of Massigui, within the region of Koulikoro, in the Republic of Mali. They know each other through neighborhood and familial connections. Their business is selling varied items and catering. These women have worked with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in order to have consistent financial support for their business actvities. They are on their third group loan and all of their previous loans have been properly repaid. They will use this loan to purchase clothes for men and women, as well as a large quantity of grains/ cereals for their food business. Usually they buy their clothes at wholesale prices from Bamako and in Fana, they purchase the grains from the surrounding areas and will resell these products in the market of Massigui to a clientele composed of men and women. They estimate that with will each earn an average monthly income of 37,500FCFA, which they will use to purchase food, for their health and their business.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of items

loans.name: Alice

texts.pt:
Alice da Conceição M. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província capital de Moçambique, tem 35 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 3 filhos de 17, 14, 10 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 7ª classe, parou devido a Gravidez precoce. Vive na casa própria com a sua família em Boane no bairro 5, não sustenta mais ninguém. 

Saiu da Matola para Boane, em 2008 com a sua família após a conclusão da sua obra em Boane. Tem um negócio próprio a 2 anos, vende mais frangos que compra o pinto a 19.00mt e vende o frango a 95.00mt, tem 2 trabalhadores e trabalha das 9h, as 14h. O seu rendimento mensal é de cerca de 5.000.00mt, com o qual sustenta a família e poupa através do sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa (Xitique).

Nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus vizinhos. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 11.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar (pintos e ração) para aumentar a quantidade de frangos e responder a demanda do produto na quadra festiva que se avizinha.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente este crédito para poder aceder a mais empréstimos. No futuro pretende comprar uma viatura que ira lhe ajudar no transporte de sua mercadoria.
texts.en:
Alice da Conceição M. was born in the city of Maputo, the capital of Mozambique. She is 35; married; and the mother of 3 children who are 17, 14, and 10. All of them go to school. She studied only through the 7th grade and stopped due to an untimely pregnancy. She lives in her own home with her family in neighborhood 5 in Boane. She doesn't support anyone besides her family. She left for Matola for Boane in 2008 with her family and built her home in Boane. She has had her own business for 2 years and buys and sells chickens. She buys chicks for 19 meticais and sells the chickens for 95 meticais. She has 2 workers, and she works from 9 am.-2 p.m. Her monthly income is around 5,000 meticais, with which she supports her family and saves some via a tradtional rotating savings system known as Xitique. She has never had a loan with another bank. She became familiar with Hluvuku through her neighbors. This is her first loan and it is for 11,000 meticais. She will use it to buy chicks and feed to increase her quantity of chickens and respond to the demand for her product during the holiday season that is approaching. She promises to pay back this credit on time so she will be able to receive more loans. In the future, she hopes to buy vehicle that will help her transport her merchandise.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise chickens

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazaret”, en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Tiene 37 años, es viuda, tiene 4 hijos (3 varones y 1 mujer) y tiene estudios primarios incompletos(quinto de primaria).

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. hace 2 años y se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.
Su primer préstamo fuè de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles con los que compró 2 ovinos. Paralelo a ello también realiza actividades agrícolas para autoconsumo.

Ella solicitará el monto de S/. 1,700.00 Nuevos Soles con lo que comprará 1 toro para engordarlo en 3 meses y luego venderlo en la feria de ganado;indica a su vez que tiene forraje para engordarlo y que además serán meses de verde y habrá pasto.

Indica que en su  Banco Comunal se olvida de sus preocupaciones.

Su anhelo es que sus hijos sean mejores que ella y que su negocio siga prosperando.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the "Jesús de Nazaret" Community Bank in the Ilave district, province of El Collao, in the Puno district. Aged 37, she is a widow with 4 children (3 boys and 1 girl). She has completed 5th grade primary education. She has been a member of the Manuela R. Movement for 2 years, and she is in the business of buying and selling livestock. Her first loan, for $105, enabled her to buy 2 sheep. She also grows her own food. Rosa will use this $600 loan to buy a bull, fatten it for three months and then sell it at the livestock fair; she has the hay needed to fatten it, and it will be in the growing months, so there will be pasture. The Community Bank enables her to forget about her worries. Her dream is for her children to have a better life than she has had, and to continue expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a bull

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer S. is from the village of Puntod Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old. Jenifer is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Jenifer owns & operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from raising fish for sale. Jenifer has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Jenifer joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenifer is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jenifer from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to buy food for her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Saodatkhon

texts.ru: Бобиева Саодатхон проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст, 37 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Имеет среднее техническое образование. Бобиева Саодатхон работает более чем 6 лет в области торговли. Она покупает вещи и продает в своей торговой точке. Кредит берет на увеличение товараоборота.
texts.en:
Saodatkhon B. lives in the Khroson region. She's thirty-seven, married with four children, and has a secondary technical education. She's been a vendor for over six years, buying merchandise and reselling it from her own stand. She plans to use her loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Confidence Sisters Group

texts.en:
This group of entrepreneurs named their group 'Confidence Sisters'. They are petty traders from the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 each from SMT/Kiva lenders for the very first time in order to enable them to expand their businesses.

The leader of this group of 5 is Ejatu S.. The 40-year-old Ejatu is married to a businessman and they have 5 children – 2 in primary school, 2 in secondary school and 1 in nursery school. Ejatu has over 10 years of experience in the business world. She sells items such as soaps, toothpaste, batteries, biscuits, sugar, and many more. With this loan, she will buy more of these items wholesale to add to her current ones. (Beneath the photo are snapshots of two group members who were not present for the group photo.)

loans.use: Buy soaps, toothpaste, batteries, biscuits, sugar, and many more items

loans.name: G.s El Arca De Noe Ii Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Arca De Noé II está conformado por Petrona y Maria Gerarda. Ambas se dedican a la venta de granos básicos. Petrona tiene 12 años que se dedica a este negocio, y lo realiza en su vivienda, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo es por eso que no quiere dejar de trabajar pues tiene que sacar adelante a sus hijos. Y su amiga Gerarda se dedica a lo mismo la venta de granos básicos, ya que con la ayuda de ella hizo posible, por salir adelante con su hijo porque su esta actividad  le proporciono lo necesario. Por lo que el motivo de su financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que servirá para la compra de cada uno de sus productos.
texts.en:
The Cooperative Group Noah’s Arc II, is comprised of Petrona and Maria Gerarda. Both sell basic grains. Petrona has worked in this business for some 12 years and she does it in her home, she has 2 children who she takes care of and it’s because of them that she does not want to stop working since she has to give her children a good start in life. Her friend, Gerarda sells the same things, basic grains, and with her friend’s help she has her own business, she does her best to give her son the opportunity to get ahead in life because this activity allows her to do so. The loan will be used as work capital to buy each of their products.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes K. is currently in the business of selling charcoal in the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Agnes is 48 years old and is married to a soldier. She has three children, and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Herminia Agostinho

texts.pt:
Hermínia Agostinho S. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 28 anos de idade viúva e mãe de 2 filhos de 10 e 3 anos de idade, o mais velho vai a escola. Fez somente 6ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e sustenta ainda sua irmã que vive com ela.
Nunca saiu da sua cidade natal, estudou e casou se na Matola. Tem um negócio próprio nesta zona há mais de 10 anos, não possui nenhum empregado. Vende mais colares de ouro, fatos para homens e roupa para crianças, neste negócio consegue um rendimento de cerca de 8.000.00mt a 10.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de u ma amiga que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar produtos (fatos para homens, colares de ouro, roupa para crianças e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. O empréstimo anterior foi de 10.000.00mt, para a mesma actividade.
Compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aquisição de uma viatura para ajudar no transporte da sua mercadoria.
texts.en:
Hermínia Agostinho S. was born in Matola, Maputo Province, south of Mozambique. She is a 28 year old widow and the mother of two children ages 10 and 3, the first one goes to school. She finished 6th grade but had to drop school for financial difficulties. She lives in her own house with her children and also supports a sister that lives with them. She never left her hometown, went to school and got married in Matola. She has her own business in the area for the past 10 years, and has no employees. She sells gold chains, men's suits and children's clothing, and makes between U$280 and U$350 per month, which she uses to support her household and save some. She's never asked for a loan with other agencies and heard of Hluvuku through a friend. This is her second loan with Hluvuku and she's asking for U$475 in order to buy more merchandise to improve her business. Her previous loan was for U$350 for the same purpose. She's committed to pay it back on time so she can ask for other loans. In the future she would like to get another loan to buy a car to help with her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing for reselling

loans.name: Modi

texts.en: Modi J. is currently in the business of selling beans and pulses (e.g. groundnuts, peas, cowpeas) and is requesting a loan to stock rice and maize flour to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot and build a permanent house to let. Modi is 37 years old and is married to a soldier. She has six children and her children go to school. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock rice and maize flour to sell
